description:
Good food, good service

Noticing less onions which is good
Didn't like seeing the manager temp the food and wipe it off with the same napkin
K would suggest alcohol wipes after it temp
author: J K.

description:
Super fast and efficient. I went at 12pm, right at the starting lunch peak time, and stood all the way at the other side but still only took like 10 min. 

I feel like they do give smaller portions and I had to ask a few times for them to add more. Sometimes they move so fast that I have to go back and tell them. Overall, very efficient but they should give full portions of each item.
author: Rose C.

description:
I had gone into Chipotle for a sofritos bowl which is their soy protein based burrito bowl. Something in the bowl ended up stabbing me between the front two teeth and inside my gums. I was able to extract it but it concerned me since I didn't understand how, what I thought was maybe a splinter of bone, got into the soy based protein and then into my gums. Since I eat Chipotle at least once a week from this location and haven't had issues before, I decided I was going to try to just get past it, go in tell them about my experience and ask for a free Bowl in replacement. Due to location issues such as a fire and a gas problem, this Chipotle hasn't been open when I tried to go back in earlier this week and talk to them.
 
Today I managed to get in there and talk to the manager about it but got very strange attitude. I was told that I should have "contacted corporate", that it was strange that I ended up with a bone in my soy burrito bowl, and that they were only closed for half a day, all of this in a semi accusatory tone and generally I didn't feel believed.  After what felt like five minutes of arguing (that I never should have had to engage in as a customer) the manager handed me a card for a free meal and then walked off.  No, I didn't save the shard that stabbed me but I was worried about taking real damage and when I got it out I threw it away in disgust.

I felt like I was being treated like somebody scamming for food when the staff in there know me. I get that mistakes happen, and I really just wanted to get past it, but dealing with that manager today made it very difficult to move past and now I don't really want to ever go back.
author: Steve G.

description: So I needed something cheaper and healthier to eat after visiting Crunch New Montgomery for the first time today. And I must say I got sick in the digestive system after, so that's why it gets 3 stars instead of 4 stars. Chipotle is better than The Bird, but it makes me sick digestively sometimes. And it was like 9-10$ for the damn food. So we will conclude that I shouldn't eat Chipotle very much and that I am giving my digestive system a whirl.
author: Denise C.

description: This is by far the worst chipotle I have been to. The place is disgustingly dirty, the veggies and food are burnt, the employees are not trained on how to make the food and deal with customers. This location needs a ton of work on all aspects. I couldn't get a photo but the veggie pan/wok that they cook in has layers of burnt charged old veggies and hasn't been cleaned in months. This place will make you sick. The employees just laugh it off and don't seem to care.
author: Charley M.

description: Inadequate proportion in comparison to other locations. So I ordered a burrito bowl, and the server started giving me just a tiny potion of white rice. Then when it came to the meat and condiment sections, the portions were worse than the white rice. I wished I knew about this, I would just go to The Bird.
author: Anton B.

description:
Chipotle is predictable, which is one of the reasons I like it. It's not really Mexican food, it's just a quick tasty burrito with fresh ingredients. The location on New Montgomery is absolutely slammed at lunch time. The line wraps around the store, but they are typically very quick about moving people along. 

I've had 3 and 4 star experiences here, but I hesitate to give 4 stars because the consistency is lacking. The things I care about are simple. Get the order right, and a nice balance of ingredients. I don't like when they over or under stuff for any of the ingredients.  

My latest trip near dinner time was a 4 star experience, however the location was not busy and I was able to get decent service and a nice burrito. The things I care about are simple. Get the order right, and a nice balance of ingredients. I don't like when they over or under stuff for any of the ingredients. 

My previous visit was certainly 3 stars as I was left with a small sad burrito for lunch and was disappointed with how quick they rushed things along. I know everyone is in a hurry, but properly cook the tortilla and make sure you add enough ingredients to each burrito. It only takes an extra 5 seconds. Everyone will be happier. I'll keep going, but will choose other places for lunch.
author: John W.

description:
I'll admit it, I have been coming here a lot ever since I started this low carb diet. It's predictable, and I need that for my diet, Chipotle is just a safe bet, and its tasty.   

Regarding this location:
The line can get very long starting around 12:10PM. If your going for lunch, I would recommend going just before noon, or exactly at noon. 10 minutes later and you will be too late, stuck at the back a line that seems to snake around the inside of the store.

The employees there are usually very friendly to me, after all, they see me nearly every day M-F. I have never had a problem with the quality of the ingredients, nor have I ever gotten sick here. Sometimes sure, I wish I had a little more meat in the Salad bowl.. don't we all, but thats life.
author: Bryan M.

description:
I really should be more proud of the fact that I enjoy Chipotle so much. Not only is it keto-friendly, they pile on the good stuff. My go-to keto bowl is a salad with steak or chicken, veggies (fajita peppers and onions), pico de gallo, cheese, sour cream and guacamole. The difference between the salad and a burrito bowl is that with the salad, the lettuce lays at the bottom of the bowl and with the burrito bowl, the lettuce covers the top. Meh, to-may-to to-mah-to.

I had to dock a star because it gets pretty pricey when you add a dollop of guac. 

For the kids, they like to order the cheese quesadilla kids tray with rice, beans, and chips.
author: Michele A.

description: there food is not the greatest but its okay. When ordering online or in person they need  to make sure to include the dressing for salads and the chili sauces ordered. It is very inconvenient when you have to go back. This seems to happen a lot from Downtown Phoenix location. City Scape
author: Christine A.

description:
My go to place for lunch on the way to work. Service is quick& friendly. If there's a line it usually moves fast. 

Only thing is, sometimes when I get chips on the side, they can be stale. Other than that everything else is good!
author: Ashley J.

description:
Well, well, well.  Amid the drop in stock prices and the lawsuit from its investors, I am NOT surprised Chipotle is having trouble yet again with their food.

I've been to this location a few times, but my recent experience (about 3 weeks ago) will tell me not to trust this fast food chain again.  I got food poisoning here, and I know it was this "quality" food that gave it to me because I didn't eat anything else that day.  My usual order is: crispy tacos or a salad, with brown rice, chicken, mild salsa, corn, sour cream, cheese, and loads of lettuce!  This last time, I think it was the brown rice that did the poisoning.  

I went with my coworkers, and everyone else had ordered white rice except for me!  Sadly, I learned that old brown rice that has been sitting for a while in the bin can lead to stomach-destroying bacteria that leads to food poisoning.  This is most likely what happened.

I am very very sad to say that after a couple years of Chipotle abstinence, due to the e.coli scandal, I mustered up that courage to try it again.  I'm writing this review a couple of weeks after the fact because ever since that day I ate chipotle, I haven't really been feeling well.  And, after all the chances I gave Chipotle, I'm certain this will be my last visit with you guys.  Good luck surviving!
author: Jana L.

description:
Chipotle is not fancy or anything special, but having said that, it's probably the best fast food chain around that accommodates vegans.

I'm a big fan of the sofritas (which is a tofu protein option) bowl with black beans, brown rice, lettuce, medium sauce and guacamole (if I feel like splashing out the extra two bucks). It's a decently size portion, easy to scoff down in a hurry and seems pretty healthy (for fast food). As a vegetarian/vegan, you can also choose the sautéed veg as your "protein" instead of sofritas which is a great alternative if you visit frequently.

Also, although the guac is extra, you usually get a hefty amount (and if you ask, the staff usually add more). Thumbs up!

That said, there a bunch of things Chipotle could do better, which is why I'm giving 3 stars. First of all, they could hire someone that knows how to roll burritos! For a city that seems to have so many taquerias, Chipotle really don't know how to build a basic burrito (I think this is because they put too much food in it)! The tortilla chips always seem to bit a stale or greasy and I've yet to be impressed by them.

This Chipotle gets super busy during rush hour but I find that the queue moves quickly considering the size. And since the bowl/burrito prep is speedy, I don't think it's a big downside. (I usually get my food quicker than when I go to Ayola next door)
author: Michael C.

description:
If it's after 7 pm and I'm not already on the other side of the bridge, chances are pretty high that this is dinner. This week Donald H. asked me where I wanted to go to out (date night status), and I still picked Chipotle. Sometimes you just know where your priorities are!

If you come here during lunch, you've made a mistake. Line out the door, harried workers, small portions, boo. Come here around 2-8 pm, and you've got no line, friendly folks at the counter, monster servings...you get the idea. 

For an $8-$10 dinner in SOMA, this is probably one of your best options, especially if you're looking for a place later than 7 pm.

Pro tip: Ask for peppers/onion AND a protein - they'll usually give you full servings of both. Same goes for ordering all the salsas. 

Grab their new rewards card if you're a frequent burrito eater or if you're looking beyond PokemonGo to fuel your competitive side.
author: Laura B.

description:
If I make it to 3pm without eating lunch, and I haven't fainted or died, I inevitably end up at Chipotle. Is it delicious? Yes. Do I hate myself afterwards? Yes. 

Self-hate aside, I'm thankful to have this Chipotle by my office for those very late lunches, and appreciate the smiling friendly employees who do not judge when I ask for extra cheese and sour cream. 

Plus stars for convenience, tastiness and reasonable price point. 

Minus star for the fact that I feel terrible. every. single. time.
author: Connie S.

description:
I appreciate that your can customize your order at Chipotle, that it's affordable, and that they strive to provide organic/well sourced ingredients - when possible on their menu.

There was no line when I stopped in here recently. The service was personable and quick. The carnitas was both moist and flavorful. The romaine lettuce was fresh and their red salsa was spicy. Their corn salsa added a beautiful crunch to the salad, and the guacamole was the perfect accompaniment to bring it all together.

I definitely ingested my fair share of salt with the above meal and needed a couple of glasses of water following it.

I'll be back.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I had a "Burrito Buck" card that I had received for a bad experience. The lady at the counter told me that it was expired and that they used to accept those but don't anymore. I asked another Chipotle and they said that was a lie. Why lie about something so trivial? 

Food was good, place was clean, and everything else ran quick. Would typically leave 5 stars. Not today :/
author: Paul S.

description: Nothing special about this location, just close to my office.  Occasionally I'll come here to grab lunch, but I don't find myself walking there with a smile on my face.  Can't really judge a chain fast food restaurant on anything other than service and portions.  Service was good, but the portions are small (as expected).  I hate having to ask for more because I feel they short-changed me.  I was able to finish my bowl, with everything in under 3 minutes.  I'm not a fast eater, so this shows something about portions.
author: Justin Y.

description:
I'm a fan of Chipotle, especially armed with Thrillist's collection of chefs' favorite orders:

https://www.thrillist.com/amphtml/eat/nation/best-things-to-get-at-chipotle-chefs-favorite-orders

This SoMa location is convenient and serves quickly, but it all comes down to the staff's skill in stuffing and rolling burritos. They're not shy about the amount of fillin's they give ya here....and the wrap up job is accordingly challenged. 

Aesthetics? Not so hot 
Quantity? Bumper!!
Net: I can't eat the whole thing anyway, less would be more for me.
author: Lanny B.

description:
I am personally a huge fan of chipotle. I get the same thing every time because it's bomb but it's taken me a while to perfect it. Burrito bowl with brown rice, both beans, chicken. Mild salsa, corn and cheese. I don't like the lettuce because it usually tastes bitter and is wilted. The salad dressing is bomb and sometimes I get that also.

This location is very convenient if you work downtown.
author: Jenna G.

description:
If I had a dollar for every time my burrito needs to be re-rolled, double-tortilla'd, or wrapped in more tin foil, making rent would not be an issue. 

If you can't talk and roll a burrito at the same time, stop talking and roll the burrito.
author: Cody R.

description:
It's chipotle. there's really not a whole lot to say. Service is fast and the employees are coo. but DAMN IT IS NOT WORTH THE ENDLESS STREAM
OF DIARRHEA THAT IVE HAD FOR THE LAST 24 HOURS WTF GUYS?! i will always love chipotle, but my butthole certainly does not.
author: Jacob D.

description: "Oh my god, I love Chipotle" is what I used I think when I came to Chipotle but then I had more authentic Mexican food in the Mission and wondered what I was doing. It's tasty and good for a quick fix (since it's right beside work!) (and except during the lunch rush) but I know I can do so much better. But sometimes laziness just has to have it's way. My preferred meal is a carnitas or chorizo burrito bowl. (Pro tip: always ask for more of everything to get more bang for your buck)
author: Kevin N.

description: My muse. My love. The one who's always there when I need it. Lunch or for dinner. Doesn't matter what time it is, what day it is, you are perfectly the same and never ever change. Except get the queso out of here. Whether in New York or San Francisco, I get my chicken bowl and it is exactly what I remember it being and that's how I like it. As a food aficionado, I agree that this does not compare to a real burrito in the Mission. I don't consider it Mexican food but highly support Chipotle being its own food category. It's the spot next to work (wherever you work) where you can grab a meal in 5 minutes (timed right - either before 12 or order through their app) and know it's going to be exactly what you thought it was going to be. No surprises and perfect.
author: Kyle R.

description:
Chipotle is the definition of A-OK to me. Some people were a little scared after the e. coli situation but that didn't put me off.

Living in San Francisco, there are countless other better burrito places available, but sometimes you just want a nice, quick, and safe burrito. I prefer the burrito bowls from here, and like the fact that Chipotle allows you to go half and half on the different toppings. Charging extra for guacamole though is definitely a negative in my book.

The lunch lines are crazy long, but that's just the standard for SOMA lunches. I always time it so that I end up here just after 1 PM when the line is tiny, and I can get in and out very quickly. Staff are always courteous.
author: Rajeev S.

description:
Very kind workers. I, personally, love chipotle - especially when they come out with a fresh batch of white rice and steak.

Bathroom code for men is 3916
author: Austin G.

description: I came to this chain for lunch expecting the same consistent quality I've experienced at other Chipotle's. Unfortunately, this one missed the mark. They give less meat than other branches I've been too. The chicken is tough and dry. The beans and fajitas are overcooked and mushy. And they rush you along so you don't really have a chance to tell them if you want just a little more or less of something. So quality, quantity and service are all worse here than at other Chipotles.
author: Katherine Y.

description:
shoutout to Katie (kitchen staff) for trying and helping. I came in 5 mins before closing and coughing. bought a guacamole just so i could ask for some hot water. they dont have any. but katie offered to boil some. i was very happy she offered that. although eventually we found out she couldnt give the boiled hot water to me because the restaurant is liable for whatever happens and they dont have container for hot water serving. Still, i appreciate the attempt and offer to help. hence 5 star.

and the guacamole was good. smooth.
author: S W.

description: Usually CMG is reasonably good.  Went early and noticed that they used meat left over from the night before.  Skimpy, DRY and just mediocre at best.  DO NOT GO EARLY if you want fresh food.  This is the Peabody MA store.  Employees didn't want to be there.  Oh yeah, expensive for mediocre food.  Could get better at Burger King or McD's.
author: Larry B.

description:
Stop in here once a week or so for a burrito. 

Super fast service that keeps the line moving.

Good customer service.

Always well stocked and food is fresh. 

Pro tip - arrive by 1130 for lunch to avoid the crazy long line that wraps around the store.
author: Melissa H.

description: Their portions are a joke!!!! Im not returning back to this location anymore. They always give half portion. Too cheap!!! I paid $8.75 for half portion veggie bowl, they literally threw a spoon of guacamole in there. I was very disappointed!!!
author: Zafar A.

description: I love taking my kids and my family to Chipotle and having Mexican food, it has become one of those things we look forward to doing every week. It doesn't hurt either that the prices are really reasonable for any budget. We especially love the variety when it comes to their burrito bowls and the corn and lettuce included in it. They always make it extra special. We have also had take out from this place and they're always certain to pack everything well for the trip. If you're looking for a neat little experience with fast service then Chipotle is the place to be. I assure you that you won't go wrong.
author: Paul J.

description:
The burrito bowl is delicious. Chipotle is definitely a quick grub spot for me. I do like how I am able to customize the item I chose. In addition to the burrito, there's the burrito bowl available. It's the usual ingredients placed on and wrapped up in a tortilla for the burrito. Invention of the burrito bowl is a genius creation.

- Friendly staff team
- Good food
- Good service
- Clean facility

Payment Method:
Cash / Credit / Debit accepted
author: Bennett W.

description: The staff is so rude not accommodating at all.The food is good but the staff is bad.This was my second time here and treated both the times rude by the staff in the counters.Even seven eleven staff treats you better.
author: Abhishek P.

description:
I've had better burritos from non-descript food trucks. I had a chile verde burrito and it was large and nearly flavorless. It had no sauce, too much rice and wasn't even rolled all the way around so that the insides fell out once the foil was unwrapped. Veggie salad was ok, nothing special.
Both for$24-overpriced and underwhelming.
author: Christopher E.

description:
This Chipotle would make Henry Ford proud. An efficient team that somehow manages to keep the 10-person-minimum line always moving during the lunch rush. The upside of this is that even with the menacing looking line, you'll get your meal in no time. The downside is that they WILL definitely skimp on something, whether it be your beans, rice, or (as it happened to me) the meat you asked for. 

As for the food? Chipotle is Chipotle - have it once and you've had it anywhere. It'll fill you up, but don't expect the most life altering burrito you've ever had (and definitely go for the bowls, they generally pack more in there than the burritos).
author: Sameer C.

description:
Much like your average Chipotle, but with one downside and one upside. 

Downside: Line gets craaazy long at lunch

Upside: The staff are incredibly efficient and the friendliest ever!
author: Clay P.

description: Used them to cater a for intern meeting.  A couple things were wrong with the order but I believe our events crew upped the order because we had a higher turn out. It is an easy way to feed a lot of people on a budget, and the interns ate through much of the food. The buffet set up looked tasty with a lot of variety.   I walk by all the time and this location is popular, and the lines seem to move during rush times.
author: Sam M.

description: Reading some of the reviews, this chipotle does give you less than others. Even tho I asked for almost everything, my plate was not full. Normally I'm never able to finish my burrito bowl but I did today. The 2 staff that was making my plate did not even smile. Only good thing about my visit was the person next to the cashier. She smiled and offer to give me a tray because I had a few things. The taste of the food is just like any other chipotle. It just the trick.
author: Sandy B.

description:
CheePotLay or CheePottle? Well that was my first time hearing the word. The answer is CheePotLay. 

What's nice is that they have brown rice. Their grilled chicken is great and you can mix it too! The hot is not hot (for me) and Guac on the side is better to if you put it in the bowl (you get more in the separate container) - and they're expensive...

Chips are salty, so don't be surprise to eat a lot of them (mix with salsa or guac - amazing)

Tip: During the night before they close, they usually give you more portions, and you can ask for the burrito wrap Tortilla along with your bowl for free (anytime for this one).
author: Kevin L.

description: one star for veggie consisting of just onions and bell peppers. two stars for charging extra for guac. three stars for being a giant boring chain. four stars for chicken burrito taste. five stars for proximity to SFMOMA. overall? average.
author: Ronny K.

description: Ordered the salad bowl and they literally gave me 10-12 slices of lettuce. I had to practically beg them twice to add more lettuce in order to make it look like a salad. Craziest part is the server had to ask the supervisor if they can give me more lettuce after she gave me the 12 pieces of sliced lettuce.
author: Eric C.

description:
The portion sizes get smaller and smaller each time I come.  I had thought Chipotle would try harder after all of the bad publicity from the health scares...but not the case.  I guess this is their way to address the issue by reducing the volume it is easier to do quality control.  

I am done with Chipotle.  Food and environment is the same but prices and portion sizes headed in the wrong direction.
author: Roy L.

description:
Thank you for slopping together a bunch of ingredients with 0 enthusiasm and 0 customer service.   Not one person looked at my as I went down the line placing my order.

I appreciate how you added extra water to the beans so that my burrito bowl, so once packaged for carry out, it dripped through the paper bag and all down my new dress and then onto my legs.   Nothing like spending the rest of my day at work drenched in bean slop.
author: Kate R.

description:
Chipotle is pretty much the fastest, easiest lunch I can get. While the line gets crazy long during the rush hour, it moves pretty quickly, and the staff always seem to be un-fazed by the never-ending parade of hungry hungry people in need of lunch.

I use the app most of the time when I go here to order ahead, pick from one or two favorites, (sofritas, ftw!), and dart to the lonely cash register on the far side of the line. I'm always in and out in just a few minutes, and can't complain.

Food is fresh, consistent, lunch.
author: Jenni S.

description:
Man this place is great. A 1000 kcal meal for under $10. That's something you don't see often in San Fran.

The chips used to be better though. They're the best when they have lots of lime juice on them.
author: Maxwell M.

description:
If you're into this contemporary style of burrito, you won't be disappointed with chipotle. The food taste is also very consistent throughout the chain, which is great as always, except the portions slightly differ depending on location. This one seems to be moderate/fair in their portions. While I typically wait longer for my food at this busy location than other locations. I have to say, by far this team is the quickest I've seen. It's incredible to see how many people they serve, so quickly, compared to other locations where they lose rhythm much quicker and with far fewer customers. 
The food is always being freshly cooked and prepared. No matter how many hundreds of people hit this location during the lunch hours, this location is always clean, and fully stocked with napkins, forks, etc. it's really impressive.
author: Faldo R.

description: I ordered 2 tacos. I selected soft flour tortillas cause some told me soft flour were more delicious than soft corn. I chose chicken and carnitas filled in the tacos separately with roasted chili-corn salsa, tomatillo red-chili salsa, sour cream, cheese and guacamole inside. They are delicious.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Chipotle! I probably come here for dinner three or more times a week after work, and I've tried almost everything. The chicken is alright, but the carnitas and steak are delicious. The crispy tacos here are a hidden gem, they're delicious. You can also apparently get margaritas here, who knew! I've never done it (there are too many actual bars near here to justify that) but hey, don't let that stop you.

This Chipotle is really packed for lunch, but the dinner line always moves quickly and has fresh ingredients. Another important note: they do have a restroom available, unlike many of the other places on New Montgomery. The people here are really nice too, come check it out!
author: Nikhil S.

description: I LOVE CHIPOTLE BUT, this is probably the worst one I've been to... honestly it was very bland and very different from the ones I'm used to. Had a coupon and wish I didn't use it here. The people are rude and I've been to chipotle all over California. Won't ever come here again but one star for feeding me and one star for the beer.
author: Gisell R.

description:
Knowing that it is one of the chains that serves Mexican food in the States, I actually lowered my expectation during my first visit, which was suggested by Michelle during our CM week. Not hating any chains here, but I just didn't want to get disappointed.

However, burritos still win my heart. In Malaysia, it isn't easy to find good Mexican food and you would not see Mexican chains around. So, when I was at Chipotle, feeling hungry during lunch time, I literally and happily gulped down the big burrito. Without an expectation that's too high, the steak that's wrapped within was actually better than I thought it'd be. What can I say? Burritos make a happy Alexander.

I actually visited this place twice during that trip to SF - I just couldn't get enough of Mexican food. For dinner the second time, I ordered a bowl with Carnitas - equally good and I do love the meat that they use. However, I didn't get to try their chips and I was almost deadly craving for those with Guac - be there earlier I guess if you want some of that. 

The queue there during lunch and dinner hours are usually quite long, but don't be deceived as the line moves really quick. So, definitely still suitable if you need to grab a quick bite.
author: Alexander Kim Wooi L.

description:
Um, probably the smallest burrito I've ever had at a Chipotle. It looked less like a burrito and more like a taquito or something. Even the guy in front of me mentioned the smallness of his portion and the girl argued with him. Definitely don't think I got my money's worth.

Gave it an extra star due to its proximity to my next destination, but that's not really any doing of its own, is it?
author: Eric K.

description: In general I like chipotle but this time it wasn't a good experience. The rice was not cooked properly and I got a bad feeling in stomach.
author: Yazdan S.

description: It's great they invented the fast prepared food category. It's perfect for a workday lunch when I don't have too much time. Their assembly line is also impressive. Even when the line seems long, I can still get my food in about 5 minutes or under. My secret is to get just 2 tacos. Enough to get by for the day without getting the food coma, not what you want during work. It also costs less. Under $6 I think.
author: Joseph L.

description: The whole point of asking for double chicken is to have a lot more meat than usual.  Why would you serve me 2 half scoops of chicken?  Skimping out this time really made me consider not coming back at all.  Chipotle should just have a scale for their chicken/beef/pork so I can't complain about inconsistencies between burritos.
author: Charles L.

description: I know I know. Chipotle had a problem with their food. But after their problem, the long lines disappeared and I've been taking advantage of that. I no longer have to wait. I don't feel like the quality of the food changed. It is still pretty Damn good. I've kept going to this location because it is close to my house and will continue to do so.
author: Alvin The Chipmun K.

description: I really like chipotle and this store does everything right about it!! the food quality is fresh and the line moves quite rapidly because the workers are quite efficient! The workers are also super generous and gave me a big portion without me having to ask them to put extra rice or beans.
author: Jason X.

description:
Cramped. Kind of dirty. Long lines. I eat here 3 times a week. The food is awesome. 

The guilt you feel about not walking one block further to some authentic joint is far out matched by the comfortable, décolletage of that half chicken half steak burrito.
author: Devon L.

description:
Seems to be a Chipotle on every block in this area of SF.  Not a bad thing though!  Sometimes you just crave some fake Mexican food!

I got a steak bowl.  They're really weak with their portions.  Gave me so little rice and so little meat.  Then they just pile the other stuff to make it seem full.  I'd rather have more meat and rice than, I don't know, lettuce.  If I wanted lettuce, I'd go for a salad.  That's just me though.

Small place, but it's there and it's Chipotle.
author: Sedine S.

description: Small portion, hefty price. I know y'all are getting sued left and right but cmon, the loyals came back and now you're skimping on the portions? That's a fast way to lose customer base. I guess less customers means less chance of being sued? Guess no more Chipotle for me.
author: A o S.

description:
Reviewing this exact Chipotle:

1. Zero Enthusiasm up until you reach checkout -1  (thank you kind girl at the register!) 
2. Throwing corn on my order w/o listening to what I'm actually saying -1
3. Who the heck burned all the chicken?!?!  -1

Kinda bummed I spent $9.95 on a Chicken... correction Chicken Jerky burrito today.
author: Katrina L.

description:
The food I would give 3 star.. but customer service like .5 star. This is the second time that i come and honestly i feel like walking away at the cash register and getting food somewhere else..
I know this is fast food but damn it doesn't mean you can't crack half a smile.
They seem so annoyed by customers presence that they just want to shove you out of there faces. Food server practically rolled her eyes when i asked for a tortilla on the side. Neither the server or cashier were approachable one bit.
I understand IF they were slammed or even somewhat busy but there was only one person behind me in line. Inexcusable.

Its not worth it. 
Dirty eating area - small portions - rude service.
Spend an extra buck and go somewhere else.
author: Lupita R.

description: Stingy af with everything even the veggies and beans! Worst location, two others within two blocks. Prefer the others any day.
author: Isaias D.

description:
Ohhy mi cabeza is what I'll say about this place. The food here gives me a headache. I ordered a steak burrito bowl and it tasted like paper. There were absolutely no flavors to it. The portions they give you here are so small that I feel like this is a meal for a midget. I got what, like 4 small pieces of steak? They then give you like a generous amount of lettuce to make your bowl feel bigger. If I want lettuce, I would've ordered a salad, I want steak, so give me a good portion of my damn steak

For the few pieces of steak that I did get, they taste rather dry, rubbery, and flavorless. So I guess it's a good thing I didn't get that much of steak...

The chips here are salty!!! I had to gulp down a cup of water to cleanse my palate.

Want some real authentic burritos? Go to Garaje or Tropisueno that's nearby. Don't come here!
author: Xin W.

description:
Chipotle is definitely one of my favorite fast-food options! The food here is not bad at all :) Both the burritos & the rice bowls are good. Also the salad bowl! But that's basically the rice bowl with extra lettuce so I tend to not get that, unless I'm feeling extra fat that day :P All of the options are pretty good. I particularly enjoy their chicken & their sofritas!

Whatever you do, be sure to get guac! It's so worth it :)
author: Alice H.

description: It's a pretty bad service Chipotle. Never give you enough food when there's no line. You want corn? They'll give your sour "cream" instead. I asked for my burrito to go and they give me a cap and a bag while there's a ton of other customers behind me trying to pay. Get to the standard of other Chipotle's please.
author: Jay F.

description:
Consistency is key, and this branch sure does lack in this department.

I have to get the same thing while in California because I only get 2 taco shells when ordering tacos....WHAT!!!???  In every other major city it's 3. (Use to be 4 back in 2005, but the shells were smaller then)  This does not equal the proportions of a burrito bowl or a burrito for that matter.

I ordered a burrito bowl and got a pinch or white rice. Mashed down, it couldn't cover half the bottom of the bowl. The preparer was generous on the meat portion, aiming to make up for the extra square footage not being occupied in my bowl.

This was my 3rd trip to this location and I will definitely be trying out the other 2 that are within close proximity instead.
author: Brian J.

description:
So this review isn't super specific to the Chipotle that I visited. It is more a review about the Chipotle culture from its inception to what I experienced today.

When I first went to Chipotle, I loved everything about it. Friendly staff, diverse staff (Mexican, Black, White, Asian, etc). The portions were great, and I'm a big guy. The food tasted excellent.

Today when I went in, after some time I hadn't visited a Chipotle, I noticed it was VERY corporate feeling. My portions sucked, and when I asked the guy to add some more meat, he snarled at me and said that I already got more meat than normal. Are you use to feeding infants or adults? The meat portion you showed me my 2 year old niece would have ate and still had room to keep eating... Also everyone behind the glass were kids, lacking diversity.

The prices went up, I got less food, and somewhat of an attitude when I asked for more because I thought.. hmm for $9 that sure sucks, I can get a burrito from the Mexican joint down the street that will surely fill me up.

It is really sad how corporate is becoming everything in our country. I will no longer eat at a Chipotle again, and will try not eating at any corporate chain and support my local mom and pop restaurants / food shops. 

Overall experience...disappointed.
author: Tom L.

description: They gave me the smallest burritto I have ever received...and charged me $15. She even looked at it funny when she wrapped it and handed it to me anyways. I looked at her surprised. The guy who wrapped it look barely legal to work there. I enclosed a photo with a chip and salsa cup to size compare. Hate fast food chains this reminds me why I never go to Chipotle.
author: Attic F.

description: Every time I come here it's always a bad experience, the only reason I come back is because of the convenience of how close it is to my school. The food is always good, I've never had a problem with the quality of the food, however the employees are a different story. First of all, there was absolutely no sense of urgency from the employees. They never seem like they want to be there and everything you ask them is a hassle. I ordered chips and when the cashier didn't give me the chips I ordered I asked her for them and she rolled her eyes and threw them on the counter. Like oh I'm sorry? Is it too much to ask for what I ORDERED? Then after that she walked away and I had to get my own bag and walk out. Another thing I noticed with this spot compared to other Chipotle's is the portion size. I should not be able to see every single corner of the bottom of my bowl, i get that there are portion sizes... but it's a little to extreme at this location.
author: Mark A.

description:
She broke my burrito. 

It was a sad, dismal burrito to begin with. She was obviously a newbie, as my burrito looked like a folded up sandwich, so rectangular rather than a perfectly rotund burrito. 

Then she broke it. And subsequently proceeded to use a napkin to wipe off the spillage. Wrapped it in foil, handed it to me. 

I was speechless. 




(Other notes: the bathroom was half flooded with dirty cleaning water. They ran out of chicken and subsequently some chicken lovers had to wait 10+ minutes for their orders. The entire staff mumbled.)
author: Rowena L.

description: Smallest burrito I have ever gotten at a Chipotle. Smallest burrito bowl I have ever gotten at a Chipotle. When I asked for more rice (I thought a 3/4 filled scoop wasn't sufficient) I was told I would be charged more. Same with the lettuce. Rude workers.
author: Nick S.

description: The lines are too long, and the employees are very slow and inexperienced. They just aren't organized as other Chipotles, I would avoid this one.
author: Tim L.

description:
Chipotle - SF

Dear Cheap'otle, what happened to you?...  You used to be so hearty, so full of pork, chicken, or beef...  'But now you're "meatless," like a vegan, tofu substitute.  It's as if I never knew you at all...

90% filler + 10% meat = WTH?!
Photo - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/SQuQ32gVOVsnXrKCOXl0Xw?select=sOEHCF7jiIqibv9WkXmK2A

Was up in SF last week, hanging out with my good friend, AM.  We decided to grab a bite to eat after leaving Maxfields @ The Palace Hotel...
Maxfields Pied Piper Bar & Grill - http://www.yelp.com/biz/maxfields-pied-piper-bar-san-francisco-2

I had Chipotle a couple of weeks ago in SoCal - City of Lake Forest @ Rockfield and El Toro Rd. with the same sad result, all fluff and no "chutzpah!"  I thought, "Hey, maybe it was a fluke!..."  It just might be that one particular SoCal location...  So, I had hoped...  'Until I came here and my suspicions confirmed.  It was as if I was looking at the same, identical meat deprived burrito...  Really?!... 8/

Lake Forest Chipotle - Lake Forest, CA
http://www.yelp.com/biz/chipotle-mexican-grill-lake-forest

'Used to come to Chipotle evey now and then, when it was great!  'Loaded with meat, well proportionate to the rice, beans, sour cream, etc., but now... Fail.

Up until 2006, Chipotle was a subsidiary of McDonald...  
Hmmm, maybe MCD's held the company to a higher standard before the IPO.
"¡Ay Dios mio! Adios, McJuan'olds!"

There seems to have been a Chipotle Mex'plosion over the last 6 to 7 years, with a location in every city. (In 2009 - 'More than 30 states, close to 500 stores nationwide.)  The quality seems to have been compromised for the sake of streamline franchising and as always, a larger bottom line.
Well, at least the skimping of the meat is consistent up in the SF Bay Area as it is down south.
Once - 'Shame on you.
Twice - 'Suck it!

Now, when you take a bite, you may get a mouthful of rice, maybe some beans, if you're lucky a few pieces of meat too!  The next bite you might get a bit more...  'Or hit a pocket of sour cream with a few beans?...  The burritos are not being well made so that you get a bit of everything in each bite but with the lack of meat, no big surprise.

Really, is this a steak burrito w/vegetarian tendencies?...  'Where the hell is the meat?

The chips & salsa were tasty...  'And you can't go wrong with a Corona added to the mix but if I wanted a plain rice & bean burrito, I would've just ordered one!
It looked good! - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/SQuQ32gVOVsnXrKCOXl0Xw?select=4xAxaUs-Uwou7UV9uk_A5g

It seems that Chipotle has lost its way from its beginning in 1993 and of all things, BASED ON SAN FRANCISCO BURRITO STANDS!... 8(
Article - http://nutritionwonderland.com/2009/06/does-mcdonalds-own-chipotle-mailbag/

There are a lot of hole in the wall, burrito shops in SoCal that can show Chipotle what a burrito should look like and taste like for less dinero.
Examples:
El Campeon - http://www.yelp.com/biz/el-campeon-san-juan-capistrano
Albertacos - http://www.yelp.com/biz/albertacos-mexican-food-inc-mission-viejo
Diego's Mexican Food - http://www.yelp.com/biz/diegos-mexican-food-oceanside#hrid:P6AzfRIxkEsiE5V0Etii0Q/src:self

Dear Jip'otle, it is with deep regret that I bid thee farewell.  
You may want to revisit some long standing burrito joints and get back to the basics of why people fell in love with you in the first place.

However, they did have a cool recycling set up for bottles!
Photo - http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/SQuQ32gVOVsnXrKCOXl0Xw?select=1BV3NmioO3y-ZD8K28uOHA

- Pau 

Food: 3
Ambiance: 2+
Service: 3
Value: 1
author: Darrell P.

description: Their portions are tiny. They'll give you like half a scoop of chicken. Feels like a rip off. It's expensive. Also the quality is going down. Today my chicken had a lot of burned pieces.
author: Erik G.

description:
I once raced some coworkers who went next door to Working Girl Cafe (a 4-star establishment in its own right) when Chipotle had at least 20 people in line and Working Girl only had a handful. Sure enough, I strolled out of Chipotle a few minutes later burrito in hand while my coworkers were still waiting for their sandwiches.

There are a few things I don't love about Chipotle (the burritos are a little on the small side, the guacamole is like $18 (okay, it's $2), and the rice is a little weak), but at the end of the day, they serve a tasty burrito made to order quickly and for not a lot of pesos. I dig it.
author: Andrew M.

description:
This place kills me. When there's a queue out the door you'll get the best service, fast, quick, friendly.

When there's two people in the queue they'll drag their feet, have a chat & even sweep the floors..come on guys...what happened to the customer being the priority?! Sadly this isn't a one off occurrence either.
author: Nicole E.

description:
Chipotle is my favourite Americanized burrito place.  I don't consider it Mexican food, and neither should you.

I don't typically review chains, but this one is very special to me.  My friends and I were at 111 Minna for happy hour during the DataWeek 2013 conference.  Although I love 111 Minna, we were starving, and 111 Minna doesn't serve food!

BUT WE STILL WANTED TO DRINK.

So we went over to Chipotle, got some burritos / burrito bowls... AND patron margaritas.  BEST HAPPY HOUR EVER.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Awful customer service. They were out of plain rice and I asked if there was anything on their menu that doesn't include rice at all. One of the employees by the kitchen area said no one is FORCING me to get rice. Um, okay... I ordered tacos for my boyfriend and he told me they were so sloppily put together and falling apart that he couldn't eat it. Not coming back.
author: Nancy L.

description: I had a big catering order that this location took care of yesterday. I was greeted by Katie who made sure everything was good to go. She even was kind of enough to help me load the stuff into my waiting Uber. When I arrived, my clients were impressed on how everything was laid out (with the trays, burners, etc). Everything I needed was in the catering bag - plates, bowls, napkins, serving utensils, regular utensil, etc. Food was great. Definite crowd pleaser. And to top it off, Katie called me to see how things went! She rocks! Thanks Chipotle on 126 New Montgomery Street!
author: Tom H.

description:
I'm a huge fan of Chipotle.  This location does a great job at taking care of the long lines, especially during the lunch time rush.  One thing to be aware of is that they do not wrap your burrito the best.  Every time I've come here, my burrito was on the verge of falling apart!

Also, if you ask for them to take it easy on the cheese or sour cream, be prepared just to have what looks like a standard amount of cheese and sour cream.

Well, who comes to Chipotle when they want to watch their diet anyways?  The food tastes great and the service is fast.  Make sure to use the Smoked Tabasco as well!
author: Andrew H.

description:
Is the meat a topping at this place? I asked for carnitas in my burrito and got practically a pinch, placed on the tiny mountain ridge of rice, ever so carefully with a pair a tongs. I thought the chick that made it was going to ask for some of it back when I sat down.  
When a burrito is ordered with meat I thought the main attraction was THE MEAT. I ended up with an overwhelmingly tasting guacamole burrito instead, which by the way, I paid $2 extra. I give it two stars for just existing and not being crowded. Almost $10 for this? Not coming back.
author: Will G.

description:
Great for a quick bite (amazingly addictive) and a friendly staff. 

This location is a bit small and can get very crowded during the lunch rush. Fortunately, the line moves fast but it can be challenging to find a seat.
author: Eric A.

description: I'm usually a huge fan of Chipotle restaurants but this location simply serves too much traffic to deliver quality. When I came here for lunch, my order was incorrectly made even though I looked at the person behind the counter eye to eye and said "no beans", and they proceeded to give me two massive spoonfuls of beans in my burrito bowl. Portions here are also considerably smaller than other locations. In terms of taste, my burrito bowl tasted the same as any other burrito bowl I've ordered from Chipotle so +1 star for that. If you can, try another Chipotle location. Can't recommend this one unfortunately.
author: Austin W.

description:
I love quesadillas. I love quesadillas with chicken made at Chipotle. I have been enjoying them for 2 years now. however 3 x in last few weeks I have had 2 send them back due to them being dry, a little burnt and like it fell on the floor.

The team lead there, nice thin latin gent with slight thin moustache who works near the cashier running the line and a sweet burgundy hair youg lady with short hair, fabulous eyelashes and blue eyes always brought it home with new, fresh quesadillas that were robust, full, soft and greasy the way I like and they use to make.

Today was one of the worse days of my life there.

I ordered 1 cheese and 1 chicken and the chicken one came out dry and burnt again, So I took it back and asked if they cab remake while looking at the girl refrebnecs above. She knew my pain from last time. 

So 12 minutes later I had to go up to counter (they usually bring it to me when i complained in past) and they didnt started it so 5 more mins they brought it to me leaking. I said "can I have a bag. That will cost you 10 cents.  "Here is a dollar" I threw on counter, they threw the bag at me. Touche but rude. I didn't get mad. I Yelp!

I walked out and when I got back to work the quesadilla it was completely burnt and so was the chicken inside. It tasted like they scraped the meat from an old pan of meat and as if they dropped it on floor. barely any cheese, which they always put lots of cheese. I even got sick in bathroom.  Ugh! I will never go to this Chipotle again

:(
author: Michael D.

description: There was a time when I looked down my nose at Chipotle. Not anymore. They are fast, convenient and the food is good. This location has 2 floors and is nice.
author: Sunil R.

description: I'm not going to eat from this restaurant anymore , the worker is so weird specially the guy who works on Saturday , he doesn't even smile  and the meat so dry , even they charged me $2,95 for extra meat , that's incredible .
author: Rock H.

description:
This is my favorite branch of Chipotle in SF. The people who work here are friendly and make burritos very efficiently. 

The line does get long during lunch hours, but it moves relatively quickly and the floor-to-ceiling windows provide a wonderful people-watching opportunity!
author: Kira G.

description:
I've never had to bargain for my Mexican food before.

Chipotle is Chipotle- they all taste the same- but the service at this one is what is prompting my review. 

Thursday afternoon- I ordered a quesadilla, chips, and guac- got up to the register and handed the cashier my card (the lunch lines are INSANE so I figured I would be ready to go). As she's swiping it, I realize the total is 18 bucks- I immediately tell her what I ordered and assumed she would void the transaction and re-charge my card the correct amount. I had been charged for a stranger's lunch as well as my own.

Instead of voiding like I asked, she said "come back in tomorrow and I'll give you a free burrito." Uhh, what? I told her that I just wanted to be refunded and she made a comment about me holding up the line- only to follow it up by promising me TWO free burritos for her mistake. Confused, I responded, "Alright- Can I have a special receipt? Like a gift card or something? Or can you just void my transaction?" She responded "No, no- I'm the only cashier. Come back tomorrow or next week and I'll be here! Two free burritos! I'll remember you! Two burritos!" 

I ate my quesadilla in bitter defeat, wondering how I had just been maneuvered into paying 18 bucks for my lunch. Two burritos though, I thought- okay! I should have realized "I'll remember you" isn't exactly a binding agreement. Not wanting more Chipotle but feeling obligated to collect my bargain burritos, I went back the following week. She's not there- and I have no way to prove that I was charged for someone else's food. 

Burritoless and bitter, I'm not so impressed with the pushy and sloppy service at this Chipotle.
author: Kay E.

description:
I love chipotle. 
I went there on NM st last Friday. The food is good. There were not many customer, may be 2 others.
The music is loud but what's louder are workers, chatting and making crazy funny extremely loud noise. I thought there was a fight. I don't mind people being happy but please keep it low. Please....
author: Manutsawee B.

description:
Ok, we all know what Chipotle is about by now. You go in and order the same damn thing you got the last 60 times a'la Starbucks. People say there's a "secret menu" but really it's just mooshing the same ingredients in different ways (but then again, this is true about all Mexican food, in California, to some extent). 

So what's different about *this* Chipotle? Well for starters you have to fight your way through a crowd of smoking art college students to get to the door. It's like going to a Great White show, only replace chain wallets with haircuts that they'll look back at in five years and cringe with double chills. Once you're inside there's probably a lunch line as far as you can see. That's not the problem, it moves fast. The problem is they skimp hard on the ingredients, probably so they don't run out from the hipster art student onslaught. 

They however have margaritas. Not that Ka wine BS but Patron. Haven't tried them though, because, who really wants to sip a Margarita in a loud fast food restaurant? 

I may sound negative. At least a little. But, hey, it's still Chipotle. I'll see you there ordering your 2,000 calorie burrito and I'll get mine.
author: Scott M.

description:
I love all chipotles. I really really really do love them. For me it cannot get any better. This place stands out for me because they offered brown rice! Ohhh yay I can fool myself into thinking that my burrito is healthy!!! 

Only downside to this location is that at lunch time expect to wait about 20 min for your meal.
author: Michelle I.

description: Chipotle started going downhill once it started charging customers an extra $3.50 for a quesarito. I've been boycotting them ever since. #freethequesarito
author: Nikki W.

description:
Today only!

Wednesday, January 12th, 2011. From 11:00 AM to 09:00 PM.

If you work at_______________, show us your employee badge or uniform and get a free burrito, tacos or salad.

Of course, I opted for the FREE steak burrito.

It wasn't great, it wasn't bad either.

Beggars can't be choosers.
author: John G.

description:
It's Chipotle. If you've been to one before, you likely know what to expect.

I went here for dinner, and it was actually very quiet. There was no line at all, and the three of us going there got through in about a minute all together (if that). One gets the sense that they're used to handling the lunch rush, so they're surprisingly efficient at getting food out to you. Quick, friendly service is always a plus. The place was clean and comfortable.

The food is typical Chipotle fare. It admittedly doesn't taste like authentic Mexican food or even particularly exciting, but it does taste fresh and like the combination of ingredients should. I got a veggie burrito and couldn't finish it. My friend got tacos and, while he enjoyed them, about half of the contents of each fell out before making it to his mouth, so he had to concede and grab a fork after the first few minutes. Generally speaking, burritos are a good strategy for keeping food contained.

Four starts because it's exactly as advertised. It's not a place I'd go all the time, but if you want a meal in a corn tortilla pouch with fresh ingredients without selling your soul, it's a reliable place to get it.
author: Xanda S.

description:
First of all, it's a Chipotle, which means you can expect a few things: clean seating area, friendly line workers, and tasty not-really-authentic mexican food.

This Chipotle doesn't fail to deliver, but it does fall short of other Chipotle's in one area: competency. It seems to me like the entire line crew has been new the last couple of times I've been here. That leads to messier, slower food prep (the burritos are barely wrapped at all) and a longer-than-it-should be line wait.

Food is still up to par, but there's another Chipotle or two in the area to choose from. For now, I'd recommend skipping this one.
author: Haak S.

description:
Good location and generally good service.  I've eaten here probably 50 times in the last two years.  One major issue is that they don't know how to handle the dinner rush.  I was there on 2/6/14 and they were out of white rice, chicken, steak, sour cream and hot salsa.  

I understand it gets busy but it's not that hard to predict when you're running out of common items in the prep area.  

On top of that I watched one woman screw up three peoples orders (when they were 90% complete) and just throw them away.  She remade them quickly but what a waste to see good food thrown away while you're waiting in line for 15 minutes.  When you ask if someone wants sour cream and they say no and then you put sour cream on it, of course they're going to want you to remake it.

I love Chipotle but seriously; I don't want the burnt crusted on rice at the bottom of the pan.
author: Jamey D.

description:
Yup, this is just another Chipotle. But word to the wise, as other Yelpers have noted: insanely long lunch lines. They do move quickly, which means that if your big spoonful of [insert protein choice here] is towards the end of the batch, no concerns about freshness or temperature, which might be the case at other Chipotles.

Also, unlike other Chipotles, I've always had luck here making swaps/asking for extras. No one has questioned it and I've been an embarrassing number of times, always asking for swaps/extras.

This is one of the few places open on the weekend in SOMA that's cheap and easy, which is awesome.

So in Chipotle terms: Yay! I'm a fan.
author: Sally R.

description: I've been a big Chipotle fan for a really long time but was starting to get a little disillusioned with the quality of it, steak was gristly or chicken had so much fat on it. I ended up taking a break from Chipotle after the E-coli incident and decided that since they are being so focused on the quality of the ingredients I'd give them another shot. I was pretty disappointed when I ordered from there for a lunch and learn. It was completely disorganized, though everyone was very nice and friendly no-one knew where my order was and forgot to some of the order, so I was late getting it back. When I dove into my bowl it was pretty upsetting how tiny the portion was, I don't need a ton of food but less than half the bowl is pretty small. I figured the chips would help fill be up so I moved one but when my second bite of the little amount of steak they gave me had gristle in it, I've decided to extend my break a little longer.
author: Jessica C.

description:
You have to give a huge round of applause to Chipotle, who insists on humanely raised meat. As an animal rights activist, this is HUGE that a chain such as Chipotle would fight the horror of factory farming.

I went to a festival in Chicago hosted by Chipotle, where they had different tents, each discussing their sustainability practices (organic cotton t-shirts, no gestation crates for the pigs). This really means a lot!!!!

And the food is always delicious! Veggie bowl with chips is my way to go. Man I want some just thinking about it!!!!

More info: http://www.chipotle.com/en-us/fwi/animals/animals.aspx
author: Rebecca L.

description:
Don't be alarmed by the long line, it moves quick, I promise.  The chick with way too much make-up on is a straight triple-og hustler.

Not too bad on seating either, and they always have some bumpin ass jams for you to shake it to while you wait in line.
author: Farrell W.

description:
This particular Chipotle's is a very useful place to get lunch if you're in a hurry and need food of a reasonable quality.  Relative to other Chipotle's, this particular establishment hurtles through its customers.  You'll be in and out in five minutes during peak lunch time.

Still, though, at the end of the meal you're left with Chipotle stomach.

So -- pros and cons.
author: Bill H.

description:
They always try to put the smallest portions in the burritos at this location. Compared to the East Bay Chipotles, it's like I'm getting a baby burrito here.

Then the looks they give me when I ask for double white rice, which by the way is the same amount of normal rice at a Alameda or Oakland location, I had to ask to for double rice three times. 

Also gave me what looked like a total of 12 pieces of corn.


If you can wait to go to your local Chipotle I'd definitely do it.
author: Wahid S.

description: The staff is quick, and efficient at delivering standard mexican fare to your mouth.  I am a regular here and the food is consistently what I expect and for a reasonable price.  The lines can be 50 people long and you'll still get through it in less than 10 minutes
author: Matt U.

description: Customer service here compared to other chipotle's is FAR better.  It's hard to leave reviews for fast food establishments, so I'll leave it up to the cleaniness.  This place is modestly clean and in a great location. 3 stars.
author: Jason C.

description: im a fan of ethical organic non gmo eating so i love this place just dont like the prices but u get what u pay for i guess
author: Leigh G.

description:
I have been sick with food poisoning for the past 2 days.

I should've ran out of the building when I saw the pico de gallo was bubbling with some off-white ooze, but I figured, I would skip the pico and order a steak bowl. What's the worst that could happen?

Wallowing in nausea with a fever in my bed all weekend. That's what.
author: Anthony O.

description:
Today, I ordered a steak burrito bowl, I think. Key emphasis on the words "I think."

I said I wanted brown rice. The lady over the counter gave me no rice. I asked for black beans; she gave me black bean water (it is literally an inch thick of black bean water). The steak was overcooked to a rubbery texture, and they barely gave me a tablespoon of corn salsa, lettuce and cheese.

Although, they were pretty generous with the hot salsa. So generous, in fact, that I have an entire burrito bowl full of hot salsa and black bean water.

Chipotle, get your act together.
author: Vy H.

description:
I'm not reviewing Chipotle food.  You know what the food is.  The food is the same everywhere. 

I'm reviewing the extreme efficiency of the staff at this location.  No matter how long the line is, it never takes more than 5 minutes to get through and get your salad or burrito and go. 

Be ye not dismayed at the sight of the long line -- the staff here will get you through quickly.  And the food is tasty to boot. 

Also, they're open a bit later if you work late at night.
author: Tom P.

description:
It's Chipotle. If you like Chipotle, you will like this Chipotle. If you don't like Chipotle, I don't think this location will change your mind.

Now, don't get me wrong. I like Chipotle. A lot. Around 10 years ago, it was a totally novel thing to me--delicious, hard to find (where I was living, anyway), and generally very exciting. 5-star-worthy in those days, for sure. But the novelty has worn away in the intervening years. Case in point: there are *at least* four Chipotles in a roughly two block radius from where I used to work in downtown SF. Possibly more.

So: Chipotle has graduated to "widespread chain" status. Which means that, as much as it pains me, I've got to review like a widespread chain. And that means three stars all the time (because you know what to expect), unless it really stands out one way or the other.

This Chipotle doesn't stand out one way or the other.

(That all said, if you've never gone to Chipotle, definitely try it out. The barbacoa is amazing.)

Bear in mind that this location gets hella busy during the lunch rush. The line moves relatively swiftly, though. Because it's Chipotle.
author: Greg P.

description:
Everyone knows the drill.  Everyone wishes they bought the stock way back when...

The line gets ridiculously nuts on weekday from 11:30pm - 1:00pm.  So avoid those hours unless you want to take an hour lunch where you are mostly waiting in line.
author: Steven F.

description:
Been here three times. First two were great.

This time I ordered online, and after I picked it up and got back to the office, I discovered there was...

- no meat
- no fajita veggies
- no medium salsa

... all of which I had ordered. Needless to say, disappointing.
author: Logan H.

description:
Chipotle is chipotle. I have had better, and it's just okay. Fast foodish Mexican, once owned by McDonalds. Yes, they say that they "try" to buy natural meat when possible, yada yada yada... This is a good step in the right direction, but they are still a huge corporation and their environmental footprint is very large so their words don't mean much to me.Unfortunately, "Natural" is a pretty meaningless label due to the lack of standards by the USDA and it would be nice if chipotle committed to buying pasture-raised (actually humane and natural) meat. Animals are meant to live outside! Also, When I get a burrito bowl they put it in the LARGEST brown bag possible rather than asking "do you need a bag?". Completely unnecessary. 

The prices are decent, especially considering the area (its hard to find a lunch around here for under $10.00 but very easy to do here). The people that work here weren't very friendly, but weren't necessarily rude. There's usually a long line but it moves fast. They do a good job at handling it.

Props to them for having brown rice, although it doesn't look very brown. Not sure what this means. I also like that they have nutritional information on their menu and guides for vegans, vegetarians, etc. I ordered a burrito bowl with brown rice, black beans, fajita veggies, lots of lettuce, corn salsa, pico de gallo, and guacamole. It was good and came out to a bit over $7.00. The portion was not huge but not small.

I will return if I ever crave a burrito bowl again but it won't be on a regular basis as Chipotle simply does not compare to the real Mexican food that we are spoiled with in this diverse city. I always feel better supporting a local business as opposed to a giant.
author: Celia B.

description:
It's convenient for me and I know the food... Love the freshness and environment of the chain. 

However this location skimps way too much on ingredients. Get a guac cup and they barely fill it up. They are very efficient and move lines quickly. But that efficiency comes at the expense of not giving enough food.
author: Rob L.

description: Very mediocre food. Not much more that I can tell about this place. Well, it's quite cheap so maybe a good alternative to McDonalds if you like Mexican. They have a lot of seats so usually no problem with room except for lunch hours.
author: Piotr G.

description: pretty good - good customer service and fresh vegetables.
author: Ginny L.

description:
I know, I know... I'm ashamed of myself as well.

Being in the hub of amazing, world-renowned culinary delights like the nosh you find in San Francisco on a daily basis, it's almost an insult to even contemplate eating at a chain restaurant like Chipotle. In fact, the mere thought of it is probably the equivalent to spitting in the face of Gary Danko or kicking Michael Mina's miniature schnauzer straight in the balls repeatedly, then pouring Tapitio on it's open wounds.** It's disappointing, but you know what? I actually enjoy Chipotle; so there!

**No idea if Michael Mina actually has a miniature schnauzer, but I just got done looking at a picture of a puppy on the internetz, so that breed of canine was fresh on the mind. Also, I in no way, shape or form advocate the idea of kicking dogs in the genitals, then pouring hot sauce on the affected area. It's just for comparisons sake, ya dig? I digress....

I'd never opt for Chip-ottel over some bomb-ass eats from El Farolito or Taqueria Can-Cun or anything, but for being an Americanized Mexican food juggernaut, they sling some pretty OK stuff. Plus, their morals are spot on, which makes me feel less guilty about eating there. They have integrity with their food with naturally raised pigs for their carnitas, organic vegetables, and more. They take the extra steps that places like McDonalds or Taco Bell would never even think to touch.

Being in a busy area like SOMA, it can be a pain in the arse to get in-and-out anywhere around lunch time, and they do a pretty good job of managing lines to ensure you're grubbin' and back to work in three shakes of a lamb's tail (an organic lamb, at that!).

For me, eating at Chipotle is a lot like an eclipse. It rarely ever happens, and when it does, I enjoy the moment for about 60 seconds, then I move on... only to look forward to another event about 6-8 months later. I also try not to look directly at the center of either the sun, or their burritos, for fear I might burn my retinas.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I had late lunch here on a Saturday afternoon. The place was not packed and had plenty of seats.

I ordered a Chicken Burrito and it was very tasty! The rice had a nice stickiness to it and the chicken was chopped into small, easy to eat pieces. 

By the way, for the price, I think it's a really good deal. Although the portion is huge, I sometimes surprise myself by finishing it all at once! I really wish the chips would come with the burrito...I mean, how can you not have chips when having Mexican food?

In any case, I would definitely go back for more. Writing a review about it is making me hungry!
author: Alice L.

description:
The price is fairly reasonable. However, given its prime location, it gets EXTREMELY busy during lunch hours. However, the service is quick and great! I always like to get the chicken bowl because I don't like to eat with my hands! It's like a burrito except you don't have to deal with the mess and it doesn't get soggy. 

I try to stay healthy and not add sour cream or cheese. It taste just as great except healthier!
author: Becca L.

description:
I'm on a slow-carb diet (a la 4 hour body) so I try to order a burrito bowl but swap out all the rice for extra beans and axe all the sour cream and cheese. You'd think that such a simple request would be easy to execute. Unfortunately, it's always a pain 

- I never get the extra beans without asking for it like 5 times
- I ask for a little bit extra chicken (because I didn't get the extra beans) and I'm told that it's not possible
- I ask for some extra tomatoes and the person usually doesn't hear me or is so confused by the request that they just sort of ignore it given that they need to quickly cater to the next person in the burgeoning line
- And finally, I ask for a discount because I'm axing the rice and not getting extra beans or extra tomatoes and I'm met with extreme confusion.

I understand that this is intended to be a smoothly optimized supply chain but come on!!  even a tiny taqueria in the tenderloin can pull this request off in a jiffy.. 

Otherwise, it's just another Chipotle with all the usual pros and cons...
author: Partha S.

description: I rarely have anything bad to say about Chipotle. I love the chain. But this location is the stingiest Chipotle I've been to. It seems like they rarely give an actual full scoop. I ask for fajitas, they give me ~6-8 strips of veggies. I ask for corn, not even a tablespoon. Lettuce for my bowl, only a pinch of ~8 strips. My chicken burrito bowls (brown rice, fajitas, chicken, mild salsa, corn, sour cream, cheese, and lettuce) barely fills half the bowl. What the hell. Customers should not have to ask for more to receive an appropriate amount of food they pay for. Whoever is in charge of this store is giving Chipotle a bad rep.
author: Vicky C.

description:
"Writing this review to the detriment of my "Pretension cred""

What "In n Out" is to burgers, "Chipotle" is to burritos. Always fast. Always tasty. Always under $10.  Their barbacoa or perhaps the hot salsa is not for those with sensitive stomach.  Bill Niman found of Niman Ranch is an adviser to Chipotle, and Steve (Corrected thanks to Colin B.) Ells (founder of Chipotle) and Bill Niman's relationship goes back several  years. "Chipotle" is somehow involved with distributing / promoting "Food Inc." (though it could still be an awesome marking move) this sets them apart from their fast food competition like McDs and BK and the like chains.

** Also upgraded to 4 stars for paying attention.
author: Oleg H.

description:
Surprisingly delicious food and nutritious (check out the nutrition pamphlet behind the menu). I often opt out of chain restaurants. Why go to a chain when you can have the chain in other cities? I was wrong about Chipotle though, it was a yummy meal. My boyfriend and I was surprised to find large portions, many options, nutritious ingredients, quick service, and at a great price. Honestly, it was an excellent option after a long day at work. 

Highly recommended for a quick, nutritious, well priced lunch or dinner.
author: Lilly J.

description: I love chipotle, but this one is the worst ever in terms of customer service and portion size. About a month ago I came for lunch and asked for guacamole and extra chicken. The guy had given me barely one serving if chicken and barely any guacamole. I told him this and he laughed at me and still charged me for extra hickey and guacamole... I refuse to go to this chipotle for lunch anymore. Definitely go to the one just 2-3 blocks west of here. Very friendly people and good portion size
author: Gaurav K.

description:
I'll admit, I stop in for a salad on really busy days at the office, because it's fast and as long as you didn't think of it Mexican food (or God forbid, order a burrito), it's not so bad.

Today, I was proven wrong. They screwed up my order twice, but were so eager to push my salad down the production line that I could barely get it corrected either time because the line only moves one way.  They also never put the salad dressing into my bag, and there was a chunk of bone in my barbacoa. It really couldn't have been much worse.
author: Quinn S.

description:
Meh. Don't get me wrong I love chipotle and their delicious steak burrito bowls. But this place in comparison really jips you on the amount of meat you get.  That's the biggest and only "beef" I have with this place. I eat my meal and more than not I'm still hungry (it's chipotle, you're NOT supposed to be hungry at all after).  

The one good things is that the line goes by fast! Even when it looks long you're in and out within 20 minutes tops.
author: Austin R.

description:
My buddy from UCSC got me into this Chipotle craze.  Basically a burrito in a bowl minus the tortilla with the works.  It may look small in their custom bowl as they are getting it ready but damn...it fills me up quick!

I really recommend buying a side of chips & salsa there so you can eat it with the burrito bowl and make your own version of a Super Nachos!

Sorry Nick...I still prefer the Chicken Bowl over the Steak bowl any day! :)
author: Dave L.

description: Although food is expensive all over union square, chipotle gives you more bang for your buck. Friendly staff, good food, and near union square
author: Ryan F.

description:
47 seconds. 

I start my iPhone timer as I walk into my local Chipotle.  Uncharacteristically, there is no line so I place my burrito bowl order immediately.  Brown rice (new!), black beans, chicken, salsa, cheese.  Bag it up, swipe credit card, no receipt.  

Walk outside and check timer: 47 seconds.  

If you want a no-frills lunch with mind-blowing quickness, this is the only place to go.  Seriously, no one can touch Chipotle when it comes to speed.  Sure, the food is mediocre.  But it's certainly not bad and it's absolutely reliable.  For healthiness, that's really up to you.  A veggie or chix burrito bowl really isn't bad, and there are handy calorie counts posted on the menu if you're into that sort of thing.

So if you are looking for something authentically Mexican, hop on the 14 bus and get yourself to the Mission STAT.  But if you need slightly-above-average food in sub-1 minute, Chipotle is tough to beat.
author: Eric S.

description: honestly the food and service is just very very mediocre. I work downtown so this is one of the only places open on weekend nights. The bowl is actually somewhat tasty and fills you up, but today I tried the burrito for the first time and .....well it just wasn't any good. First off the dude who made it rolled it up into more of a ball than a burrito, then half assed wrapped it in a very small piece of aluminum foil so that some of it was exposed touching the counter. the meat was not tender, instead really chewy. on top of that it is almost laughable how much they skimp you on ingredients....all for almost ten dollars for a burrito.. WOW. in a city like this where there are some of the best burrito joints around, i wouldn't go to chipotle only if it is the only place open and when I'm working.
author: Nick R.

description:
Damn you Chipotle and your ads plastered all over the Montgomery BART station! Now I crave you on a daily basis. I had to feed my craving today.

My newest fave: chicken burrito bowl with rice, black beans, hot & medium salsa, cheese, sour cream, lettuce. Take it to go & eat it outside at Yerba Buena Gardens...now that's a great lunch.
author: Erin S.

description:
Great quality! I've seen my share of Chipotles which put in wrong proportions of ingredients or tear burritos but I've never had that happen here. Great atmosphere. 

The only downer is the line can get crazy around 12. Come a little early or prepare to wait ~10-15 minutes. The line does move pretty quickly...
author: Srikanth K.

description:
Chipotle is delicious and they care about sustainability. They buy organic and local produce when they can, and try their best to only use meat that is free of hormones and antibiotics. Their meat is very flavorful and I love that their rice is mixed with cilantro and lime. 

They are also super fast and do not skimp on the filling. My coworkers have actually complained before that their burrito had too much filling, couldn't be wrapped, and fell apart as they were eating. I say bring it on! I love that they give generous portions and don't mind the mess. Another complaint I've heard is Chipotle isn't "authentic mexican." Newsflash - they're not trying to be. Anyhow I recommend the carnitas or steak burrito and LOVE adding the fresh and corn salsa. If you like spicy you should also add the green chile salsa. Unfortunately you have to buy chips separately, but they're worth it; perfectly salted and also contain lime.
author: Alice J.

description:
Try this order if you want to get out of Chipotle for under a bazillion calories:

Salad, no dressing. Black beans, no sauteed veggies. Mild and Hot Red, plus Corn Salsa. Ask for a "small" serving of the gauc. Add the green chili tabasco, or don't. Either way. Pair with an iced tea with lemon, no sugar. 

Doesn't matter which Chipotle you're at, that's a solid order. 

This Chipotle is just as good as the others I've been too (which is a testament to their quality control). Line moves fast, ingredients are always getting replaced with even fresher batches.
author: Allison S.

description:
Today as I was going through my friend's profiles on Facebook, I came across the information that two of them are pregnant. They're both younger than me. By two years. It got me thinking about having children and getting married, despite neither having a boyfriend nor a guy I can stun with a "whoops!".

Then my therapist described, at length, the birthing process. Now if I didn't need therapy before, I sure as fuck need it now.
