Chipotle is kind of like having a kid to me. Eating that burrito, with fresh ingredients and fast service is just like making babies; especially the fast part because my taste in men is HORRIBLE, but still delicious.

Then after devouring the ridiculous amount of food they served you, you suddenly feel like something is growing in your stomach. Despite the backaches, the always going to the bathroom, feet swelling, and other nauseating qualities it brings, you're convinced it was all worth it.

Then 9 months later you're shitting out a kid, screaming for an epidural and wondering why on God's green earth did you ever think that was a good idea in the first place. 

I wouldn't be surprised if Chipotle was heavily frequented by Mormons.
author: Jaime L.

description: The guys are nice here, but this place gets slammed during lunch and sometimes they cut corners. That said, they do a good job of giving you a heaping serving of guac--though you have to pay a whopping $2 for it!
author: Paul C.

description:
Not all Chipotle branches are created equal. This one is the best in SF, in my opinion - I've tried all three, and eat Chipotle multiple times per week, every week (yeah, it's an addiction).

As for Chipotle as a brand in general - it's the best "fast food" you can get. They source relatively sustainable ingredients, even though it impacts their margins, because they believe it promotes customer loyalty. It certainly does. When you want a quick, delicious, filling meal for under $10, and you want to know that the meat is sustainably sourced - it's pretty tough to beat!

Even in a city with so many great authentic Mexican restaurants, I still eat here all the time because I trust the quality of the ingredients. Yeah, it's a big public company. I don't care. I am obsessive about ingredients, and I am also very busy - those two factors collide at Chipotle.
author: Chris U.

description: First time there today and the staff COULD NOT HAVE BEEN NICER. I explained I had no clue how to order but they were so sweet and patient, yet fast and didn't hold up the line. Speaking of the line, when I walked in there was a really long line but it moved quickly. I will certainly return. But be warned, I had the spicy sauce and it was spicy. Might have to go medium next time.  Thank you guys for a great downtown lunch experience.
author: Samantha Y.

description:
Solid Chipotle. 

I always order the kids meal and they were nice enough to give me a Normal sized bag of chips with my meal instead of the tiny one that you usually get. 

The manager on duty was friendly and walked around to each table clearing trays and socializing with the patrons, all of which I thought was nice and made it feel more like a home style place than a huge chain.
author: Katie K.

description:
Love chipotle since 2006!!! They have the best guacamole ever!!!!.  Now they r serving brown rice too. My favorite:  burrito bowl with chicken+ guacamol+ lots of lettuce!!! 
Plus,.I am impressed No matter u have chipotle in minnesota or California.  They can maintain the taste exactly the same!!  Yummy:)
author: Vincci W.

description:
I like ordering a soft, flour tortilla with barbacoa, black beans, fajitas, mild salsa, roasted chili-corn salsa and topped with lettuce along with a side of chips and more salsa! It's a good amount of food for under $5, seriously. If I'm hungry, this place is the place to go. It may not be authentic Mexican fair but it does the job. The barbacoa is always tender and juicy and the fajitas always have a nice onion to green peppers ratio.

Unfortunately, I have passed by here during lunch hours and noticed a really long line. 

And hey, thanks cute guy that let me cut you in line last night. Thanks. (:
author: Maggie H.

description: Chipotle is my all time fave fast food but this one is my least fave location. They really skimp out on the meat here. They don't give you nearly as much as all the other Chipotles. And there is this one guy who works there that is always yelling at the staff in front of us customers to give smaller portions. I'm not sure if he's a manager but he's kind of a douche and needs to be taught that his behavior is not cool. The rest of the staff are really nice. The line is insane here too by the way. Be prepared to wait at least 15 minutes to order and there's usually no seats. I suggest going around 11 AM or waiting until after 1 PM when it's died down.
author: Dusty N.

description:
Guilty pleasure?  Bourgeois burritoria? 

Chipotle has its detractors as any chain restaurant in SF should.  But the options for the burrito-starved downtown worker are few, so let's take a look here.

For one, Chipotle found itself (controversially!) on 7x7's top 10 burritos in SF last year.  I had to rub my eyes when I read it myself, but it's up there among the ranks of Farolito, Papalote, and Cancun.  

As a company, Chipotle purchases ingredients from local farms and suppliers.  While not farm-to-table exactly, everything you eat comes from within 300 miles of the location.

And it tastes good!  I love the barbacoa!  They serve beer!  And margaritas!  With booze in them!

Unfortunately, Tapatio does not exist in the Chipotle universe and no one got the memo that Tabasco does not really belong on a burrito.  And it does fill up around lunchtime with the 18-21 crowd.

Still, it's fun to sit in the window and watch the kids with skinny pants and sideways hair shuffle down the street.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Ingredients are really good, but their rice is bizarrely bad.  Its like they are trying to innovate where they shouldn't be... don't mess with the basics of beans and rice in Mexican food if you ask me.

My biggest problem with this place is that they don't put any care into assembling your order.  This is particularly painful with the crispy tacos, which were awesome the first time I had them (no rice :) but the few times since then they literally just toss all the ingredients *on top* of the taco shells, most of the salsa and sour cream is on the outside, making the shells fall apart and become essentially a taco bowl.  Might as well order the burrito bowl, except for all that damned rice.
author: j s.

description:
I eat at this Chipotle almost every other day. I have a mexican food addiction, and in my neighborhood I only have shitty chain taquerias to choose from. I can't even bother to sneer at del Taco or Chevy's or that other del someshit another block away. 

Chipotle has ok meat and addictive lime/sea salt laden chips. They also have beer that they tempt you with and then pull away when they find out that your order is to go. 

What they don't have is someone to train their people to make burritos or tacos in the way that civilized human beings prefer to eat them. Instead, I imagine that they must show them Jackson Pollock videos and then spin them around 5 times real fast and shove them to the food line with the promise that the slowest among them will be put to death. Speed is paramount. Craftsmanship is out the window.

If you order tacos, they will just sprinkle ingredients all over the place. If you are lucky, some of those ingredients will land in the taco shell. The rest of the ingredients, you get to eat off the wrapper or your hand as it slobs off the side of your taco. Grab a fork. If you get a burrito, they will put more crap in it than should fit and then mush it into a blob. Just before the blob ruptures, they quickly envelop it in tin foil. You will want to wear a Hurt Locker suit when you open that bitch. Have a spoon and a roll of paper towels handy.

Your best bet is to just have them slop your ingredients in a bowl. Even if you want shells or tortillas. It's the only thing they can do with any competence and it will reduce your rage.
author: Gabe M.

description:
I can love Chipotle because I've realized that it's not mexican food, it's just Chipotle, and thus I can judge it on a different scale from all of the real taquerias in San Francisco.

The burrito bowl is brilliant, and I'm a sucker for their margaritas.

This particular location is often packed at lunch time, so be aware that you may have to wait and may have a hard time finding a place to sit.
author: Daniel H.

description:
I admit that I'm kind of a Chipotle connoisseur.  I will often walk the extra few blocks, or drive the extra couple of miles to find a Chipotle when I get the craving.  I am not ashamed to admit that I have succumb to my Chipotle craving in San Fran, New York, Cupertino, Castro Valley, San Rafael, etc, etc.

I know you won't believe me, but Chipotle burritos can stand up to any mom-and-pop Mexican taqueria anywhere.  It's a chain, I know.  Trust me, I think it's weird too.

It feels like an assembly plant, with employees running around like crazy in order to maximize throughput, but damn those burritos are good.

Tip:  If you choose the burrito bowl, they still give you a tortilla on the side if you ask for it.  Why waste the tortilla?
author: Don T.

description: The lines can be intimidating at lunch, but they manage to pump people through pretty quickly. The people at this location are friendly and speedy (especially at the register). Interesting people watching too as the art instute crowd meets the startup/tech crowd.
author: J S.

description:
Typically, lunch is a battle. You run to the nearest place to pick up food, wait in a long ass line, and then run back to the office and scarf it down. A bunch of us ran over to this Chipotle and our excitement for a delicious burrito all died when we saw the line curling out the door. We complained to ourselves and thought, oh well.. let's wait. To our surprise, the general manager was right behind us cleaning and overheard our dismay at the wait and promised he'd have us out the door within 8 minutes (with around 40 people in front of us). We started the timer, and he promised he'd meet us at the checkout line to wrap our burritos. 

7 minutes 40 seconds later? We were walking out the door with our delicious food in hand. 

For that efficiency alone, I will be a lifetime customer. HUGE props to the Chipotle on New Montgomery. They've got their operations so well oiled! Hats off to an amazing team & awesome general manager!
author: linda t.

description:
**This review is relative to other Chipotles**

So this isn't the worst Chipotle I've been to...the servers are pretty nice for all the crowds and crap they have to deal with, but there's room for improvement:

1. I usually get the burrito bowl, and they tend to skimp on the portions.  I've been here several times, and they've been consistently stingy on packing that bowl to the brim.
2. The lines are pretty long here during lunch, and it always seems to be crowded.
3. More expensive here than typical Chipotle because of freakin' SF sales tax.  I know I can get my steak bowl in Foster City for $6.66, but it's over $7 here.  Yeah, it's a matter of cents, but it's the principle.
4. I saw a pigeon just walking its dirty little self all over the tables outside.  EWWW !@#%^  Sure, the pigeon is one of my most hated living creatures, but that's besides the point.  People are EATING on those tables.  Gross.  Just gross.  So don't eat outside here unless you enjoy things like, a mouthwash that gives you poison ivy.  Or a burrito with tuberculosis.
author: Alice C.

description:
So I'm not rating on the tastiness of this Chipotle (cuz honestly, all chipotle tastes the same, cuz.. it has and uses the same ingredients).

So I always order for pick up in order to avoid the lines (for those that don't know, you can go online and order for pick up at a certain time, you typically have to order at least a hour before the time you actually want to pick it up). I usually order from the one on Market but I decided to go to this one this time (2nd time going)

I decided to order double meat and asked for extra rice for my steak burrito for my online order.  When I received the burrito and looked inside, I could already tell they skimp'd on the meat and everything else.  It was the smallest chipotle burrito I've ever gotten, smaller than if I just got the normal serving of rice and meat.  But I was already out the door and had to go back for a meeting.

When I got back to work, I opened up my burrito, hoping to be able to eat half of it and save the other half for later, but I was right, they didn't give me extra rice, NOR the extra meat and in fact it was less meat and rice than if I just ordered a normal burrito at the other Chipotle.

Sad thing is.. this is the SECOND time this has happened.  I would have given it one star for the inconsistency of their burritos, but for the convenience of online ordering and the quickness of the pick up I gave it two stars.

Note to self: NEVER order double meat or bother caring if they'll listen to your special instructions if you're ordering online.
author: Willis C.

description: Good old stand-by in the FiDi.  Yum.
author: Mel G.

description: Carnitas burrito bowl with brown rice and black beans. I rejoiced when they finally decide to add the brown rice option. I can eat here everyday and not feel too terrible because the food here is fairly healthy. Yum!
author: Alice W.

description:
Hard to go wrong with Chipotle. Obviously SF can offer much better, but if you're at work and in a rush, Chipotle consistently brings the heat. 

For those looking for something new, try their quesadillas. It's not listed on the menu but they will happily make one for you. I find their steak quesadilla with a side of guac to be quite satisfying!! It takes a little longer to make however, so maybe avoid this one during lunchtime rush hour!
author: Peter C.

description:
One of my SoMa lunch staples.  I am no burrito snob.  I like meat.  I like cheese.  I like spicy sauce.  I like beans.  These all go into a quickly and efficiently made burrito at Chipotle.  I like that regardless of how long the line is, the wait at Chipotle won't ever be longer than 10 minutes or so.  

The only two things I order are the barbacoa burrito with spicy sauce and lettuce (sometimes the "burrito bol" if I'm feeling healthy) and the barbacoa crunchy tacos.  Valarie A. introduced me to the crunchy tacos which are delicious...  Sometimes the crunchy tacos don't feel as filing as the burritos but I think it's because they aren't as dense...though that's probably a good thing.  The crunchy tacos are sloppy and messy, though, so beware.  You will need lots of napkins (or you will need to lick your fingers).  The barbacoa meat (shredded, slightly spicy meat) is so yummy and the real reason that Chipotle is one of my favorites...
author: Wendy L.

description:
First time ever at Chipotle.  I had heard that it was one of those places that people hate to admit they like, like CPK or Denny's.  It's not.  It's really, really bad.  I was impressed that the menu was small and straightforward (always a great sign in *any* type of restaurant), but was taken aback by the super salty meats (I tried 3 different kinds: 2 of the 3 were barely edible), and a guacamole that looked like guacamole, but somehow didn't taste that way.  

I dunno -- basically the tacos didn't look or taste anything like any other taco I've ever had.  And it's not that I'm a traditionalist.  These just didn't taste any good.
author: Laurence W.

description:
I like this place. I don't care that some people claim that it's not "authentic".
(BTW, the variety of burritos that we eat today are not Mexican, it's a product of the San Francisco bay area)
You do get relatively fast service, you can customize your order, and the food is decent.
All the meat choices (chicken, beef, pork) are of better quality than at some other "Mexican" places where you get lower quality meats mixed with skin, tendons, onions, etc.

Chipotle is one of the few companies that has committed to serve naturally and humanely raised meat at their restaurants.
http://www.reuters.com/article/pressRelease/idUS113290+07-Jan-2008+BW20080107

But it's disappointing that they charge $1.40 for guacamole, and that the tortilla chips cost extra.

In case you didn't know, you can also place an order (including custom requests - make sure you choose the right location) in advance, for pickup (no deliveries - just go straight to the cashier to pay and pickup your order) online at their website: http://www.chipotle.com/#

Also it's conveniently open late until 9pm, while most SF FiDi food places are open until 3 or 4pm only.

Notes:
McDonald's sold its ownership of this company in October 2006. Chipotle Mexican Grill is now an independent company.

There's a special offer at Chipotle for Valentine's day:
http://www.chipotle.com/email/08-all-001.htm
Buy a $10 gift card at a store, during February (1 thru 12th), and bring back the receipt on February 13th or 14th to get a free burrito. I think that they do this offer every year.

Also if you buy a burrito on February 29th (2008 is a leap year, the next leap year will be 2012), your receipt will have a coupon for a free burrito.
author: Luis C.

description: I'm not really a fan of soy imitation-meat, but their Sofritas (soy meat) is surprisingly not bad---taste and texture-wise.
author: Ian W.

description:
8:30 PM, Thursday 9/10/13

Not up to par with other Chipotles.  Couldn't keep up with a modest line despite workers behind counter outnumbering customers. Music was too loud (85 decibels average, peak of 99).

They ran out of chips.  The guy in front of me ordered chips, the woman at the register turned around to grab some, and the shelf was empty. The employees called out to each other to see of there were more chips in "the office." There were not. They sent the man away without chips, which I'm assuming are among the highest markup items on the menu.

Whoever's managing isn't.
author: Bill G.

description:
We were pleased with our visit to this site on Saturday. It was selected by a friend visiting from Boston as being within walking distance of his Union Square Hotel and BART. 

Clean, efficient, good food and we liked the galvanized metal decor. The waitstaff was excellent, and everyone got *exactly* the ingredients which they wanted in their burrito. The music (mostly rap) was a trifle loud for our  ears, but we were still able to talk and enjoy a conversation with our friend. 

All in all...a pleasant surprise.
author: Dorothy C.

description:
Good quantity for the price.  Regularly, long lines at lunch hour, but they tend to move pretty quickly.  Chipotle certainly has plenty of staff working behind the counter to keep the service flowing, and to keep the line moving.

I particularly like the burrito bowl . . . you can pretty much build it with whatever you want . . . I'm partial to the carnitas, but chicken is also good.  They may suggest guacamole, but just be aware there is an additional charge.
author: Joel E.

description: I am sorry to say that my burrito bowl was filled with cold rice, rubbery meat, and vegetable trimmings that should have been tossed.  This includes the green stem of the tomato and the root ball of the onion. And why was the rice in a burrito bowl cold?  I got a combination of carne asada and pollo asada - grilled steak and chicken.  Both meats were not tenderized, chewy and bouncy. I threw most of it out and wanted to eat something afterwards to get rid of the taste. I have been to other Chipotles and had a better experience, so I am not sure what is up with this one! Waste of a perfectly good 8 bucks! Not going back.
author: ana m.

description: The food here is decent but the service is not so great. They always seem to mix up my order every time i go here to get food.
author: Ash R.

description: Got a foot-long hair in my bowl. When I showed it to them they told me to get back in line so they could make me a new one.
author: Ben M.

description:
I haven't had Chipotle since my freshman yr in college in SB. That was four years ago. I use to study across the street at the Kaplan center and I was super hungry. I walked over and I ordered a chicken burrito: no beans and mild sauce. It was extremely good! I love the rice! 

I came back last week and ordered the same thing. Yea I am not much of a risk taker. This time I had a friend with me. We sat outside. If you want to check out chicks sit outside. It is right next to the AAU so a lot of people walk by. That was what my friend was doing the entire time we were eating.

One downside to Chipotle is that it gives you severe food coma. -_- Instead of going to study I went home and took a nap.
author: Sarah C.

description: Well if you like real Mexican food then this is not the place for you. Growing up in the Mission this place is just OK... I always get the burrito bowl with chicken, brown rice , black beans, cheese and sour cream with that yummy tomatillo-green chili salsa.
author: Mae D.

description:
For lack of a better option, I found myself in front of this Chipotle at 1045 on a Monday morning, only to find the doors still locked.  Well, maybe it was for the best.

Just a tip: if your store hours state that you open at 10:30am, maybe you should, y'know, open your doors?
author: Rich G.

description:
Pros: Ideal for AAU students and financial district.
Offers firm price and it's reasonable when it's compared to other fast food joint near.
Location is great.
Cons: long line during lunch.
author: Daniel H.

description:
Ok, let it be known that i LOVE chipotle. And i mean LOVE. I have perfected the art of chipotle burriot bowl making and have my order down to a T. 

On that note, this chipotle location has repeatedly (this is the third time) screwed up my online order as long with my co-workers. It's pretty hard to screw up something that is written with specific instructions in front of your face, but they have managed to do so. So with that said, I still absolutely LOVE the food but I am very displeased and unhappy with the service/online ordering.
author: Tamara R.

description:
Ode to the burrito bowl....

O burrito bowl, 
You soothe my hungry tummy,
With a gluten free option that is actually yummy,
Downtown lunch has so far sucked lots
Until I found you, who'd have thought?
With black beans, chicken, and guac, I won't need a late afternoon snack...
And that freaking  corn is so good, it's like crack
Downtown Mexican was lacking before you, oh no! 
Now I don't have to keep going to Tropisueno!
author: Lauren F.

description: Fast and convenient to my office. The portions seem to have gotten better since my last review, but it seems inconsistent. Especially around the lunchtime rush hour. The flavors have gotten better though, so bumping it up a star.
author: Vince L.

description: If you want try Mexican food, so choose this restaurant! It's one of the best Mexican fast food restaurants.    I like its salad with white rice,black beans,chicken,medium ,corn and cheese, the food and soda is totally ten dollars,it's cheap and yummy.    choose it,try it and you will like it.
author: Chen Y.

description:
Chipotle is the only fast food chain I can think of that gets nominated for James Beard awards.  For good reason.  They give a damn about serving good food.  For the most part it is good.  Forget the organic, humane, blah blah stuff, it tastes like somebody actually cooked something.  Imagine!

Overall I've never been disappointed with a meal here; invariably there's some miscommunication in this particular location because the acoustics are terrible, the place is perpetually packed, and there's loud music blaring above the ambient noise.

The menu is confusing despite its attempt at simplicity.  In some ways I think these Southwestern joints benefit from more choices, not less.  When you can just scream out your whole order at once, it's a lot easier than going bit by bit.  Most people know the difference between beans and salsas by now.

But I can't fault them too much.  They've earned their success, they're the good guys, and yes there are better options in SF.  But not so many on that particular street..
author: J W.

description: Excellent service, line is always fast and portions generous. Food is exactly what you would expect from a Chipotle. I eat lunch here way too much. :-)
author: Jay F.

description: Didn't even have half of the ingredients. The worst thing, they have not even informed me before I started ordering. I wanted a steak bowl, you should at least let me know that you don't have steak.
author: Karina L.

description:
I would be doing myself a great disservice if I never visited nor reviewed this Chipotle...sure, once you have eaten at one you can pretty much say you've eaten at them all, but this Chipotle is the fastest one I have ever been in.  I'm sure that speed is a major focus when you have a Chipotle in the SOMA near FiDi and you have to serve regular peeps in the area PLUS conference goers.  The burritos really are good, but I am partial to the tacos here.  I've never actually sat down to eat here since I work like a block away but I'm pretty happy with this Chipotle overall.  No matter how long the line is you are in and out pretty quickly and the meat is quality, its fresh, and all the employees are nice.  

If you want guacamole its like, $2 extra.  Kind of pricey if you ask me.
author: Sonya T.

description:
The bf and I are on the slow-carb diet, which means Chipotle's burrito bowl (minus the rice and cheese) are perfect for us.

We had a craving tonight, so headed over for dinner.

As we were waiting in line, their rice cooker apparently broke, so they ran out temporarily until the rice could be finished on the stovetop. One of the girls working there made an announcement, apologized for the no-rice situation, and then offered to make our food for free if we would be ok with no rice. Perfect situation for us!

We usually get the burrito bowl with extra grilled veggies, no rice or cheese, chicken, and extra guacamole. Total cost: 0.

This review isn't because we got our food for free. This review is about the foresight of management to empower their employees to make the right call in situations like these. They probably ended up giving away 7, 8 burritos while the rice was getting ready. But they moved the line really fast, and made some people happy in the process. In the long run, that is a much better return on investment than trying to collect the money for those 7 or 8 burritos.
author: Mary M.

description: Because I live in the Mission, I tend not to eat Chipotle cus it really sucks compared to my local taquerias, but me and some friends were hungry and they insisted on chipotle. Firstly, their prices are so high for what you get especially compared to a taqueria. Secondly, they don't even have spanish rice... how are you supposed to make a burrito with white or brown rice?!? Lastly, my burrito was not a burrito... it was a lump. It was a lump that was about 3-4 by 5-6 in. A burrito is supposed to be a long cylinder nut a freakin lump. LEARN HOW TO WRAP A GODDAMN BURRITO. why is this place popular...
author: Jess C.

description: I love the steak salad bow with sweet corn. And I also have with chip and avocado. Great place for fast lunch
author: Suabot J.

description: I hate this place. Let me first say that all Chipotle's are not created equal and that I sometimes DO find myself craving this place in general, but for my next fix I am  resolved to head out of the City to satiate it. The staff are always rude, talking amongst themselves while they shepard us through the long line like cattle. They throw your food around like they would rather be somewhere else and don't DARE ask for any extras...the wrath of God, or at least Chipotle God will give you the stink eye as the spoon brings forth extra salsa. Thank goodness they make the food right in front of you. But with the terrible service, long lines and impersonal, apathetic staff, I always feel like I've whored myself out by the time I leave that place.
author: Tiauna G.

description:
My little brother loves chipotle and gets this after school all the time.  Fortunately, I work above another chain and had to try it out myself.  

Pretty funny how I had to get schooled on "how to order at chipotle!" ,. I ordered the chipotle bowl, it comes with lettuce, meat, sauce, corn, vegetables etc etc. LOTS OF HOT SAUCE please and cap the dish to go. 

Plenty of tables to sit at if you want to dine in and also bar seatings; so you can people watch during lunch hours.  There's also a few tables you can sit at out front.  I eat my bowl back in the office or back at home after work and by the time I bring it back,. the bowl is mixed up and it really looks like crap, but taste ohh so good! 

Less than $10 for a decent meal! SCORE!  

Long lines during lunch hours, I would recommend coming slightly earlier than 12pm.  

I will be back !
author: Chanel L.

description: I found out if you buy the veggie burrito you get all the extras for free.  The sour cream and guacamole.  You can ask them.  I like the sauteed pepper and onions.
author: John F.

description:
Cheap burritos, decent options, I love their veggie burrito and I am a *HUGE* fan of the chipotle flavoured tabasco sauce (yes I know, you can get it at the grocery store, the big thing for me is that they have it here where you can top your burrito with it).

These burritos are *huge*.  I can never eat a full one.  Veggies mixed with rice and beans and sauce and cheese.  Mmmm.  I love coming here for lunch.

Decent seating options inside and out.  The lineup at lunch can be stupidly long, going all the way outside, since it's right near the financial district.  I actually hate the lineup process, as it goes right across some of the seating spots.

A good place to go for lunch if you're in the area and itching for a burrito.
author: Cassandra J.

description: This place drives me nuts. I'm a frequent Chipotle customer and I visit a lot of different locations and NOWHERE are they more stingy than the New Montgomery location. Order a burrito bowl and it comes half full. they practically count the number of grains of rice they give you.  It's maddening. Go to the one on Powell or Market if you want to get your money's worth.
author: Kyle F.

description:
Ok, when it comes to lunch in the financial district, it's one of the more affordable and reliable options. Their food is above average, it's consistent, and honestly, it's all pretty tasty.

Chipotle is Chipotle. 

They're springing up like carnitas-producing daisies, and they're also bringing in droves of Academy of Art students that are more annoying than... uhhh... than what? I dunno where to go from here because they're kinda the pinnacle of annoying...

If annoying has an apex, Art students would certainly be perched at the very top, though right below them would be the following people:

-- Those who reach over the Chipotle sneeze-guard glass to point at their choices
-- Those who reach over the Chipotle sneeze-guard glass to point at their choices and then lean their head over to look at it
-- Those who change their minds as to which kind of beans they want AFTER the employee has already dropped a heaping spoonful onto their burrito, giving everyone an awkward pause, and thus creating the first rumble that will eventually give rise to the avalanche that is Chipotle's near-fatal bottle-necking (ever notice how long it can take to get through that damn line sometimes?!)
-- Those who call it Chi-pote-lays or, even worse, Chi-pol-tee... I'm not even fucking kidding.

Rein it in, Brian, rein it in...
author: Brian K.

description: Ok so this place has good food at reasonable prices and it hits the spot. but I'm taking off a star because why can't the wrap the burrito correctly? It doesn't matter what location I've been too, I usually order a burrito, and each time the person takes a stab at it, putting the food to centered like a pyramid and then wrapping it like a newborn babys diaper by an inexperienced father. You'd think after like 5 times you'd have it down, let alone you've been wrapping them for like 8 hours- tighten it up yo'.
author: Legal C.

description:
If you are hungry and need decent food in a hurry go here. 

I walked down to this location with my co-workers and said. "I'd like to go here but the line is out the door." They replied."Don't worry. This is the most efficient burrito place in SOMA" Oh and they were TOTALLY right. 

I was so surprised that in a blink of an eye I had my burrito bowl ready. When I asked for guacamole they even asked me "are you sure? It costs extra."  Thought that was nice of them.

Food there is eh.. ok. I prefer going to Maya more. But every once in a while you need to go some where else to really appreciate what you have. :)
author: She R. A.

description:
What makes this Chipotle stand out is the dazzling speed at which they take your order, assemble your meal, try to upsell you, and run your credit card.  At this point, I pretty much know exactly what they are going to ask me at each step of the process but I have to mentally prepare myself before I run the gauntlet.

If they track tttl (time through the line) for each store at Chipotle HQ, I bet that these guys are at the top of the heap.  It's really the only place I can think of where the customer ends up being a bottleneck so come prepared.
author: Vivek P.

description:
Want a clash of grease and fresh salsa? This is the place for you.
I gotta warn you that this particular location gets crowded with AAU students and countless business workers. 

I love ordering their steak/chicken bowls (for I can never finished their ginormous burritos), soft tacos, or simply a chicken quesadilla. (Yes they make those! Just request it!)

Along with my meal I usually get their chips and freshly made guac. Those are the bomb any time of the day!

To acquire seating, just simply hover over people until they are done :P
author: Karen L.

description:
Why is there so much hype for Chipotle? I tried it once before, and I thought the burrito was so gross and soggy. Every bite would ooze of beans and the chicken was so dry and tasteless. This time around, I decided to give it another try. 

I came in around lunch time and there was a huge, huge line. I thought, "Ok, they've definitely changed and upgraded their menu or something...." The place was packed! Instead of a burrito, I got the burrito bowl. Same concept as a burrito -- but without the wrap, which means no soggy burritos! The chicken burrito bowl still disappointed me. It reminded me of the cafeteria Mexican Grill in my college dining hall. People rave about the huge portions here, but what's the point if it's no good? I'd rather pay a a little more for a smaller serving of REAL Mexican food.
author: Linda T.

description:
What can I say? Sometimes Chipotle just tastes good. Order a Burrito Bowl and you can be so lazy that you don't even have to hold up your taco or burrito. Just stick in all in a bowl and use a fork. Their guac is worth the extra $1.50.

The only problem with this location is the lunch rush. I'd only eat here if I was eating after 1:15.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
What can I say - it's Che-polt-lay. 

You know what you are gunna get whenever you walk in to any chipootle. It's just like a subway, or any McDonalds (who owns them). 

Decently clean place in soma, and a clean bathroom. People there were friendly - but I doubt I'll go back if there is anything else close by that's open. :)
author: David N.

description:
Dearest Chipotle,

When I wait in line for 25 minutes for steak tacos with avocado, then pay you nearly $10 for them, I don't want them served unpleasantly ice cold.  Thanks for your attention.

- B.L.
author: B L.

description:
Yes, Chipotle is a chain but this location has ample seating for lunch rush in the financial district. They have outdoor seating and indoor seating available at the peak of the lunch hour (i.e. noon). The line isn't as long as the one on Market street and 1st location but they don't move as fast as them either.

Overall, I am a fan of Chipotle for my burrito bowl cravings. Their ingredients are always free and Barbacoa is always yummy.
author: Eva Y.

description: Decent food but the employees really need to clean up the tables for new customers. I've been to this location a few times and the tables are filthy! Get it to go and eat it at your desk!
author: Phi Li J.

description:
I wanted to give this place 4 stars but i'll get to why I only gave it 3.
It's decent Mexican FAST FOOD. Please note I said FAST FOOD not authentic Mexican stuff. 
It's tasty, it's reasonably priced, and there's plenty of room for me to sit. Tons of students from Academy of Art, they are interesting to people watch. 
I like to sit there and wonder about what kind of beautiful (or strange) art they make.
Anyway. I wanted to give it 4 stars but my friend found a twisty tie in his burrito. That was a bit unnerving. Instead of comping his meal, they gave him a certificate good for $1 toward his next purchase. 

right, that'll totally keep him going.

ehhh actually it will, he goes to school right across the street..
author: Susy C.

description:
I go to the Academy of Art right next to this Chipotle, so it's a convenient place to just walk down the block and grab a burrito when I'm starving to death (since I usually can't finish one of these burritos, I only eat one when I'm dying hungry, which is actually quite often).

No matter what time I go here, the servers here are always friendly and funny. Very down to earth guys! It depends on what I feel that day, but I sometimes order my burrito without beans (yes, I'm one of THOSE people), so it's funny whenever the servers give me this weird look for just getting rice.

They get a huge plus, however, for making my burrito super huge time after time! Not that I can ever finish a Chipotle burrito in one sitting regardless of how big it is, but it makes for a good second meal later during the day. I always feel like I got my money's worth, which is never a bad thing. [: (Hay, I'm Chinese, go figure.)
author: Judy Z.

description:
The Chipotle burrito has about as much in common with a traditional burrito as does the peanut butter sandwich I had for lunch.  And I have never met a saltier food.  I mean, Utah called and they want their lake back.  Seriously, I had Chipotle for dinner about 6 hours ago and have consumed at least 8 glasses of water since.

But here's the thing: I'm good for at least one stop here every couple weeks because (1) they are open until 9pm when every other quick eating establishment in SOMA has been long closed and (2) I'm mesmerized their efficiency -- these guys run a well oiled machine behind the counter.

So now if you'll excuse me, I need a glass of water.
author: Geoff D.

description:
I confess, I came back.  I was craving a burrito, and the two Mexican places near my office manage to be worse than Chipotle.

I also figured out why this location does so well.  At $6, a burrito here is $2-3 less than a burrito at the "other" burrito places, and there are plenty of cash-strapped art students up and down the street.
author: dan s.

description:
After working out at 24 hours, my two friends and I were starving...we were walking around trying to figure out where to eat at, since last night the weather was pretty nice. We stumbled upon Chipotle. BURRITO after a work out hahaha...sure why not, it has all the essentials. ( rice, beans, meat, sour cream, guac, salsa, etc) haha What more can you ask for. 

Walk in and we see this HOT guy haha. Nice eye candy is always good. Anyways he takes our order and we sit down. All three of us agree...HOT! 

Cheap, good food, great eye candy! Love this place! Will be back on Mondays at 7:30pm just to see if our eye candy is still there. :)
author: Sandy L.

description: It must have been training day behind the counter this afternoon.There were 5 people struggling to make burritos poorly, but hey, I can live with that. What was not acceptable was when I asked one of the kids how they prepare the beans (because they tasted like meat), he said: "I really don't know. I'm not the person to ask." When I responded, "Who would be the person to ask?"; he replied, "I would google it." CUSTOMER SERVICE FAIL...teach employees how to interact properly with the public, not just make burritos.
author: Maggie F.

description: I don't know why, but I'm a fan of Chipotle. The ingredients are fresh and tasty. I usually get a steak burrito bowl with all the salsas, yes all of them. This particular Chipotle is fairly generous with their portions. I don't get beans and most other locations give me the same amount of rice, so it looks like I only got half an order, but this one fills up my bowl with rice. The only bad part is that the line can be long here.
author: Adelina W.

description: best healthy food, the line could be long even when they open up, but this is most healty food you can get close to busy streets
author: Art R.

description:
Like most of the reviews here say, this location is so incredibly stingy by Chipotle standards.  Their burritos are more like "enhanced taquitos".  If you ask for a bit more beans or meat they look at you like you just killed their puppy.  Or you pay an extra $2.50 for more meat and then you're ALMOST at the size of a standard Chipotle burrito at other locations.

I've been going to Chipotle for probably eight years and I'm from southern California so I've probably been to 50 locations by now.   Normally I can split their bowls/burritos in half and get two meals out of it, but the stuff here isn't even enough for one meal.  Like the other reviews say, it's all rice and no meat.

Bottom line, this place is garbage.  The portions and amount of meat get smaller and smaller every time.  It's a complete ripoff.  I know it's not the workers' fault, they're probably just doing what they're instructed to do.  But seriously, take your business elsewhere.
author: Jeff S.

description:
In most cities, Chipotle might get 4 stars. In San Francisco, with delicious burritos everywhere, even 3 is a stretch.

They're fast. Really, really fast. Every other taqueria should take a lesson from Chipotle in efficiency.

Other than that, it's pretty standard food. It's good. You know what you're getting if you walk into a Chipotle anywhere in the world.
author: Ben B.

description: I am healthy eater i thought their food is healthy because hormones free yesterday i had their food since then i'm so sick with the Migran headache and i was throwing up because their food was so salty when i call them and complain about it their manager said their tofu is already made it and they deliver it to them my blood pressure it gone to the roof i thought i'm going have a heartache. just be carful people their food it is not healthy.
author: Maryam K.

description:
This place earns 4 stars because the staff here is ridiculously pleasant.  The place is always packed and yet everyone that works here smiles from ear to ear and still manage to get those burritos made at lightning speed.  Subway on 2nd, please take a look at the staff here and revise your 'tudes accordingly.

The burrito bowls are pretty cheap, crazy filling and I don't feel they're clogging my arteries and adding (another) layer to my mid-section.

Yay Chipotle!  Props to the staff!  Minus one star because I like quac in my bowl and that costs waaaaaaaaay more than it should.  $1.75?  Bitch, we're in a recession...
author: Evan L.

description: Nice food, but, the overflow smoke from cooking gets into financial center buildings.  Really really awful.
author: David B.

description:
[ + ]

This particular Chipotle assembles their burritos with unparalleled alacrity.

Quality of ingredients is consistent with other Chipotles.

Facility receives a ton of foot traffic yet is immaculately clean .

Burrito bowls are awesome.

Their guacamole must have been given to humanity by the gods.

[ - ]

Though the burritos are delicious, they have a very generic, popularized taste.

Since the burritos are so massive, consuming a whole one begets you about 1,900 calories.
author: Peter T.

description:
After living in the heart of the Mission for a few years, I developed a slow, easy addiction to taqueria food. Anything with pico de gallo was fair game and tasted like it was straight from someone's Mexican grandmother's kitchen.

Still, I find myself at Chipotle more often than I care to admit for a somewhat healthy lunch downtown. With a dirth of Mexican food options in the FiDi, sometimes it feels like the only place to go for cheap-ish and healthy and spicy.

I like to order the vegetarian tacos with all of the fixins. Wait, is sour cream bad for you? Oh well. *sigh*
author: Nicole G.

description: I finally gave in to the peer pressure and tried the Chipotle burrito. While it is not a true burrito it is a healthy alternative.  After consuming the steak burrito with guacamole, I did not feel as though I had eaten a greasy burrito. In fact I felt as though I ate something that was good for me. Sure, it did not taste the way a normal burrito does, but I would not hesitate to eat this again if a true taqueria was not in close proximity to me.
author: Marty M.

description: This place has the worse customer service ever!! This is not a fast food place so the servers need to slow down when making the orders and actually listen to what the customer is asking for!! There is no reason why I should have to repeat my order 3 times if you would just listen. I'm making sure that all my friends, family and co-workers do not go to this chipotle ever again!! Rude ass workers!!
author: Venise W.

description: They were very friendly here, not busy when i went in, couldn't get parking so my hubby drove round twice!! Clean, quite, they were a bit skimpy with the nachos! not many at all but still my barbacoa burrito won yet again, this place is the bomb! Won't bother with chips next time though.
author: Rachael S.

description:
In the spirit of keepin' it local for lunch today, I decided to get a chicken burrito from Chipotle. For $5.50, you get a burrito that's the size of a brick. I can only ever eat half of it, if that. The hot salsa is really good, and is actually one of the few spicy sauces that make my eyes water while I eat it. For another $2, you can get some tasty chips and guac!

The perfect sized burrito for me? A chicken fiesta burrito from Taco Bell, of course!
author: Connie C.

description:
This shouldn't even be an issue when reviewing a place, but FYI...McDonald's divested from Chipotle in 2006. (Now for all you kids out there, "divested" means that they longer invested in Chipotle.) It was never McDonald's creation, they simply bought into it to make a McBuck.

Anyway, the only thing I ever order here is the barbacoa burrito and I think it's pretty good considering the fact that I prefer to eat Mexican food from taco trucks. 

But what I really like are the bottles of Smoked Chipotle Tabasco. It's the perfect condiment and a really cheesy "coincidence."
author: Arnold G.

description: I wish I could give this place zero stars!! I used the chipotle ordering app and paid in advance so I could get my food and go...when I went to the cashier to pick it up  she told me to wait 5-10 min there was a line. WTH was the point of ordering in advanced then? So I wait around for my food and the other cashier asks me if I needed help...I told her I ordered online a f what do you know, my food was right there at the counter....BAD customer service thanks just wasted half my lunch
author: Alexis S.

description:
This review is really regarding a lame moment. 

I made my order off the iPhone app, I thought, Cool. It's easy. 

And it was. When I got there, I went to the pickup station, clearly said, "I ordered online. Name is Scott."

Manager guy turns around, yells through kitchen door, while I could see a woman shaking her head, 'no' - which clearly meant it wasn't ready. I had placed the order 20 minutes before.  She gives him a piece of paper - clearly my order.  

Manager turns to me and says, "We've had a problem with our online orders today; basically when that happens, they go through as a fax."

(I'm thinking -- what does that REALLY mean?)

Then, with my order print-out, he turns to his staff and tells them to give me my order now. "It's on the house today."  He give me a cup for a drink, and I go to fill it. He walks over a minute later with my order in a to-go bag, again apologizing. He says something -again - this time about the wireless being down.  

I say, I understand, since I work in tech, too-- though his explanation was clearly not making sense.  How could they not get my order when he clearly had the printout in hand when I arrived?

So, the girl I saw earlier comes forward, and says, "I'm sorry, I didn't see your order before. "

Long pause. The manager turns red, and I glared at him and said, "Thanks again."

Now, I'm not sure why he felt like he had to lie about it, but it was totally unnecessary.  I'm giving this place a rating of three, and that's for the generous (and correctly done) free food, and the iPhone app, and the fact that it is still good food, but the little slip-up by this store wasn't necessary.  

They could keep a better eye on incoming web orders.  That's all.
author: Scott R.

description:
I'm torn. If you had asked me about this place before my lovely co-workers/foodies/anti-big corporation friends told me that this place was owned by McDonald's, I would have said... "Hey, I like that place. I'll give them three stars and probably head back there for lunch in a couple of weeks. After all, they serve a pretty good chicken taco yo!"

And they do have good soft tacos. And I will give them three stars -- even though their food can be a bit salty at times. Truth is,  I'd eat there again if I was in a pinch. 

But I have to say... the more I learn about companies like McDonald's  (only THE largest consumer of beef in the world), the more I start to feel uneasy about eating at Chipolte. I grew up on Mc D's (blech) but after reading Fast Food Nation - I've stopped eating there. 

mmmHMM anyone ready for a Big Mac?
author: Stephanie I.

description:
You can judge me all you want for liking this place.

The Barbacoa Hard Tacos with everything on them. 
                                                               A dream.

Have a Chipotle Good day!
author: Richard T.

description:
Chipotle, I heart you.  

You move fast and I like that.  A lot. 

Although people tell us we shouldn't be together (because you're owned by McDonald's and I'm owned by healthy arteries) I am still torn. 

I visited you at first, you see, when I wasn't aware you were a chain.  I found out the hard way, after emailing Mike in Atlanta to tell him about this awesome fast-food Mexican place by my work. 

And then he broke my heart.  He told me that you've been around, Chipotle, and tons of people know you intimately.  In fact, he said you have girls in all major cities. What the frak?  

Unfortunately, I can't cut you off.  BUT, I can limit my visits. 

Salad with chicken, pinto beans, lettuce, and mild tomato salsa.  *Sigh*

Those words melt my heart.
author: Janney B.

description:
WHAT? I'm sorry I can't hear you over the blaring non-Mexican music.

Food: ehhh...

Chips: yummy!

Atmosphere: Bite me.
author: Patrick G.

description:
ZOMG, yeah that's right I added the Z. I have been to multiple Chipotles and I am always in orgasmic bliss. I started out with their Tacos, delicious, then switch to Burritos, Heaven, then Burrito Bowl Heaven with Honey,honey. I cannot have anything without Guacamole though but I must say I hate that the Guac is so pricey but it is worth the 1.25 extra. Also their chips and dip is amazeballs. 
The service has always been good and I can always find a place to sit and stuff my face.
 I once lived of chipotle for a week, not even kidding!
author: Tori B.

description:
Disclaimer:
I own Chiptole stock. So be forewarned, I'm biased.

Disclaimer #2: 
If you're looking for authentic mexican, stop reading.

Disclaimer #3:
I'm Japanese, I like soy sauce, I like salt. This food is salty. Hence, I like the food (they call this the transitive property of grubbery, elementary school math people...)

Positives
The In-N-Out of burritos, you basically pick from four selections. Burrito, Quesadilla, Burrito Bol (Burrito without the Tortilla), or Taco. And yet, people still can't decide what they want.

Then you make another massive decision. What type of meat.

I mean this place isn't rocket science. It's not authentic. But the quality of their produce and meat is great, they support small farmers, who use organic products (although I've heard some stuff about the tomato farmers?). Chipotle is a chain that is everything Fast Food Nation is not. 

Btw, their hot sauce is to die for. In fact, my stomach is dying from it now. And I'll probably be hating myself later, but it always seems like a good idea at the time.

Negative
If you don't like salty food, don't go here. Everything has salt. The rice, the chicken, the beef, the hot salsa, the medium salsa, the corn, I mean you take a look at the sodium content on a burrito and you'll probably die of a heart attack just by seeing it. But hey, I'm Japanese and we love our soy sauce, so I'm cool with a 5000% daily content sodium kind of meal. 

Ambiance
Uh... it's a fast food restaurant. What were you expecting? Candlelight?

Service
Uh... it's a fast food restaurant. What were you expecting? Them to fill up your coke when it's empty?

Dunno what else to say. I own the stock. I'm biased. I like salty foods. They are everything Fast Food Nation is not. I like their burritos (if it didn't split my stomach in half, as massive as they are). So sue me.

PS: I'd say I like this place better than Baja Fresh. Non-authentic Mexican food lovers, bring on the hate mail!!! I hear that the Baja Fresh vs. Chiptole war is pretty intense! Stand back people!
author: Seiji N.

description:
It is good when you are craving chipotle... otherwise don't let this place fix your burrito craving.  Drive into the mission for that.


High quality meats is a plus and the rice is pretty good but all together it just tastes too much like mcdonalds... oopps did I say that out loud?

yea pretty much good for a quick huge bite.
author: Shawn A.

description:
This is probably one of the best places downtown to grab a "quick" lunch. I am amazing at how quickly they serve people here and maintain a decent level of quality. Most mexican places make me feel like I'm eating the most unhealthy food but Chipotle does a good job of trying to keep the fat content down to a minimum.

For those of you still dumb enough to be on the Atkins' Diet you can have a Burrito Bol (burrito without the tortilla). They do taste pretty good and the main reason I get them is because they're easier to eat when you're trying to get some work done.

Some people at work seem to think I eat here too much but what can I say, it's good, it's quick and it's close to work.
author: Bryan B.

description:
Yes, it's a chain, and as a San Franciscan, I'm supposed to hate chains. Yes, McDonald's has [now it's had] an interest in Chipotle, though not a controlling one, and we all know that McDonald's is destroying America (or at least making us fat). No, it's not in the Mission, and the Mission is cool (except for the gentrified parts). So why don't I hate Chipotle?

Well, first, the burritos are tasty. They're a heck of a lot better than the ones that come from the Embarcadero branch of Pancho Villa (granted that might be damning with faint praise). Second, they serve succulent free range carnitas. Third, the barbacoa - a spicy beef - is a great option.

I'm not claiming it's authentic. I'm not claiming it's healthy to eat giant burritos (but if you think that the super burritos in the Mission are much healthier than the ones at Chipotle, you're deluding yourself). I'm just saying the food is good, and having a nationwide chain source its free range pork from family farms is a good thing.
author: Timothy O.

description:
Wow...really? Is it COOL to hate on Chipotle now? I mean, the place is pristine & immaculate. The countertops are shiny, the employees are cheerful, & the clientele are successful-looking ladies & germs who work in the neighborhood.

Note that I used the word "germs". That s comehould stand out, especially after I just spoke of how clean the place is. That said, I wouldn't doubt the quality of their food.

Are their burritos going to stand up to an independently-run Mission hole-in-the-wall burrito joint featuring a generations-long family recipe & freshly made on-location ingredients? Probably not (though you'll note I DID say "probably", because although we're famous for our mom & pop burrito joints, there are some shite ones in this town, too).

But this is NOT the McDonalds of burrito joints. That's insulting to the title holder (hello Del Taco?...please, people...let's be real).

While I'm not immune to hating on corporate food chains, I usually do so for good reasons: i.e. the food is disgusting, the place is filthy, & the service is shit. I don't generally hate on a place for the sole reason that it happens to be a chain. That's like me walking up to you in the street & telling you that I know exactly what People Like You are made of, & I don't like the cut of your jib.

Again, if you want to say I'm selling out to Big Burrito, go for it. When Chipotle is my local burrito option come lunchtime, I'm not going to decry their (delicious) food or lose any sleep over eating there.
author: Pete J.

description:
Used to eat there once a week at the one downtown SF until a chicken burrito landed my friend and I sick for a couple weeks. We called and they apologized, but offering up free burritos just doesn't do anything for me.

Crazy how they're getting so much positive publicity from Oprah this week - but yet you can find thousands of 'food poisoning Chipotle' results in Google - Ah... yes... the millions of dollars they make can afford them a first rate PR team!
author: John S.

description: If you live in SF you have no excuse to eat here, seriously. The meat is over salted, the salsa isn't any good, and the guac isn't fresh. The Mission is only a short BART ride away. Please do yourself a favor, ride to 16th and Mission, walk to 19th and drop into Taqueria Cancun.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
HMMM? Quick Mexian Food? It sounds good in theory but the food falls short at Chipotle.

I had been hearing from Co-Workers about this location for several months now and had yet to stop in for a bite. 

I was feeling hungry today and decided to stop by for some mexican food. 

The location is convenient to work so it allowed  me to stop in very quickly. The food arrived quickly but  were out of chicken and gave me the steak instead. Not my preference but I didnt have the time to wait for the chicken to be ready. They also forgot to ring up my drink order so I had to go back up for a drink.

The food was not terrible. It was average. I had the burrito loaded and it was ok. Nothing to write home about though. 

Its one of those places that makes for a quick lunch stop if you are hungry in the SOMA for a burrito.
author: Adam B.

description:
Chipotle. Always my last choice for a burrito down town, but I still go back from time to time....to time.
The burritos are so big I usually don't finish them (that is a plus) but I usually try to which usually results in food coma and or stomach ache. The steak is marinated in some sort of insane hot sauce that tastes like fire. But that is why I add the sour cream and guacamole to even it out. However the way the burrito is made isn't conducive to the melding of the spicy and the creamy. If only they took the time to mix it up a little more! But alas, it's not. Since the burrito is so big I take a bite of one side ...the fire side. And try to as fast as I can take a bite from the quac and sour cream side to even out the burning in my mouth. But once I do all the flavor is gone, so I go back and forth from extreme to extreme.

If you are a student (or still have your student ID that passes) you can get a drink for free. And they are insanely quick and theres usually seating, even if you have to wait for a couple minutes. It's not all that bad, but ...its not all that great either. But..I'll probably go back.
author: Whitney F.

description:
I love Mexican food but I despise fresh cilantro: the only thing in the world that I refuse to eat - ever. Chipotle's rice comes mixed with cilantro, they don't have any other kind of rice and they won't make you any without cilantro, which makes it impossible for me to get a burrito here. A burrito without rice is a watery, far less satisfying mess. The tacos are alright if you can prevent them from throwing a mess of cilantro on them. 

I think what bugs me about this place isn't that they're obsessed with cilantro, but that I take that fact as a sign that they're just a trendy, California-style Mexican chain. I've been to Mexico and eaten in local places and it isn't nearly as prevalent as some trendy Mexican places would have you believe. There's far, far better Mexican places in the city that offer a lot more choice about what goes into your food and even a few around Soma. Why come here? I dunno.
author: Kristina A.

description: Chipotle is great. This particular Chipotle most definitely is NOT. I came in well after the lunch rush and there were only 1 or 2 other customers. There were 5 or 6 employees standing around talking with each other, none of them very eager to take my order. After standing at the counter for a good minute one of them finally offers to take my order. Given Chipotle's basic menu this should be pretty easy, right? I order the crunchy tacos, which of course, they're out of. A taco restaurant without taco shells? Really?
author: Ben P.

description:
Peer Pressure.

We all learned in our youngster days that giving into peer pressure is never a good idea. Here, have a sip of this Boones Strawberry Hill, it's good. Here, have a drag off this clove cigarette, it's smooth. Here, come to Chipotle for lunch cuz all the cool office kids are doing it. Dammit, peer pressure led me to a bad place once again.

Chipotle. Good God, I'd sooner take a bubble bath with my father than ever eat here again. I tried the 4 crispy taco combo and ordered one of every animal in an effort to make as complete a review as possible and while it was "okay" going down, it was the aftermath that sucked a big ole tail pipe.

Sodium. This is the key ingredient here, and I swear after eating my 4 combo dealio, I felt like a bloated whale for the remainder of the day and night. That is just wrong. I couldn't even take my rings off! At least with McDonald's you know what you are getting and it doesn't make me swell up like a salt cured clown, but oh well, live and learn, peer pressure ain't cool. So um, don't do drugs and definitely don't do Chipotle!

What I will give this place is light speed service. I have never seen a meal thrown together that fast in my life. So if you are in search of a quick n crappy lunch. Here ya go!
author: Stephy S.

description:
When I lived on Geary, I'd go to one of those "real" Mex places -- where they know exactly how to roll a burrito. Chipotle seems like the hygienic version of one of those places -- and kinda corporate too. But I like it.

The amount of chips they give (if you ask) is ridiculous (and also comes in a nice brown bag!). They charge extra (1.40?) for guacamole, which is stupid, but hey, I'm not much of a fan so I'm fine. I find it funny sometimes to see them roll the burrito because they don't seem to know what they're doing -- while it's funny to see, it's annoying when you actually eat it because that's when you realize that if you don't roll it well, the stuffing gets messed up.

Oh, and this ain't no Taco Bell. Thank God for that.

I'll end by saying I'd still prefer the friendly mex place (the name of which I can't remember) up on Geary, but I don't mind this place at all.
author: Premshree P.

description: Long lines at 1:30. It's SF lunch rush. It's good food. These guys know how to turn a line. I am a fan. Usually takes 10 minutes with 20+ people ahead of me. Customer service is good and my food always comes out the same. Consistency is important to me.
author: Reid R.

description:
I know there's a chance that it might be unpopular to say this, but, "This is my most favorite f***ing burrito place in the WORLD!". 

This place started out local and it was so good they decided to go big and share the goodness. I know. I have a friend from Colorado who used to talk about Chipotle incessantly when they were his local place. Drove me crazy. I was like, no way, dude, Baja Fresh is the best. Now that I know that truth, I say, "So what" if McDonald's is the funder. Chipotle clearly has their own committment to quality and their vision is still cut from the same cloth that made them successful in the beginning.  Isn't that every small businesses' dream? Get big and stay true to your own vision. 

And I haven't even mentioned the food yet. Let me just say, that if there is such a thing, I'm a 2/3rds vegetarian or a 1/3rd meatarian. I occassionally enjoy some type of good quality meat in my diet but it's pretty easy for some wayward piece of grizzle to turn me away from a meat dish. Chipotle's meat is amazing. I crave their Carnitas and Barbacoa. Their pork comes from small farms in Iowa where they don't feed the pigs antibiotics or hormones. Pretty progressive for a fast food joint.
author: Kelly S.

description:
After a night of drinking w/ friends and checking out guys the only place on Montgomery to grab a quick bite is here. 

I'm making this review just as bland as the food I ate.
author: Jay H.

description:
Chipotle is a great chain but this location is sub par. Good burritos can be had here but I have gotten several bad wraps and some overly apathetic service. Other locations are much better, but I wouldn't pass this place up if I was looking for some quick mexican food downtown.

So I am not clear on all the facts here but let me explain this a bit. Chipotle was expanded by McDonalds but McDonalds left most business decisions and all restaurant decisions to the guys who originally started Chipotle out in Colorado. I hate McDonalds, but I do love Chipotle.
author: Sven S.

description:
Food/quality:
I definitely don't go to Chipotle for authentic mexican because it is far from it. I like to believe that it is a healthy american version, although it is packed with calories. With that said, I do enjoy frequenting the chain when I am hungry and want something inexpensive. Although I usually thoroughly enjoy the steak fajita burrito, at this particular location it did not live up to its usual quality. The peppers were crunchy as usual, something I enjoy. However, the whole burrito just tasted a bit off. 

Service/Atmosphere: 
I cannot comment on service or atmosphere this time as a friend of mine was nice enough to grab a takeout order for me.

Value: 
Overall, it is a great value for the type and quality of food that you receive in an order.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
The menu is small, which to me means they can really focus on the things/items they do have, and make sure they're great.

When I come here, I get the chicken burrito bowl.  Love the corn salsa.  Great place to come for a quick bite that can be as healthy as you'd like, or not so healthy (cheese, sour cream, beer).  Of course, I choose the not so healthy, but so what?
author: Sarah F.

description: There should be a trap door at the front of the line for Chipotle that opens into a pit of fire if you take too long to order your burrito! Kidding. You know there is always going to be a line, it's Chipotle. The service is fast here and the staff is really cool. I usually go for the burrito bowl with chips, comes out to be $10. The bowl is very filling and tasty. Go to walgreens and buy your own avocado for $1.69, guacamole is $2 extra. Otherwise, go for the burritos. Given there's not that much good and cheap Mexican around, Chipotle will always be a solid choice.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
I know that it's Chipotle and it is a huge chain with a billion locations. So as far as the food goes... it's just like every other Chipotle I have been to; fresh food, large portions and decent prices. 

BUT, the outstanding service that I have always received at this particular location is what makes this one my favorite. Every time I have been to this Chipotle, the lines move super fast and every employee is extremely polite, friendly and happy. I usually place online orders and right when I walk in to pick it up, someone is there to help me and get my order, no matter how busy the restaurant is. One time, I even came 10 minutes early to pick up my order and they gave me a free soda while I was waiting. :) Thanks Chipotle!
author: Shannon E.

description:
I sometimes feel weird about writing reviews for chain restaurants, since I think Yelp really shines for independent and smaller establishments, but I wanted to add Chipotle to my SoMa Lunch list.

We ordered a 20+ order for my company online.  The process was simple, the interface for ordering online was slick, and everyone got what they wanted.  I submitted the order and Chipotle called me within 5 minutes to confirm the order and said it would be ready in 35 minutes.  Well, it took well over an hour for them to complete the order, so I was waiting in Chipotle with a coworker for an extra 40 or so minutes.

The office didn't get to eat until 1:45, which is not the end of the world, but I was aiming for a 12:30 office lunch.  I wish Chipotle delivered.  Any good Tex-Mex restaurants that deliver to the SoMa area?

The lunch lines seem pretty long for Chipotle- my advice:  Call ahead your order, skip the lines.  You'll be happy that you did.  (Chipotle has their entire menu online, so it's easy to figure out what you want: http://www.chipotle.com/#flash/food_menu)
author: Jason R.

description:
I like Burritos.  In fact, you could say I love 'em. 

That's why I tend to avoid Chipotle.

If you really loved hamburgers, somehow I doubt you'd eat at Burger King to satisfy for your burger cravings.  And that's my almost pointless analogy for why I don't eat here.
author: Shawn S.

description:
Whatever secret juice Quizos uses to make my stomach feel like it's fighting the Spanish Armada must be a trade secret that they share with Chipotle.    

In my mind it's hard to get excited about burritos essentially made by McDonalds (soon to change though as McDonald's divests its stock ownership).

The burritos aren't terrible (other than that stomach thing but I'm open to the fact that my tummy is tender) but they just taste manufactured to me. 

Two stars because, well, it's food and it'll do in a pinch.  Judging by the ginormous line out the door every day between 12-1 PM I could be  in the minority on this one unless there is some mind control device in operation.  

We have to consider the possibilities.
author: Steve B.

description: I give chipotle crap for being so boring. But I do have to say they are consistent and fast. I have seen this location take down a wrapping around the door and alley way lunch crowd without breaking a sweat. This location has a business card drop where if your business card gets picked you get a free burrito for everyone at your company (not sure how often this deal is run). I mean who doesn't want a free burrito for lunch? I haven't seen this at any other chipotle so I will give them an extra star for that.
author: Greg G.

description: The best thing when your starving is the burrito bowl. I would never eat meat from a chain, so get the veggie and they give you free guacamole to compensate for not getting meat.
author: Moises T.

description: Chipotle hits the spot when I just need a break from heavy Mexican food.  I ordered tacos and much to my surprise it was actually pretty good.  Not authentic Mexican but at least I didn't feel fat and bloated afterwards.
author: Michelle T.

description:
I used to go to chipotle alot - even 2-3 times a week cuz I loved the flavors, freshness, salsas and the lime-flavored nachos - but eventually got tired of it and it's been 3 years since my last visit...... and then today, after seeing all the chipotle ads and posters around (yep, all that advertising does work!) i decided to visit this Chipotle on New Montgomery.  

When I walked in, it felt like coming home b/c the place looked the same but there were some new things that weren't there before like the calorie ranges for each item on the menu - wow isn't that an eye opener!  I ordered a carne asada burrito and was first surprised the server guy only gave me a HALF serving spoonful of meat which was like 7-8 chunks of meat for the whole burrito so I thought they cut down on the burrito size so I moved down the ingredient and salsa bar line but then 3 guys came in after me and they each got 3 heaping servings of chicken for each of their burritos!  They were all overflowing with meat!!!

So does this place now discriminate against women by giving us smaller servings of meat and ingredients???  It's not as if the guys ordered larger size burritos - there isn't a super size option on the menu.  

I then asked the cashier if chips came with the burrito and she said you have to pay extra and order a side of chips - I said oh we used to get some chips with the burrito but would order a side order if we wanted more.  She said they've never given free chips with food before, which I know to be wrong because I used to be a frequent visitor at this location and around the country.  So she obviously hasn't worked there or eaten there very long.  Even if I had liked the food, I wouldn't go back because of her snippy attitude.  

Now I'm looking at the yelp reviews and see many others have complained about the smaller portions and change in quality of the ingredients and poor service.   So at least they're consistent I guess.  

Only bright spot is that b/c I got a small size burrito, it definitely had to be on the low end of the calorie range!  

Sorry to see how far Chipotle has fallen.  I will definitely NOT go back and will post this on Facebook and tell everyone about my sub-par experience.  

Everyone should go to Tropisueno on Yerba Buena Lane instead - much better food, many more menu options, fresher ingredients, good service - everyone there is happy and smiles at you, and a well-stocked self service salsa bar.
author: kristy l.

description:
ok so i finally got a chance to try chipotle...at first i wasn't sure about eating a taco from a place owned by McDonald's, but it's not that bad.  So at first I was scared of the menu because it was very minimal...i thought i had to order four instead of one soft taco...but i did, so i got what i wanted.  A small soft taco with black beans and everything on it...it did the job of fulfilling my Mexican food fix. The chips are lightly lime flavored...I didn't really like it, i felt like i was eating seasoning...like Doritos or something. Tortilla chips are good b/c they're not supposed to have all that seasoning crap on it.  
I'll probably end up going back b/c my school is pretty close to it, but for the most part i feel i would hold out for Le Mexicana on Sutter St.
author: Sloane G.

description:
For the last goddamn time:

They are not owned by McDonalds.
Their share was divested a good bit ago.
You are, in fact, going crazy.



..whew. thank you. Oh, and Paul from "The Wonder Years" didn't become Marilyn Manson, either. But my smart friend told me so it must be true, duh duh duh..
author: Nik B.

description: I love this place! The only issue i have is they put WAY too much rice in my burrito even though i order them to take it easy on the rice and add more beans instead.  They don't really listen to me.  Anyway its way better than Baja Fresh, taco bell & Del Taco. I wish they'd make one in Sonoma County, though there's one in San Rafael but still that's pretty far from here. This store is really crowded but there's this guy on his little order machine who orders for the people in line so we get our food once we get in front, luckily we've always had a place to sit.  I love their tacos and quesadillas tho, i usually order those instead of a burrito now.
author: Nikki S.

description:
Chipotle is pretty much has really good burritos. It is like fast food, but actually really good and they get it all ready really fast. What I like the most here is the service. There waitress who was cleaning the table and stuff. She was really nice. Offered me salsa with my chips even though I didn't want any. And, she cleaned up after me and brought me napkins. I kind of felt like i was at a regular restaurant and not a fast food place. 

Service = great!
author: Jimmy H.

description:
YUCK, Chipotle is horrible. I ate here once and then nearly chipotle'ed in my pants on the bus. My skin must have been green. What are those nasty seasonings all the meats are covered in?

I tried this again to be fair a year later. It was so nasty that all I wound up doing nothing but picking off the cheese and throwing the rest away. YUCK.

It was true that McDonald's DID own Chipotle, but no longer does as of 2006. However, if you ask me, McDonald's at least has their awesome breakfast biscuits and hash browns, and Chipotle just has its nasty bunkus-tasting burritos.
author: Heidi G.

description: I just freaking love chopotle. Its really fresh. One stars off because of the small portions. I usually have to buy two items.
author: James M.

description: They offer a student discount here so if you have an ID take advantage of that.  Otherwise, the food is pretty much average.  If you're in a hurry though and you don't want TacoBell, this is a pretty good substitute.
author: Amy J.

description:
I hate that this is next to my school becuase I always run into people I know.
There are few things that are less beautiful to ingest than a burrito.
And I always eat the whole thing.
And chips.
It's not pretty.

But that doesn't deter me, because the food tastes really good. I think people that say the food is back are just wishing it tasted bad because they're so evil and corporate. 

So, yeah. In SF we have more options than I used to when I discovered Chipotle. I used to make a half mile trek to one during my lunch hour...in my hyundai...in Cincinnati...where I worked at Tri-County mall. Those were the good old days. And now, eating here and smelling it on myself for the rest of the day brings me back to those happier times.
author: Penelope C.

description:
She cracked my taco.  I have eaten there a few times, but it seems to have gone down hill lately.  I ordered four hard tacos with four different types of meat.  There's something about a crispy taco shell that when you bite into it, it doesn't break into a million pieces in your hand.  It's so hard to find good taco shells at your local grocery store to DIY, so I have to resort to fast food places to get my fix.    Anyway, I digress.

While the person was making my tacos, she cracked one of my taco shells in half while she was trying to force the meat into the shell.  She knew she cracked the shell too, but continued to make it.  When I brought it up, she tossed the broken shell away and replaced it.  After a few more seconds, she stopped and just walked away.  Someone else had to finish making my tacos.
