At the end, the four tacos looked like a mass produced thing with lettuce and cheese sprinkled over the top of all four tacos.   The tacos lacked individuality.

Another problem I have is that when you check-out and want to order a  drink from the fridge behind the cashier, it's almost impossible to read the labels on the bottles to see what flavor is what.
author: Chris W.

description:
I'm so mad at myself.  I hate Chipotle, always have.  Seriously it is nothing close to Mexican food.  And they can't even make a good generic burrito!  One bite is all meat, one bite is all rice, one bite is all guac.  Gross.

I decided I wanted Chipotle last Friday because I was hung over.  I ate most of it...because I was hung over.  What a waste.

I gave them 2 stars because they have a well oiled machine goin on there (thank you McDonald's), clean and efficient.  Props to Ray Crock...
author: Angela S.

description: I love Chipotle, but this place is stingy. I asked for extra rice one time and the lady looked at me like I just killed her child. How's she gonna get mad over some Chipotle rice that ain't even hers? She still works there and every time I see her I make sure to ask for extra rice. ;)
author: Angelo T.

description: This Chipotle is the closest to my work and im lazy so i go here when i want a fix. The taste is better than a few Chipotle in the city.  However their portions are smaller and if you ask for anything out of the norm like extra this or that get ready for death stares.
author: Adrienne C.

description:
Enjoy burritos w/ corn salsa while looking at art-school-confidential girls. This place is like my backyard cause of all the BIRD WATCHING.

i hate myself.
author: Steven H.

description:
Why settle for crappy "Mexican" food when there are so many better places around the city?  Okay, if you happen o work a few doors down from this place and need a quick lunch then (and ONLY then) I would allow you to eat at Chipotle.  Once a month.  Other than that, why even bother?  Sure, where else can you walk the buffet-style line and freely choose what ingredients you want in your burrito or taco?  But then again, where else can you eat at a Mexican restaurant owned by McDonalds?  Only Chipotle.  The  food is good - not great - and isn't overpriced.  Therefore, I give it 3 / 5. 

This place is loud, usually crowded during the afternoon business lunch rush, and seating is usually limited.
author: Scott G.

description:
Not authentic like the mission, but this is one good healthy burrito. 

When DO WE EAT
author: Robert M.

description:
I'm with the honest good people on this one.  This burrito is the best tasting I think I've ever had.  But yes, it is a very different burrito.

Most of the bad ratings state that it's not authentic or that it's owned by McDonald's as their reason for disliking it.  Well, I agree with both statements, it's not real Mexican and it is owned by a corporation, but shit... it's good eats.
author: Jesse F.

description: order taker actually eating food while taking my order just now... "can i help you?" with a full mouth of food, nice. young white chick w/black hair, she should be fired for that shit. and just for that I thank you for the free bottle of chipotle tabasco i stole and put into my to-go bag.
author: Calama T.

description: A Chipotle is a Chipotle is a Chipotle.  The food tastes the same at every Chipotle I've been to - good, but nothing great.  I like how the vegetarian burrito includes guacamole at no extra charge, since there's no meat.  This location has all the calories listed right on the menu if you're interested in that (not sure if that's standard now as I haven't been to another location in a while).  It's cheap, it's fast, it's a filling meal, and as long as you go early, it's easy to find a seat for lunch at this particular location.
author: Kimberly K.

description:
For all those that LOVE Chipotle, I have yet to figure out why...

What is it that makes this place so popular? They have a very basic menu, their typical burrito is a little healthier compared to the other burrito spots, but the food also lacks flavor. There is nothing about it that stands out in my mind. If the name Chipotle wasn't so well known and the chain wasn't so big, I would have already forgot about them.
author: Jason B.

description:
A McBurrito?  I don't know.  This is San Francisco and we really don't need a fake burrito chain when we have a plethora of authentic choices.  And good ones at that, which Chipotle is not.  Somewhere between over-hyped and over-salted, discerning taste buds will know the difference.  I wouldn't be such a burrito snob, but they call themselves gourmet (their word, not mine) and unless they are talking about their decor in comparison to a traditional taqueria, I don't see where gourmet fits in the picture.  The food is run of the mill.

One starter star and one star for using natural meat.

http://www.cleanscores.com/2005/Chipotle+Mexican+Grill
author: Ann W.

description:
very friendly staff. i went one time at night, they even gave me 'extra meat' for free :)

quick, cheap, easy solution for lunch 

and if you opt out the rice, just go with meat, beans, and veges. it is only about 300 calories, with a good nutritional value.
author: Danielle A.

description:
McDonald's Corporation Burritos.  Their advertising campaign pokes fun at Starbucks' cupsize naming convention.  

http://starbucksgossip.typepad.com/.shared/image.html?/photos/uncategorized/1056393944_orig.jpg

Who would win in a street fight? McDonalds with burrito chain nunchucks, or Starbucks with a daisy-chained saggy-Siren crotch death grip?

http://www.boingboing.net/2005/06/20/starbucks_mermaid_fr.html

Probably a good bite on a roadtrip, but given options, this isn't one.  Closes WAY too early.  Even disappointed my housemates that really wanted to eat here.  Makes babies cry.  

White greasy rice? c'mon

Extra star because burrito can be used as a grenade. Oh and the salsa bar is good.  Demand your burrito without rice... When they do that whole green onion thing, it's pretty interesting.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Yeah.... they used to be owned by McDonald's... GET OVER IT!!!

I love Chipotle... I got hooked in college in AZ where it wasn't taboo to eat there like it is in CA... but listen, get with the program... this sh*t is too good to pass up!  And yes, if you get a steak burrito with everything on it, it will be a gut bomb.  But for me, who tries to keep a healthy diet and is mostly vegetarian, its easy to find something that satisfies and is less that a full day's worth of calories. Here's what I get - 

Burrito Bowl
Lettuce on the bottom instead of rice
Black Beans
No Meat
Pico de gallo, hot salsa, corn salsa
No cheese, no sour cream
Chips and Guac on the side (if I'm really hungry)  I can only eat a few of the chips though, the serving could feed 3 people.

This location is excellent as well.  The line is fast and never takes more than 5-10 minutes. Don't plan on eating in though, it's usually very crowded during lunch.  Plan on getting it to-go if you are there between 1130-130p. 

So it's not totally authentic but it gives you the Mexican flavors and is fast and delicious.  And for $6 you really can't go wrong.  Don't be scared.....
author: Alice H.

description:
I must admit, I was so skeptical of Chipotle until I tried it a few years ago and then I became hooked. I used to work across the street from it so I ended up eating there at least twice a week. One thing to remember, this is not a taqueria so don't expect a truly authentic Mexican food experience.

I'm a total burrito snob but I really like Chipotle. I like that the food is always fresh. They use romaine lettuce instead of iceberg. They offer black beans as a choice. The rice is pretty good as well as the salsas and their grilled bell peppers and onions. Their chips are perfectly salted and their guacamole kicks ass. The restaurant is usually clean and well-lit. The service is always friendly and fast. 

I just wish there were more Chipotles in the world... especially when I'm on road trips and my only choices are Jack in the Box or Burger King.
author: L. L.

description:
I have no idea why i like this place so much....but let me give it a shot...

It's consistent, with high quality ingredients, enough (but not too much) variety and of course the best guacamole this side of the mission.  Even if it started off as a McD's brand  - i'm not judgemental enough to care. Minus 1 star for closing so god forsaken early
author: D S.

description:
This place is not bad. Gotta love their cilantro-lime rice, even though it's not the usual rice i expect in my burrito. They also have very fast service and the employees are quite friendly. 

If you're hungry and can't walk 10 blocks, or don't want to pay $2 to ride the muni, to get to the mission, then definitely hit up this place. 

Tallulah's Verdict: Love it
author: Tallulah J.

description: Convenient when I don't feel like eating a sandwich around the area. I think their food is too simple. The only thing I enjoy is the burrito bowl because there's no tortilla. I come back for variation since I work around there, but no more than once a month.
author: Timothy L.

description:
This is a chain place.  But it is not entirly owned by McDonalds from what I can tell.  I think that is just a myth.  They did invest in it, but if you boycotted every company that a major corporation invested in, you would be naked and hungry. 

I really don't mind their burritos.  I mean, living in SF, it seems so silly to go here when there are so many alernatives, but when there is a group heading there, I am happy to go along.
author: Pele N.

description:
Let's get one thing straight first: this is fast food, it is not a proper taqueria. But then again, you probably already knew that and should keep than in mind whenever you go into this place. Having said that, I will also say that it is pretty well done, for fast food. The value you get for your money is pretty good and it is healthier than a burger or Taco Bell/Del Taco. Granted, they use flour tortillas instead of corn, which is a no-no in my book, but would be lying if I said that I didn't find it tasty nonetheless. 

If there was a better place to get a taco in the neighboorhood, then I would probably never come here, but for a quick bite in the hood that is not a sandwich, this will do.

Also, I will never eat a burrito that is made with plain white rice. Never.
author: Tom H.

description:
So, it is the mcdonalds of mexican food, but since i am from a country with no mexicans, i dig it...
if you want a babies thigh, this is the place... not the tastiest in the world (it isnt the mission, or san diego from what i have been told) but it works...
black beans make my heart go boom boom and my anus sing for the rest of the night... but these are the perils of mexican food.
extra star cause it is open till 9pm in an area that has nothing really open after 6pm.
reasonably gold
author: Nathan H.

description:
Maybe it's the boy-from-Fresno thing, but sometimes I really crave some inauthentic cuisine. Chipotle, the McDonalds of super burritos, fills this innate need perfectly. It's totally anglo-cized and yuppified, and after a few cocktails... MMMM, Barrrrrbacoooooa. Oy. 

Still, charging nearly a buck-fiddy for a dollop of guac is totally retarded, as is the ridiculously tightwad portion control. But it is what it is, and sometimes that just hits the spot.
author: Aaron L.

description:
There were several things working against me and forced me to eat this burrito.  

One: midterms on Saturday meaning there's no TIME to take the 14 down to the Mission and get a perfectly tubular concoction made by a squat little man who can fold a circle in to a concentric pipe.  

Two: it was slightly safer and easier on the tum-tum than MacDonald's down the block (I love their fries but I always burp the funniest taste after eating here!).

I'm blown away at the menu.  It's so spare.  It's minimalistic beyond austere.  It was...trying too hard.  But I applaud what they are trying to do with the truncated menu.  

Less choices means you have less stupid people standing and staring with their mouth wide wide open, drooling slightly, and the wheels of their mind turning FURIOUSLY trying to make a decision.  Well, there are just as many stupid people in the world but less will spend their time tooling away at the activity described above.  

I got a chicken fajita burrito.  This time, I got lots of sour cream b/c i mistook the woman's question for "how much hot sauce?" and not "wanna sour cream?"  I swear they sound the same coming out of her mouth.  

And then I experienced the most experienced poorly executed burrito rolling of my life.  She man-handled it.  She molested it in criminal ways.  She committed unspeakable acts of assault and battery, felony burrito wrapping, with a culpable mens rea or at least a blatant disregard for the burrito (gross criminal negligence towards a burrito).  And to top it all off, the burrito was not tight.  After all that touching, fumbling, like a pre-pubescent teenager in the back of the bleachers during football practice trying to get to first base before the bell rings, the burrito was not turgid.  There was a hand print on my burrito.  I had to prop the thing up with the foil or else the whole thing would have gone limp and spilled sour cream everywhere.  

It tasted decent enough, with the monster amounts of sour cream that it contained.  It cost $6.46.  The rice was not mexican rice but rather, white, seasoned with cilantro.  And it was kind of sticky.  How asian.  The peppers and onions (b/c it's a FAJITA burrito) were so pungent, the vampires were dropping like flies as I walked past them on the way home (even though it was onion and not garlic that I ate).  

It's a quick enough fix close to school.  I may be talked in to coming back if the one next to Flames is already closed.
author: Christina C.

description:
I used to like Chipotle for the freshness and not for their "authenticity", but I had it again last night and everything was salty and the chips were too tangy.  I got the sour cream on the side and it was watery and I hate that the guac is $1.40.  That's a third the cost of the dang burrito itself! 

And, not that I expect exceptional service at a place like this, but they were really rude and not helpful.
author: vanessa c.

description:
This is the spot I come to for the most generic mexican food EVAR!! I like it, dont get me wrong, but mainly for the oversalted chips, cilantro rice, and jalapeno corn! 

This is the only in the city I've been to and its pretty decent!
author: Eric A.

description: With all the hype...I had to give it a try. I had the Carnitas Burrito with black beans & med salsa. The line went fast and they made the burrito to my specks. Problem was the salt...so much salt! I'm afraid Chipotle will not make it into my Mex taqueria rotation.
author: Hidegrl A.

description:
Chipotle is a great place to go if you want cheap "mexican" take-out! I work right up the street but I find it really convenient to order online so I don't have to wait in line once I get there. 

My co-workers really love the Barbacoa burrito/burrito bowl but my favorite is the Vegetarian burrito (which comes with guac, onions and peppers) or if I'm craving protein, I'll order the Chicken w/ guacamole. I like the way they season the chicken, its tasty! Its such a large portion that I can eat half and be satisfied and have the other half a few hours later. 

If you're craving a little snack, the guacamole and chips are perfect. Although the chips are usually good, I find that sometimes they are salted too heavily and I've noticed the same thing with the black beans.

All in all, I find the quality and convenience is worth my $6 - $7.
author: Shannon A.

description: Another AAU student eatery but not one I plan to return to again. I ate here quite a few times this past semester and while each thing I tried was relatively tasty (for a fast food) I felt really ill afterwards. I'm not allergic to anything and I eat at other traditional mexican places all the time and have an iron stomach for spice. The website doesn't disclose a full ingredients list so I guess I'll never know. Good-bye Chipotle.
author: Stacey C.

description: Oh so busy! Not much great customer service. But I guess that's because they're so busy. It's just that I still like some acknowledgment and attention, you know? Eh, still tastes good though (:
author: Y. Abigail H.

description:
With all the authentic, family run establishments serving amazing burrito's in this city, it's good to know that I can still purchase a quality burrito where the profits go back to a large, multi-national corporation.  Although I was hoping that the meat in burrito would be made from the same meat as McDonald's amazing 99 cent double cheeseburger, instead it was some naturally raised beef that follows Chipotle's "food with integrity" motto.  While I can't personally vouch for their integrity, nor my own, I will say this burrito does taste pretty damn good.  And if you eat the entire thing, you can almost guarantee that your day will lose all productivity, and you'll lose some time off the end of your life, where it doesn't count anyways.  

5 Senses Summary-

See- The glistening silver tables reflect the suns shimmering rays.
Hear- The strain of your belt against your enormous caloric intake
Taste- The commercialization of a food who's name means "little donkey" in Spanish
Touch- The Lemon wedges with your hand because the little tongs aren't effective
Smell- The foul gas of your co-workers you had lunch with for hours

PROTIP- With 30 Tabasco's on the counter, just go ahead and grab one for the office.
author: Steven S.

description: This place hits the spot for my burrito cravings. It's great that they let me mix and match. The staff is friendly and the prices are reasonable. It's great that this place opens on Saturdays. Washing down a burrito with soda is fine but a Corona is even better.  I'm so glad they open until 9 pm.  Then, a little siesta. Only if they would start offering tapas.
author: Peace L.

description:
Chipotle is not your awesome local Mexican joint in the Mission.  but it's a great place for a quick bite!  The meat is delicious, great salsa (especially the medium and corn), awesome portion for the price.

Think of Chipotle like In-N-Out, there are better places out there but given the option, it's great for what it is.  It's also a great way for non Mexican food lovers to enjoy some burritos.  A bit like brining your non-asian friends to Panda Express (it's not authentic but it's a start...).
author: matt c.

description:
Sure, there are way more authentic places to eat in the MIssion that are really really good. For what it is though, Chipotle delivers. You get more food than any human being should ever consumer in one meal all wrapped up in a tortilla for 6 bucks. Plus, the meat is high quality and well seasoned. Not to mention they use organic and sustainable sourced meat and vegetables. What other national chain claims to do that?

As far as I am concerned, the only thing I don't like about Chipotle is that it's owned by McDonalds. I always think it's a bummer that I have to support that behemoth just to get my barbacoa burrito fix. I guess at least you can say it's McDonalds doing something good for the world for once.   

K2 Forever
author: Adam W.

description:
Yummy lunch break food and yummy lunch break guys. There are a few great things about this Chipotle in San Francisco: 
1. Quick service- they make it as you order it right in front of you
2. Flash your college ID for a free soda
3. Cheap eat
4. It's close to my work ;-)
5. There are always some cuties grabbing a quick bite on their lunch break
6. They have out door seating (the weather is warming up people!)
author: Rada I.

description: I have been having an affair on all of my favorite local true mexican resturants with Chipotle, and you know what I dont feel guilty about it. There food is very fresh, and reasonably priced! The only think I really am upset about it that they dont have a more convenient location. Sure if you work DT its cool, but if you dont its only a short Muni ride away I guess... Still I have to stop my 4 night a week Chipotle dinners, I am getting a little out of control. HELP. When/where does the Chipotle AA meeting meet?
author: Ryan B.

description: F*ck this place. Seriously. They've wronged me more times than I can count, yet I keep coming back and I don't know why. Never again, I say! Stopped in late last night (8pm-ish), and there were maybe 2-4 people in the dining area and 1 person ahead of me in line. Considering there was hardly anyone there, the 6-7 employees behind the counter were frantic, yelling things at each other, and were in generally foul moods. Ordered my veggie burrito, but when I got down to the salsas, etc. they were out of guac. The girl making my burrito tried to ignore the fact and wrap it up without asking if I wanted any (which is included with the veggie burrito). Of course I stopped her (I'm paying 7 bucks for a pile of .50 cent veggies, I want my damn guac). She said they didn't have any but could make some. More arguing between the employees and she finally abandons my burrito to run in the back and make more (by this time, there's a few more people backing up who also want guac). 5 minutes pass and a single serving emerges from the kitchen. Another lady puts it on my burrito and rings me up (for the wrong burrito price + guac charge, but whatever, this place was stressin me out and I just wanted to leave). Finally make it home, and sweet Jesus. WORST.GUAC.EVER! Ugh! I might as well eaten a couple of limes and called it a day. I couldn't taste anything else as it was so limey and salty. And there were big chunks of something that looked kinda like avocado but were hard and couldn't be chewed. Not even 1/4 of the way through the burrito, I had to abandon the cause and rummage through my fridge for some cheese and crackers. Saddest dinner ever. Thanks for nothing, Chipotle.
author: Heather U.

description: I go to school up the street so I always stop by here for a burrito on lunch.  Its good, as always.  Knocked off two stars, cause Chipotle used to give students free sodas.  Now they dont.  and because they use Tobasco as hot sauce.....uhhhh what?  This aint Louisiana.  Thanx.  burritos kick ass though.
author: Brandon H.

description: When I first heard of Cha-poodle, I was suspicious. It's owned by McDonald's although they don't want you to know that. Fact of the matter, it ain't bad. Imagine a down-rev Chevy's where you walk back into the kitchen and tell the guy exactly how to make your burrito while you watch him do it. Well, they don't assault you with a loud 'happy birthday' song and no balloon animal extortion artists going table to table until you pay them to go away. So maybe it's better than Chevy's.
author: Brian B.

description: I know I should hate it because its owned by McDonalds- but I actually love their gaucamole.   At $1.40/serving I should hope that its good. I think its ridiculous that they charge you for tortilla chips-  especially ones that are COVERED in salt.   (don't bother getting them- you won't be able to eat them) I do like their crispy chicken tacos.
author: Madhuri K.

description:
This is my default lunch option--when I don't know what I want, I eat here. Clean and quick, I've never had a bad burrito or fajita. Even when the line is 2 dozen people long, wrapped around the drink station, I can be in and out within 10 minutes. Free refills on fountain drinks, and the meats are all well-seasoned. Only two minor downsides - 1) the fresh-made tortilla chips are an extra charge, and 2) sometimes they're a bit aggressive about rolling the burrito and it tears, making eating a bit messier.

Take advantage of their online ordering (especially if you have a group!) and bypass the line entirely. I've done so several times with great results. The online interface is easy and lets you custom-build a burrito. Then you walk straight to the register for your pick-up!
author: Bill B.

description: Ok, just because it was free for me... I tried the chicken soft taco's. They were pretty good... BUT! I would still go to mom n pops shops.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Worst Burrito I ever had. 
It was cold and gross....I had to keep shifting it so i wouldnt end up with a mouthful of extremely salty guacamole......
The whole point of a burrito is so that you get a bit of everything in one bite....Chipotle cant even do that!!!
Shame on you Chipotle! You suck!
author: Judith F.

description:
Wow.  I had no idea people are so anti Chipotle.  

I think there food is pretty damn good.  It's all fresh, clean, and very tasty.  The pork is from Neiman Ranch which is always a good thing, and its so tender and tasty!  The chicken is also very good, but the beef wasn't my favorite (from what I recall... haven't had it in a while).  Also the rice is excellent!  Salsa are on the wet side, but the hot salsa tastes very good!

Line gets very long during the lunch rush, but moves pretty quickly.

Here's some history:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chipotle_Mexican_Grill
author: shaun l.

description:
cmon, put your anti-McD prejudices aside.  The food here is really not that bad.
The meats are well marinated and decently prepared.  The food is not expensive (less than $6 total).  The service is fast.  Sure their burrito wrapping skills need work, and their cheese is processed crap, but the salsas are OK, and overall the burrito is decent.

You want bad?  Go be a tool and get an overpriced TRULY crappy, TRULY McD quality burrito at Taco Del Mar.

It's definitely nothing compared to the Mission Taquerias and it's definitely more whitewashed than Si Senor a block away (which is decent, and more authentic), but sometimes you just want that Cal-mex style burrito.  Hell burritos themselves are not authentic in the first place!
author: Fong L.

description:
This place is awesome. I don't give a flying rats ass if it is authentic! Taco Bell has its merits when you are in a hurry and need fast food. This is *FAR* better. Besides, where else can you get a burrito bowl? 

Not liking Chipotle because it is owned by the McDonalds corporation is unamerican. Go America! Go McDonalds! Go capitalism!
author: Cyan C.

description:
It's some sorta healty mexican wannabe place. I like my mexican food dirty and greasy. The guy making my food should have a latin accent and it should be hard for me to understand him. 
But ok back to Chip-o-tot-le
Their rice isn't the of the redish sort. It's supposidly cilantro-lime rice. It really isn't that bad. 
When you order it's sorta an assembly line process like at other mexican places. But you have to choose how you want your food put together (Burrito, Fajita Burrito, Burrito Bol (in a bowl w/o tortilla), Tacos or, Salad.) Be ready when you get to the counter they look agitated at the people who don't know what they want.
The food was ok. Nothing I'd crave.
author: Bee C.

description: Fresh, tasty and filling.  I love Chipotle!  The best part, ordering online, you beat the line and you're walking out in no time.  The love the variety of salsa to choose from get one or get all.  I will be back again and again.
author: La C.

description:
Three-star average?  Man, you yelpers are harsh.

Chipotle is good!  Not Gary Danko-good, or caviar-good, but chain-burrito good.  It beats the heck out of Taco Bell.  Their burritos are big and filled to the brim with meat and rice and beans.  The rice is actually Indian-style jasmine rice, which is a nice touch.  The beans are nice and soft but not too lardy.  You walk down the counter, Subway-style, configuring your burrito as you go along.

Chipotle secret: you can get more than one kind of salsa in your burrito!  I like mild and corn salsas together.  It's a nice combination of sweet and spicy flavors.

You don't get chips for free, which is a bummer, but if you do order chips you'll get a horde of them.  Chipotle's chips are strangely salty and tangy, but are rather good.

The lines here get pretty excessively long at lunch, but it's not as bad since another Chipotle opened up on 1st and Market to relieve some of the load.
author: Marco C.

description:
Slightly disappointing to see that not all reviewers liked Chipotle.  I had lunch here earlier, for the first time.  My old roomie from LA used to rant and rave about this place, I can see why now.

To my surprise, the menu was REALLY simple, you just order a burrito, fajita burrito, burrito bol, salad, etc.  Then you choose your meat and you're pretty much done.  Since it's like the Panda Express line, things move relatively fast, up until the cash register.

I got a simple, steak burrito with just rice and mild salsa.  I'm very particular about my burritos being served this way.   Only La Vics has a wonderful sauce that you can add to help the dry carne asada meat build some flavor, but since more burrito joints don't have a sauce, most burritos are rather dry.  Not Chipotle, their steak meat is cooked and kept in a sauce, so it's nice and juicy, has a little kick too.  So as I ate my burrito, I didn't need feel the need to add any sauces.  The price of the burrito was not so bad either, it was only adding a soda that sucked.

Two things that they could improve, MORE seating and smaller chunks of steak.  Otherwise, I will probably make this a regular place for lunch from now on.
author: Winnie L.

description:
Eh. This place is pretty bad. 

I got the veggie burrito. They really don't know how to roll a burrito here - I got a gloppy mess that gave me a stomach ache.

And I hate their bland crappy rice. Their food tastes like re-packaged taco bell. Why would anybody go here when there are several taquerias nearby?

I won't go here again. But the chips are good (which are extra of course - and you have to pay for salsa - WTF!?)
author: Chili B.

description:
I usually walk here from work to grab their three soft tacos but this time I had the burrito bowl with EVERYTHING which includes sour cream, guac($1.50 extra), chicken, freshly grated cheese, black beans, mild salsa, and lettuce. I think it looked like more food than ordering one of their reg burrito bombs. I like that you can order margaritas or grab a corona at this one as well. I just got an ice tea however.

The people behind the counter are generally nice and fast, I've noticed sometimes you'll get someone that skimps out on the meat but other than that I've had little complaints about their staff. This place also has an iphone app that lets you order ahead of time if your one of the lucky ones that actually own it. I always seem to almost gorge myself everytime I go here and walk back to work holding my gut. If you go to this chipotle there is a cafe trieste nearby and I recommend the africano mmmm.

All in all, it's fast and it seems healthy, but that probably just because it's missing the grease that is usually in traditional burritos.

-t
author: Tony G.

description:
This is fake mexican people! Ehh, not worth the money at all to me. It's just another taco bell with a better inside and a little bit healthier ingridients. I give it 2 stars because i will still go there as a last resort. But mexican food can be done much better for the same price, and the whole point of this place seems to be to catch the college students from Academy of Art.

What I Ate?
The burrito without the tortilla... where is all just sits there.. it was ehh ok.
author: Preston B.

description: OK...it's a chain. And it's always crowded. But even when the line has snaked outside of the door and around the soda fountain, it moves very quickly. But speaking of that soda fountain...you've gotta be kidding me on how little room there is to begin with, then the line snakes around, the someone sits at the window counter. Within a few seconds-GRIDLOCK! I find it silly that they don't take a bit more control of their lemmings and send them into a line that doesn't severely impact their customers.
author: Scot B.

description:
I agree with everyone and most definitely with Jesse F.

Its damn good eats! 
I am awful with it comes to handling a burrito. You would think since its nice and packed for me that I would have a good ol' time eating but because of my little hands I just cant seem to get them around that super size meal. When I take one hand off to either peel the foil or put some more hot sauce on that baby, its a disaster. Hand, Eye and Hunger coordination is off. 

So now I always get the Bol yes the Bol I think its Mexican for Bowl. ( to those who take me seriously, take out that stick ) So back to the Bol hmmm so good.
author: D Q.

description:
Why do San Franciscans feel they must bash chain restaurants? Is being an elite yelp member (its great to yelp often, but some people take it WAY to seriously)  mean you must be an elitist in your dining choices?  If you are so opposed to chains and want to support local businesses that's great, then don't go in the first place. And if sf is anti-chain why are there soooooo many Starbucks?????

And in terms of being authentic, I find it very difficult to believe most people have a grasp on what authentic Mexican food is.  Do you find it at you fave place in mission ? Or when you vacationed in Cancun?  Mexico is a huge country with many different styles of cooking.  And who really cares if  it  is authentic?????   i would rather have meal that tastes great than have a meal that is truly authentic that doesn't taste good. 

I am done bitching.    Chipotle serves a quality product (for a quick service restaurant)  Service is solid and place is spotless.   Its not fantastic, but for a chain its healthily if you make good choices.
author: Jimmy M.

description:
Unremarkable, standard chain mexican food...  yet somehow I always end up back here...  Probably because of the chips, they're damn good.

Their Guacamole is crap.  Otherwise the ingredients are definitely good.

In the end, I'd say it alright to eat here if you don't mind feeling like shit for a few hours after.  If you want real good, authentic mexican food though...  go to El Farolito in the Mission.
author: Alexander T.

description:
Ok - so I try to forget that they're owned by McDonalds.  And I try to forget that they're a massive chain.

Instead, I try to think about the fact that they use local, sustainable, produce and meat.  And I say thank you by giving them my business and supporting this type of behavior.  I definitely can get on board with this because I have no idea where the meats come from at my local taquerias, but I know that my Carnitas come from Niman Ranch when I go here.

Oh yeah, and its pretty tasty too.  Not very authentic, but if you want a decent plate of food with fresh ingredients, you could do a lot worse.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Since I work on the same block as Chipotle, I do eat here often. I don't get the burritos though, I get the Carmita's soft tacos. They are much easier to eat and I think a very good value. You get 3 for like $5.75. Not bad and you get a fountain drink that you can refill when you leave. 
The place is always packed at lunch time, but the line moves quick. It may not be the most exciting Mexican place but it works for a quick lunch.
author: Lisa A.

description:
Today was the first time I've ever been here. I'm really stressed and frazzled now. I'm grateful that my food came super fast, but I'm all stressed out from the experience of ordering and making my choices so quickly. 

I got the beef burrito in a bowl. It's okay, not mindblowing, but I suppose I'd go back if I was craving for some really fast mexican food.
author: joanna c.

description:
Dear Chipotle,

How I have missed you since moving from LA. We used to spend at least one night a week together and several lunch breaks. We used to grab take out and sit on the couch or we would spend have great conversation over soft tacos and margaritas. 

Sure your lines are long, but the service is fast and the margaritas are tastey. Your meat is spicey and your burritos are bulging.

You are my ditry little pleasure. And for that I will always love you.
author: Aubrey W.

description:
Tasty, in the know-exactly-what-you're-getting mega-chain sort of way.  Their recent ad campaign touting non-hormonal meat gives me hope that what I'm consuming here is, ever so slightly, a cut above.  

I don't get their burritos, because I think they have too much rice.  That could be a matter of personal preference.  The "bol" is a good choice, and slightly less coma-inducing.  Whatever you order, you should check out the nutrition calculator on their corporate website.  There's also a fun, interactive online order process.  

What I don't like is that you, the customer, pay for some service-line inefficiencies.  As in, the people ahead of you have already ordered, but the whole line is backlogged because they can't force people to pay as fast as they order.  So you have the first "burrito artist" on the food chain yelling at you above the din and music when you're a few people back in line; and so on down the chain.  The line can get crazy long, so I see why the employees get stressed.  And yes, it's very loud in here.
author: Rob W.

description:
I love this place and I am not ashamed to admit it! 
I love the bowl - any of them - yum to the max!
author: Shawn P.

description:
Love this place. Food is fresh, employees are nice, restaurant is clean and price is just perfect. I like how the employees will hook it up without charging extra, if you want more of something. Cuz I like a lil extra cheese on my burritos, without having to pay a dollar more. 

It also helps that I don't feel hella greasy after eating the burritos here.
author: Haileab B.

description:
I don't care that it's owned by a cooperation. I can get a burrito as big as my FOOT for less than 7$ (that's saying a lot for the financial district). And I get a free soda cuz I'm in college, heh heh.

Food's ok. It's not the best Mexican food I've had, but it's not super-good, Mission Taqueria style either. I usually get the steak because, unlike most taquerias who shred or chop their steak,  Chipotle has cubed pieces of beef, so there's more meaty goodness. Their chips were a little salty,however. I haven't tried anything else apart from the burrito and chips, but I'd expect they'd all be the same-ish type stuff.

A burrito is huge. I can only eat half of one before I fall into a food coma (and it takes a lot for me to food faint.). So Chipotle turns into lunch AND dinner. It's also close to where I work and service is speedy quick (the ladies behind the counter are all rushy rushy, so don't expect too much out of service) so I can get the full hour easily out of my break.

Now I'm hungry. Great.
author: Regina L.

description: I know I know I know. It's Chipotle. Well stop being snobs and appreciate the biggest, most delicious thing you'll ever wrap your lips around.
author: Zachariah Q.

description: First off their food is not all that! Second, you can get way better service & food at a taqueria.  I hate this location especially because they say they open at 10am, yet you'll catch yourself standing outside playing with your fingers until they finally decide to open the doors.  They even stand there watching a line form of people and not open.  The manager is a rude pig! He gives you attitude and asks for your order like your a 8 year old.  Ever since I had to wait outside for them to open up and was spoken to as if I was a child I X'ed them out of my list.
author: Christina O.

description:
Literally.... onions and cilantro in every bite?!? No thank YOU! I do not like the guacamole because it's too spicy and the cilantro in the rice makes the whole burrito too gross. And the vegetarian selection isn't great because really all you can get is peppers and onions for veggie option and I do not like either of those things. Maybe the meat options are better.

The people at this particular Chipotle are really nice but if I am going to eat Mexican food, I am going to want to eat actual Mexican food. I hope to not eat here or at any Chipotle again.
author: Morgan M.

description:
Can't believe I haven't rated Chipotle's yet, as an Academy of Art student. it's about as convenient as you can get.  8 bucks for a massive, gut-bomb of a burrito, with a soft drink, assembled at racing speed.  Nothing like a thousand calories deposited straight into your gut within 20 minutes to tide you over for 2 classes.

Chipotle's is without a doubt, my favorite Americanized-Mexican burrito joint, sure it's more corporate than your average Burrito stand in the Mission, but for being in the heart of the Financial district, you're not going to find much better for the price.

Love me my Barbacoa Fajita Burritos!
author: Tyler D.

description:
This is the place for EPIC burritos.  Pay no mind to the people who like to pooh-pooh Chipotle (it seems to be a fashionable thing to do these days) - they serve delicous, affordable, high quality food.  

In fact, I wish more people hated this place because there is always a line out the door at lunch time.  Go away and let me get my burrito!
author: Jon N.

description: Let's face it. All Chipotle's taste the same (except this one I had in Wisconsin, very bad, but beside the point). It's a chain, so you know exactly what you're going to get. But there's something different about this SOMA location. I'm not sure if it's the AAU-adjacent location or what, but the people who work there are just... nicer. They have a sense of humor. I've even known them to throw down some occasional witty banter. It's just refreshing, especially when you're in line at a place and you already know you're feeding the corporate beast. Nice to know that there's some individuality out there.
author: Stefanie L.

description: The New Montgomery Chipotle is the one I go to. The team there is a 'team'. They work well together with speed and a playful attitude. I usually hit them up 2 minutes before closing (b/c of my work schedule) and they're always happy to make my last minute order. The one time (only one)  there was a delay in my order, they comped my entire meal--I couldn't believe it! So kind and generous!
author: Shelley C.

description:
Often times my 20 minute lunch break consists of a Chipotle taco fix. 
There's usually not a line after 1:30, and I still use my Cal student ID for free soft drink. (No way I'm paying 2 bucks for a Coke!) The food is good - you get what you pay for, but the service there is less than mediocre. I agree that the women working there seem bitter and resentful towards their customers. 

My experiences there usually go like this: I order 4 hard tacos, but by the time one of the women adds the chicken, more than half of it ends up in the plastic basket. I then am faced with the awkward position of asking them to "please move the chicken to the taco". I feel bad asking this, but hey - I don't order tacos for the shells!! All in all, a good lunch and very organized assembly line. But the service just isn't on par. Prepared to leave a bit irked.
author: Lara D.

description: I am a huge fan of Chipotle...Although it is not authentic Mexican food, I enjoy their clean restaurants (at all locations), tasty healthy ingredients, reasonable prices and the crapload of gorgeous, young women who always hang out and eat here.
author: Raider J.

description:
I love Chipotle.  In fact, when I lived in Chicago I ate there so often that they sponsored my softball team.  

I know, I know, it's owned by McDonald's.  I don't care!  It is clean, efficient and tastes great.  You can refill your soda for free.  You don't stick to counter or the floor when you are there.  I don't know what's not to love.
author: Keith B.

description:
What can I say but I love Chipotle

I know the portions are too large and all the other stuff but the food is good, fresh, the chips are great and the service is fast...
author: Pete D.

description:
A burrito from Chipotle and a Mission burrito fall into completely different food groups.  It is like comparing Apples and Oranges (which actually makes sense because Apples and Oranges are kinda similar in a lot of ways, but are pretty different in a lot of other ways).  Anyways, compared to other "fresh mex" places - Chipotle is awesome.

Now, I'm not deaf to the chrous of people shouting - don't eat here - go get a Mission Burrito!!!  However, if I want a Mission Burrito I'll not hesitate to go to a Taqueria Cancun, CuCo's, La Fonda, el Farolito's, etc.  If you want a Mission Burrito, you'd be advised to do the same.  However, when I want a fresh mex Burrito - I want a burrito from Chipotle.   For what they are, they are awesome.  At least 10 times better than Baja Fresh and similar places.  

My only real complaint is that they charge extra for chips and salsa and they charge extra for guac (over a $1 extra at that).  

The staff here is ridiculously efficient.  The lines for this place at lunch time are super long, but move at nearly 35 miles per hour.  

I'd recommend either a) Barbacoa burritos, or b) Carnitas burritos.  Also, I'd recommend avoiding the chicken and steak burritos because they are pretty flavorless.
author: Matthew H.

description: This is the McDonalds of burritos.  If you like your Mexican food devoid of any flavor and a wait that goes out the door, then this place is for you.  This isn't just about this location; it's about all Chipotle's that I've been to.  We have way too many tacquerias in this city to even need to go to Chipotle.
author: Scott L.

description:
AAAH i didnt know this was owned by mcdonalds.  i knew it was a chain and jesse and i discussed how this might be bad for you as we ate our lunch (neither of us eats fast food). but mcdonalds? aw.. :(
anyway, this is a fast place to grab lunch if you've run out at home.  we got chicken burittos for almost $6 each, but they were very large.  Not a whole lot of chicken inside, but there was rice and beans and some weird sauce that was ok but not stupendous, and then guacamole and salsa.  overall, very messy, fally aparty, but pretty good. i was stuffed after i gulped it down.  i think i would rather spend the $ on something less chainy in the future.
author: Merredith L.

description:
Whoever invented the Burrito Bowl is my idol - so simple, yet so necessary.

Grilled Chicken is best and the one near my college used to give students free drink discounts, which translated into free beer - not a student anymore but someone should try and see if this works at the one on Montgomery
author: Lauren G.

description:
So I was gonna give my franchise burrito three stars for bland chicken, but otherwise decent ingredients and pretty tasty rice, that is until it gave me some uhm...."problems" later.  

Big "problems"  ):
author: jess l.

description:
My boyfriend and I could not find any parking on a Saturday downtown so we drove over to this street and luckily found a 30 min meter spot near Chipotle. 
The food here is good. Im still a freak for authentic home cooked Mexican food but this place is good for a quick meal when you're on the go. I had a chicken burrito which was big,tasty, and with white rice!
I wouldn't go out of my way to come here but if I was ever in this area again and was on the go, I would stop here.
author: Miss H K.

description:
Sure, it's owned by McDonald's. But that doesn't mean it can't be good. Hear Music is owned by Starbucks, and it's still decent, right? Just sayin.

OK, so it's not authentic Mexican. I'll go to Mexico Au Parc a few blocks away if I feel like that. But the burritos Chipotle serves up are massive and mouth-watering. Titanic and tasty. Huge and hunger-quenching.

The best part of this place is how easy they make it to order online. Food ready in 15 minutes, and no standing in line? That rocks.
author: Elliot J.

description:
I have to say that I do love Chipotle when time is of the essence and you need something to carry you through the day.  I have to agree with an earlier review in saying that the crispy tacos with barbacoa and everything on them are amazing.  The place is consistent, you have to give it that.

HOWEVER, this particular Chipotle sucks.  You can see that their staff is trained heavily to be as conservative as possible when serving you.  Pay attention when they add sour cream and cheese - they use so little there might as well be none at all.  I've been disappointed over and over again in the amount of food they've given me.  Now maybe that makes me a fatass, I don't really care.  It just pisses me off because I can always count on being let down by them.

Anyways, thought I'd toss that into the mix.  I'm not going to go here anymore.
author: Ross T.

description:
If you're more into fresh quality ingredients vs Mexican authenticity.  Make sure to order the zesty salsas and sauteed onions and peppers or else the burritos can end up boring and blah.  If you order guac, you get heaps of it. mmm.

Great for catering for groups. They can cut the burritos in half and then it's perfect for a work lunch or dinner.
author: Melanie C.

description: It was pretty okay for a chain mexican restaurant. I went in and got a veggie burrito. It was A-okay. the guacamole was pretty good and creamy I think. But nothing really special. It's right across the street so its an easy place to grab a munch.
author: Miss C.

description:
Given it's increasing ubiquity, I'll only mention what I eat at Chipotle and why I would go there with others. 

Typical order:

Bol with double black beans, salsa, guac, and lettuce. $5.70. Fast, delicious, filling, high-protein, and plant-based.

Why go:

Chipotle espouses many of the ideals of a socially- and environmentally-responsible restaurant. Yes, they serve meat, but it's increasingly sourced from responsible growers. Per their website 60% of their beans are organic.

As for haters of large, hegemonic fast-food outlets that may or may not own large stakes in Chipotle: check your facts and consider buying some shares.

As Michael Pollan says, "eat food, not too much, mostly plants." This is an easy place to do that.
author: Christian B.

description:
I come here when I'm craving a huge burrito. I can never decide how to eat the burrito. Do I pick it up with both hands and just bite into it? Do I use a knife and fork? Either way, it's very messy. And you will look like a pig devouring it all by yourself.

You can order online and not wait in line. Just walk to the cashier and tell them you're picking up. They go in the kitchen to grab your bag and after you pay, you're outta there. I suggest this if you're going there between 11:30am-3pm. The place is packed and the line goes out the doors. There is absolutely no tables to sit at during this time. I once saw a guy sitting on the window sill. 

Bottled drinks are pretty pricy. Show your student ID and you get a free drink. Or so I've heard.

When I feel the need to have a nostalgic moment like say, getting my food like I am in line at the cafeteria back in high school, this is where I come. You walk by and instead of you grabbing whatever they ask you if you want it...what sucks is that if you wanted something else and you pass it up, you can't get it.

Chipotle's staff seem a little apathetic to your needs, but then again, I would be too if the cost of my food was the hourly rate for my service. In saying that I must conclude that this place can be considered to be a rip off. A burrito in the mission doesn't cost as much as it does in this place....and it would be more authentic. Hit up this place if you must....the food isn't bad...but the cost of it is horrendous and oh, high high high on the calories list.
author: James J.

description: The average sodium intake from their burritos / bowls is 1300-1500gms which is more then triple of your max daily intake, plus who knows what's in that meat... oh and they charge $1.50 to put guac in your burrito... YEAH RIGHT!!!
author: Mar C.

description:
This place blows.  One of the most tasteless burritos I've ever eaten.  Skip this place.

If you are forced to eat here (i.e. you boss is buying you lunch) then go with the soft tacos and drench them in Tabasco
author: Kevin M.

description:
Chain shmain, Chipotle is freaking delicious. And I heard they aren't even owned by McDonald's anymore so cut 'em a break, ya hearrrrd?

In a hurry? It's like, outrageously fast. Seriously, I don't even know how they do it. Their assembly line will make your head spin and you'll have your food in hand before you've had time to pull out your wallet. You can also fax in your order (weirdddd) to shave off a minute or two.

I recommend getting your Chipotle in the form of salad. I know, I know... you aren't at Chipotle to eat a salad. But listen up: It's actually just a pimped out burrito bowl with some crisp lettuce and chipotle-honey vinegrette that is straight yummm. Also, I usually go for something more exciting than chicken with my Mexican food, but their chicken kind of tastes like bacon? So I'm down.

Pardon my drooling Chipotle rant, but I am kind of having withdrawals. I haven't eaten it in months due to a shocking fainting spell I had when I saw the nutrition information. This stuff is sinful... I think I'm gonna need it for lunch tomorrow?
author: Stephanie P.

description:
FYI: Chipotle is no longer owned by Mc Donalds. 

I am a huge critic on Mexican food, and compared to many authentic Taquiera's it never measures up...but for Americanized Mexican food... this is number one choice on my list!

FOOD: I think it tastes great. Just eat it sparingly because a 1300 calorie burrito is not fun! At least the meat is antibiotic free, and veggie fed. For what you pay (roughly $6) you get a pretty giant burrito. I recommend the Barbacoa beef, which is marinated shredded beef  (yum!). I also add lettuce, corn and spicy salsa to spice it up! Only thing that blows: they charge for chips, and to add guacamole on your food is like $1.50....aren't chips like ridiculously cheap? And yes, sodas are free refills. 

SERVICE: It's always been quick, and prompt! It seriously takes them like a whole minute to put together a burrito. There's always plenty of workers and so you get your meal quickly. 

ENVIRONMENT: I like the modern look, and even though they look the same, I heard each chipotle is laid out and designed slightly different. I always like to look at the photography. This chipotle is always clean as well. 

For cheap, americanized, the mc donald's of mexican food, I highly recommend it! 

Oh and btw, it is open pretty late considering its in the FiDi...I believe until 10ish?
author: Catherine O.

description:
Chipotle is my friend, not for its food but for its geography.  When people ask where my office is, I simply say I work in the Chipotle building and people immediately know what I am talking about. Kudos to you, Chipotle, for producing a product that everyone knows about and limiting your locations to remain geographically distinct.

As for the food, this isn't a bad burrito, but this being California you can get much better.  The meats are well seasoned and the staff is super fast, even when I see a gigantic line when I walk by people seem to get in and out in less than 5 minutes.   The corn salsa is also very good.  I just prefer other places for my burritos.
author: Jared W.

description:
God I love Chipotle. How could you not? HUGE burritos and everything is simple. I always have to add guac to my burrito. You have to pay a bit extra but to me it's totally worth it. This place is fairly standard, nothing different in terms of Chipotle's. It's not your mission taqueria but it's just what I like.

*tip* if you're coming around lunch time def pick this one over the one a few blocks away on Market street. This one has a line that's A LOT shorter/faster.
author: Michael P.

description:
I've just been turned on to Chipotle recently and I do have to say, I really like it.

I'm not going to hold the fact that it's owned by Mc Donald's against them, there's really no need to. The truth is, this is a different restaurant with a different style and I don't see the point to compare the two. Personally,  I don't eat at Mc Donald's because I'm a vegetarian (though I stopped eating fast food meat years before even considering a vegetarian diet). So, eating (or not eating) at Mc D's is more of a dietary and heath decision than anything else.

Ok, so about Chipotle, Mexican fast food?? I guess I would consider Chipotle a cross between Baja Fresh and Subway. They have the standard burrito fixin's, you just head down the assembly line and start pick and choosin'. Black beans or pinto? Mild salsa or hot? Lettuce, cheese, sour cream or guac and choice of meat? It's all there for you to have your way with.I really like the personal attention of custom designing my choices. 

My personal favorite is the salad which makes me feel even better about eating here. The prices are reasonable. The chips are good though sometimes they do tend over salt them a bit.
author: alexa c.

description:
Ok - I just had a lunch a few hours ago and wanted to let the food settle before rendering my review.  I wanted this to be a fair assessment of a what was a quite tasty meal. 

When I walked into the restaurant - it was as what many reviewers have described - crowded and noisy.  Luckily, I had printed out a menu from the website and had my selection picked out in advance.  But nothing would be able to prepare me with the experience of the "food order rush".  

It was literally like sitting down on a water slide and being pushed off the ledge.  As soon as I advised the order taker I wanted a Fajita Burrito, I was handed off to the bean / sauteed veggie lady - which soon handed me off to the sour cream / salsa / guacamole / cheese lady and then sent flying down to the cashier / manager.  Picture Subway, but frantic with alot of hollering in thick Hispanic accents.  Trying to order a glass bottle drink with the manager resulted in a similar experience. "What kind of juice drinks do you have?" drew a response that contained a lot of fruit rattled off very quickly. 

After paying for lunch for me and the wifey (which also left her a bit shaken), we hit the proverbial lunch lottery by  scoring an open table.  We sat down and enjoyed our lunch and compared it favorably to Baja Fresh. 

Fast food places will never / and should never get 5 stars as 5 stars are meant for establishments that deserve such accolades.  But without question, Chipotle deserves 4 stars as the food is quite possibly the finest fast food I've experienced.  Regrettably, Chipotle loses merit due to the fact that our experience was tainted by the stress of placing the order - as well as the fact that lunch was almost $18. $18 for a burrito, a burrito bowl and ONE drink is about $5 too much.
author: Dennis Y.

description:
OK, why 4 stars? Because, I believe there is crack in their rice. Chipotle is a McDonald's franchise, so what do you expect? I think the secret is extra salt, butter, and a little sprinkle of crack in everything.  Unlike real crack cocaine, however, it's not euphorically good the first time, but it's more of an acquired addiction...more like nicotene.  

This is NOT authentic Mexican food and therefore doesn't do very well in places like SF, but this chain does fantastically well in other boony areas, but not so boony that there are no Mexican restaurants... like the Midwest. 

Anyway, I confess, I like it, but I could live without it.  I used to live in an apartment right above one, so it found its way into my diet as a staple food, but no longer.  

Pros: huge burritos, tender chicken, buttery-lime rice, and did i say crack?
author: Audacity L.

description:
I love their carnitas burrito bowl. The meat is moist, salty, savory and mix with their corn salsa and spicy salsa.....hmm,hmm,hmm. 
I have to say though, sometimes they don't give enough rice/meats..you literaly have to ask them to put more things since you're paying almost $8...hence the 3 star.
author: Levy O.

description:
Eat this-- chicken burrito bowl! Choose your toppings and you've got a delicious and healthy lunch. 

I like mine with pinto beans, rice, lettuce, medium salsa (corn salsa), pico de gallo (fresh tomato salsa) and sour cream. Top it off with a splash of tobasco sauce. YUM!
author: Gerard B.

description: McDonald's listens to the consumer, builds something completely antithetical to their business.... and apparently built the leader in forward thinking, ethical, health oriented quick food.  Check it out... one of the only chains that offers farm to table stories, as well as caloric contents, and more.  They are really doing good in a nebulous and nefarious business.  Thanks for the transparency, dedication to doing good, and helping us with more information on how to eat, and watch our diets!
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
3 and a half stars. Sometimes a 4.

Yet another review on a chain shop, yeah well, I can't help that these chains are all over the place. Anyway, I really like the burrito bol! What a great idea! I've had the chicken, steak and pork and they're all pretty tasty. If you're a low spicy tolerance person then this may not be the place for you. It's not super hot but when you do finish eating your meal there is a bit of a low grade heat going on your tongue.

I'm a fan of the tortilla chip and they have a tasty one but more often than not there's too much salt. Way too much. It's like eating a salt lick. So I had to just finally stop ordering them because I was wasting my hard earned buck and some change.
author: cyndi L.

description:
Chipotle burrito's are like crack cocaine to me.  I know it's not real Mexican food, and if I ever want a real Mexican burrito, I am not going to Chipotle.

It falls in like this weird grey area.  If you can get over that, then I think you can enjoy their food.  I would never compare this to a taqueria.  Instead I think you gotta compare it to a commercialized fast food place.  Then I think it ranks pretty high.
author: Bobby J.

description: This place is my restaurant. I love anything where it required the least amount of work like a bowl, and a spoon so, simple. The food is consistant day after day. Not much else I can say. I get the Chicken bowl w/ rice, medium, cheese, guacamole, and chips. I might switch it up to steak if I'm in a good mood.
author: Nathan M.

description:
Thanks, Chipotle, for being the McDonald's of Mexican food!  Tried a burrito to see what all the hype was about and realized there's white rice in it.  Yuck!  Is this an Asian burrito?!  What happened to Spanish rice?

The only reprieve this place offers is the beer.  Without the cerveza, this place is completely worthless.  I only eat here if coworkers outvote me for the lunch venue or if I'm desperate for food and absolutely cannot walk another block.
author: Jenny K.

description:
If you like grilled chicken burritos with good hot sauce - this is the place.
Delicious
author: Matt N.

description:
You can definitely tell this place is owned by McDonald's - super slick, super pricey for what it is and super bland and generic food. Their vegetarian options suck compared to other taquerias in the city.

The only reason you eat here is because its close to work and you need something filling fast...
author: Quartknee K.

description: I like Chipotle overall, and this chipotle is pretty good, they're definitely fast, especially during lunch rush when they get so crowded!
author: Patricia Z.

description:
I work at Moscone Center once in a while and today I thought I'd take the short walk to Chipolte. 5 mins away from Moscone North makes this a good choice. It was very early (11am) so there was not the usual line out the door. 
There were maybe 6 patrons therre at that time and no one else in line. The lovely women  behind the counter are very relaxed and all smiles. My chicken burrito was dressed with salsa, hot sauce, lettuce, cheese, pintos, guac and sour cream. Fresh and fully packed! 
One of the reasons I come here is for the lime flavored chips. They are worth the extra buck. 
Good, fast, cheap. Usually you can only get two of these parameters together. 
That's showbiz!
m
author: Mark B.

description:
Chipotle.  At first glance, it looks like 
a really really good mexican joint! 
Why are there so many people?  
I know it's lunch time but wow, the
line is so long.  It must be a really
really good mexican joint!
only not.
It's right next to my school and it's
the only thing that I can gorge in a
15 minute window during class.  
There's about 30 people working to
guarantee a fast 'making your burrito'
process.   I eat here a lot, I admit.  But
I just never feel good after.  I feel warm
inside but not the good warm.  I get 
the burrito with "Carne Asada" *rolls tongue*.
Or the 4 hard tacos with the 4 different
kinds of meat in each one.  smart right? =P
They got Barbacoa (never knew existed until
this place) Carne Asada *rolls...yeah you get
the point.  Chicken and ......damn I forgot 
the last one.  But my point is - they serve it
fresh and fast but it doesn't seem like a
real burrito.  The tacos are ok but it just doesn't
hit the spot.  ya feel?
author: Jonathan P.

description: Thanks for dumping an entire ladleful of hot salsa on my burrito so I wasn't able to taste it.
author: Adam Z.

description:
what can i say? imma huge fan of fake mexican food...and thats a wrap.

burrito bowl or burrito: 

grilled chicken
little rice
extra corn
extra medium salsa
little sour cream
YES guacamole please! and i dont care if there is an extra charge for it (they always have to remind you of it, dont they?) 

chips + guacamole on the side...

and last but not least...margaritas, cheap, tasty and get straight to the point...

the green Tabasco sauce they have is the bombayder!

im always thirsty for water for the next five days after i eat this..

its like they inject 5 pounds of salt into my body, dang it!

but that doesnt stop me...never
author: SammyWammy S.

description:
this isn't a rating on their food (which is great), but on their online ordering and customer service - which is extremely poor. 

our company ordered us lunch online and when my salad order arrived, it was sans dressing and the amount of lettuce was poor (i asked for extra and shaved lettuce on top). honestly, i was kind of worried about all this when i placed the online order, but this just confirmed for me that they don't really read them, just rush through to push them out. 

i was pretty upset when i had to walk back because i had to leave the company lunch and it ate up 30 minutes of my day. the manager was ok to deal with and had the order corrected. while i was waiting, the guy next to me said "what's taking so long back there? i've been waiting forever for my order." i responded by saying "i know. i had to come back because my order wasn't right. i'm never ordering online again." to which the large woman at the register AGGRESSIVELY told me "ma'am, do not bad mouth to other customers about our restaurant." WHAT?! excuse me? you guys messed up my order and i'm not allowed to share my experience with other customers? that's how you talk to a pissed off customer?? screw you. that is just the most ridiculous thing i've ever heard. you can play lioness to your precious chipotle all day, but welcome to the real world of making mistakes, lady - people ARE going to talk about it. 

one last thing to that nasty woman behind the cash register - now instead of simply "bad mouthing your restaurant" to one person at your location, i'm bad mouthing you to everyone on yelp. this would never have made it to yelp if you hadn't handled the situation so poorly. way to go lady, you win.
author: jessica h.

description:
as an academy student there are times where i crave a burrito, kinda like heroin addicts to the needle and just gotta get my fix. since this is the only thing near by- itll do, and it does it nicely! the barbacoa is super delicious and i enjoy the salsas! 
you're not gonna find ground breaking food here, but it does the job!
author: Elliott G.

description: I really love the tastleness of this wannabe mexican hybrid platter designed for the suits.
author: Tosh J.

description: I don't normally eat at places that make the food in an assembly line.  The people working here were yelling at me.  Step off!  But my burrito bowl (no tortilla) is the only meal I will need to eat ALL day.  Shiiiiiiiit, still full!
author: Vanessa Z.

description: I am not a fan of chain restaurants and assembly line food prep.  But I've got to give them credit for their delicious barbacoa.  Really delicious and if I didn't know any better, I would have thought it was homemade.  Not a fan of their chicken...to rubbery and no flavor.
author: Adrian N.

description: Decent burrito.  I like how their veggie burrito actually has some vegetables in it.  At some places the veggie burrito just means that it has no meat.  Not here.  I don't like the rice though, it has herbs in it that don't really go along with the mexicanness of a burrito.  The corn salsa is yummy too.  They really have the whole assembly line thing down too - the line goes really fast, which is good for lunch in the Fidi.
author: Michelle L.

description: I wasn't sure if the Mexican place afew blocks over was open *as they cater to lunch business men during business hours and it was a saturday* it was pouring rain and in an attempt to escape to a warm place and find something filling i decided to try Chipotle. I hadn't been here in years, some things were different but basicly still the same. They have brown or white rice now but the brown rice was really still white. They charge $2 more for gaucamole...ridiculous. The burrito was already more expensive than the authentic ones 3blocks away before i added it. They work faster though, but really not worth it. It was still good but the chicken was overcooked and i'm pretty sure they add alot of sugar to their corn. It's definetly not Mexican, but for like an average burrito it's not that bad. More overpriced than the authentic Tacquerias on mission, i'd just go there. This place is always hella crowded with AAU students but on a saturday around 3pm there was barely anyone.
author: Brittainie B.

description: This used to be the only fast food I'd eat, but Chipotle in general and this location in particular seems to have gone down hill.  Today the chips were stale and the rice was clumpy.  I know, an under $10 lunch (that's edible) in the financial is hard to find but really, if the rice is clumpy, you know there's bigger problems going on here.  Or maybe Chipotle and I have just grown apart...
author: Kiki R.

description: OMG!  Usually the thought of pork anything is so gross, bacon....eeeewwwwwww!!!!  But I love the carnetas burrito here.  So good!  But no sour cream....eeeeewwwwwwww!!!!
author: Samantha R.

description: By far, the worst burrito I've had in a long time. The chicken burrito I ordered was disgusting - one quater of it was just this nasty rice type thing and the rest of it -- well just even more nastiness. McDonalds continues their tradition of terrible food with their entry into the Mexican market. If you do get suckered into eating here, stick with the chips and salsa.
author: Neil K.

description: This Chipotle is great if you want to watch some prime art school drama. Mmm the sweet smell of 18 year old delusion. The food isn't good, though but I think it's worthwhile noting that Chipotle uses good ingredients in their food: http://www.chipotle.com/#flash/fwi_fare and that they have an adorable slide show of all the dogs that hang out in Chipotle headquarters: http://www.chipotle.com/#flash/work_dogs
author: Maria D.

description:
who knew that a burrito would save my life?

well, maybe i'm exaggerating.  but...my feet were killing me after walking all day in 4 inch heels.   

i was starving round 9pm but i was too tired to go anywhere fancy so i turned round the corner on mission and new montgomery and presto! down a couple blocks was a brightly lit chipotle.  each painful step brought me closer to salvation.  ok, instant gratification, close enough.

vegetarian burrito pls with red beans.  yes, i know the red beans aren't vegetarian. i still want it.  peppers, rice, salad, guac, sour cream, and salsa.  hmmm.....drink? blackberry izze pls!  

the place was packed with art students looking for a cheap meal.  a couple of cute guys checked me out.  i felt flattered and at the same time a little cougarish - yowsers! am i in that c-box already?  

sitting down made my throbbing tootsies happy.  the filling burrito made my tummy happy.  looks from hot young guys to remind me that maaaybe i still got "it"? priceless.
author: Anh V.

description: Nothing wrong with a corporate burrito every now and again. Reasonable price and you know what you are getting - no surprises here. One dig, they need to stay open later...
author: Todd E.

description: Admitting that you like Chipotle is like admitting you like Britney Spears, but what can I say?  Sometimes it's exactly what I'm looking for.  While I wouldn't call it "authentic" Mexican food, it is a good American-ized version.  My favorite is the carnitas burrito bowl (light on the rice, heavier on the cheese).  It's fast, convenient and filling without making you feel like you have eaten fast food.
author: Ixchel F.

description: I am ready to pay $8.20 for big ass chicken Burrito with Guacamole, Beans and extra sour cream,but I am not ready to pay $8.20 for a cold Burrito that seat on the window to be wrape becuase they do not have the right amount of employees on a busy Saturday night - hi wake up- it the weekend many family and people are visiting the city - common schedule more employess to serve the customers! Three starts- the place is clean and the food is also very yummy just cold.
author: James A.

description: They get one star for the chips being good and a bit salty - with a nice little dose of coarse sea salt (or perhaps Kosher salt?), and another for the manager's good turn I'd witnessed yesterday:  a customer had placed her order, and didn't realize that she'd forgotten her wallet until she was more than halfway through the line.  When she asked someone to put the burrito aside, so she could get her wallet, and come back to pay for it - an employee must've mentioned what happened - because the manager offered the customer her burrito "on the house", and told her not to worry about paying him back.
author: Carly P.

description: This McDonald's owned mexican fiasco is gross... just gross.  Although, I did manage to get drunk one lunch... on accident... off the margaritas there.... none the less, I dont want McSalsa with my McCarne Asada and McFrijoles de la Olla.
author: Bone D.

description: Today me no happy.  :(  My Veggie Burrito Bowl felt like it was a half order.  One small scoop of rice, beans and a few veggies.  Also, everything went so fast my head was spinning so I could not say, hey can you please fill up that bowl?  Alas, I should not be eating there anyway.
author: jeffrey L.

description: Considering the overpriced shops in FiDi, not too bad for what you pay.  $8.50 gets you a good size burrito.  Obviously, you can't compare to the burrito shops in the Mission but still FILLING!
author: Elliot Y.

description: Let's say a) you're starving b) you subsist on a doctor-ordered all-burrito diet and c) you don't have the additional $1.40 to take BART from montgomery to 24th and mission to get a good burrito: by all means, eat at Chipotle.
author: Adam L.

description: I have been to this location too many times to count. I can't really say I'm happy with the design of this store. There is always a line during lunch time and the queue snakes through the front entrance area causing a lot of foot traffic jams. Add this to the fact that the front entrance doors open into the store instead of out, everyone is getting pinched. Wish they would consider a revolving door instead. There is a sufficient amount of seating at this location. If you've never been to a Chipotle, surprised if you haven't, then you can't go wrong with trying their customizable burrito. You just simply point to what you want in your burrito. There are also calorie indicators so you can manage your dietary restrictions. The burrito will be very reasonable in cost - $7-8 in cost. You can go all out and add some chips and guac for about $3 dollars more. Occasionally, you will have a line person who doesn't know what they are doing and will just add brown rice when you ask for white, or add refried instead of black beans. Just be curt with them and say no, they'll start the order over quickly for you.
author: Michael C.

description: They serve only a few items. All variations on rice, meat, and beans. I love the simplicity but only if they can do it right. The meat is cheap, the rice is white and horrible, and the portions aren't filling. In SF, you can do much much better with a $6.00 burrito. If it wasn't for the convenience of the place it would get one star.
author: Eric F.

description:
I am a frequent Chipotle customer, and if there were a platinum level for Chipotle customers I'd be right at the top of the list.  After my experiences for the last couple of months, after giving this spot far too many chances, I have decided never to go this particular Chipotle location again.

Why you may ask?

Compare the burrito you receive here to burritos at other Chipotle locations.  The smallest I have ever seen anywhere else is at least 50% bigger than the burritos at this location of late.  The last straw was when the people working the line balked at giving more than a teaspoon of salsa on a burrito (I'm not kidding).   

They simply do not quite understand the concept of Chipotle-liberalism when it comes to burrito creation.  Go to the Daly City location to see how it's done, or even the one on Market which is far superior.  Plus, the employees here have a serious attitude.  

The second star is merely because this is a Chipotle which is awesomeness.
author: James L.

description:
For fast food, Chipotle does a decent job at commercializing taqueria food. I went recently (for the first time) before going to watch Up with a friend of mine at Westfield. It wasn't the first choice but a very worthy choice nonetheless.

It's very convenient for urban trekkers like me and provided quick and efficient service. The food was served and tended to on the dot and was reasonably priced. The crispy tacos with adobo beef was splendid, with just the right amount of pop. But why the low score? It's not filling and I found myself gnawing on my plush theater chair and wanting to spend an arm and a leg on theater food.

The environment is decent enough, the food was pretty tasty but it's still a fast-food joint. Not matter how good the food tastes, it ultimately means small portions, decent prices and cramped surroundings and rushed delivery and eating. There are better choices for your taste buds and for more money, only come here for cheap prices and a brief stay.
author: Stan H.

description: It's the shit! So damn convinient and right next to school. One burrito has me for the day. Although it gives me stomach disturbances. I give them all 5 stars because once I lost my wallet in the bathroom with almost 200 bucks of cash and my credit cards in it. Yes I know!
