Well it just so happened that I left and went back to class and fortunately someone who worked there found my wallet and didnt take a dime and returned it to me the next day. GREAT samaritans they were! I will never forget that. Only downside to chipotle is that one burrito could hold 1000 calories. Yea i said that right. Beware dieters beware remember this is a mcdonalds franchise!
author: Meks R.

description: I used to like this place before class at GGU.  I liked the corn salsa, the tacos 3 ways, but I didn't like to pay extra for chips and salsa.  Living in the Excelsior, I have lots of good taqueria's to choose from.  But this place just irked me.  I have recently found out that Chipotle is now owned my the dreaded McDonalds Corp!  Now I KNOW I will never eat here again.
author: Michael M.

description: 4 star on the cheap(ish, for inner SOMA/Metreon area), conveniently located, and fast tip.  A good place to grab lunch at Macworld when you don't want to go to Chevy's or Thirsty Bear and need to get in and out quick.  The walk will do you good - gotta take that burrito baby out for a little exercise!  Tasty, reliable, fast, filling.  It's a no-brainer.  Sorry haters, this Coca Cola spinoff has a reliable formula for when there are no opciones mas autentico!
author: Joe B.

description: Lifeless ersatz burritos, prepared without a shred of human feeling by sad, zombified worker units.  How I hate this place!  Back to McDonaldland!  Git!
author: Brian J.

description: Haven't gotten a burrito from here, so I have no right to talk about those ... I got one of the bowls, and I love love loved it. Corn salsa -- yum. Come on, even if you don't like their burritos you have to agree that their chips and guacamole are TO DIE FOR. I dream about it.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I ain't goin lie, I lika da Chipotle. Now some of yew may say, but Joshers, whyest doth dou likest Chipotle? Do yew support big bid'ness, is ye a capitalist? The answers to these and many other questions is si. I buy burritos that are good, and I don't discriminate, and in my experience Chipotle burritos are tasty. 
This particular location has it's ups and downs. 
Pros:
I assume this place gets kind of packed around lunch time, but I always make an effort to show up between 2 and 6 PM and this place is usually mostly barren, aka perfect. There's almost always one or two people in there, so you don't have to feel awkward about overstaying your welcome, but the place is so big there's usually plenty of places to sit. Free refills, and all the plastic silverware and lemon wedges you could want, that's real. 
Cons:
I used to get burritos that were large and filled with love and care. I always try to be as polite as possible because I have this notion in my mind that they'll give me less food or spit in my burrito or something while I'm not looking, which from what I can tell is not true. It really just depends on the person, and most of the people here tend to give out less than packed burritos and unlike most burritos sometimes I won't be utterly full by the end. More than that they don't seem to know how long to grill it, cuz unlike other Chipotles sometimes the tortillas here are kind of hard and chewy.
Overall if you like Chipotle, you may or may not be disappointed, but when I'm jonesing for a Chipotle burrito, I come here and try and get the most out of my soda refills.
author: Josh K.

description:
this is home-base for a lot of AAU students like myself, and its just so convinient to come through and get  a full meal wrapped in foil, special when it comes midterms or finals time, this place keeps us running.

5 stars for the vegetarian burrito.
5 stars for the corn salsa
2 stars for the inconsistency of the burritos
5 stars for Choptle Tabasco
2 stars for chips not coming with the meal

3.8 stars Overall
author: Jeorge J.

description:
Am I the only one who's never had a bad meal at one of these places?  Seriously, I'm not sure there's a more consistently good Mexican place than Chipotle.  I'm always embarrassed, but I'd WAAAYYY rather eat at Chipotle than, say, Chevy's (the ultimate "when good ingredients go bad" restaurant).

My personal favorite:  three soft steak tacos, both mild and medium salsa, add cheese and sour cream.  To die for.
author: Ted C.

description:
by far the best fast food around...... 

if you eat healthy then this is the place to go for the Chicken BOWL. don't forget the spoonful of guacamole.

I can visit this place 3 times a week and look forward to next weeks visit.

keep up the good work guys.....
author: rasaka s.

description:
Their burritos are nothing to write home about...but I still like them. They're a bit heavy in salt.

WARNING: During busy hours, the workers can get sloppy and overcharge you. Four of five people handle your food and can sometimes get your order mixed up with the guy before after you. Just keep an eye out...
author: Jeremy A.

description: OK, fine, for a place owned by McDonald's it FAR exceeds expectations.  The prices are great and I like the burrito salad option (swap tortilla for lettuce, essentially).  It just bothers me that many people (this would include my Midwest-transplant friends) think this is a legitimate burrito place.  I guess it's like people who think McDonald's is a legitimate hamburger place...
author: Tovah S.

description:
first of all, chipotle is NOT OWNED BY MCDONALD'S. mcdonald's used to be majority stakeholder, but no longer after October 13, 2006.

"With the completion of its tax-free swap of class B common stock in Chipotle Mexican Grill, Inc. (NYSE:CMG - News), for its own common stock, McDonald's Corp. has fully divested its investment in Chipotle."
source: http://biz.yahoo.com/bw/061013/20061013005190.html?.v=1

yes i did just quote a yahoo finance article in a yelp review. does that make me uncool? maybe. do i care? no. i go all out for my loved ones, especially loved ones that come in the form of non-authentic-mexican chipotle chicken fajita burritos.
author: Jessica W.

description: A Chipotle burrito is consistantly amazing.  The only downside to this location is the fact that it gets very busy at lunch time, so you would be advised to avoid coming between 12 and 1.
author: Brett J.

description:
its overrated

let me just say that

for the amount of meat and the quality of the food

its over priced

now

that being said

i do like this place

for a few reasons

1. cute male workers with nice strong bodies

2. decent tasting food that is quick to get

3. they offer vanilla coke

and for that i love you

but all those fucking extra charges

some of their bitchy attitudes


please

if ur gonna work their

pretend like you like it

if u dont

quit and find a deskjob and shut the fuck up

X
author: Mateo X.

description: I caught a bite to eat here before heading to the SFMoMA with my friend one evening for the convenience - fast, quick, tasty food. Right? I mean, seriously, when you make the choice to eat at chain establishments you go there because you rely on consistency. Compared to other Chipotle's I've been to (as well as numerous 24-hour taco shops in San Diego), this was probably my most unsatisfactory experience with a burrito joint. The rice and the chicken were oversalted, and let's just say beans did a number on my stomach not long after, and it lasted until the next day.
author: Monica N.

description:
Mad house alert!

Chipotle is a mad house during lunch hours, be prepared for the crowds.

Despite that you will get your food very fast. And it will be much better than a trip to McD's or taco Hell. Burritos are decent for lunch, but I would recommend going for the three soft tacos with Chicken, Mild Salsa, Guacamole and Cheese. Bite size, delicious tacos that will leave you full. Not stuffed like the burritos. Or opt for the burrito bowl!

Nice that they have free refills without having to go back to the insanely busy counter. Seating is limited to lonely counters while you stare out the window onto Minna St. or shared seating at small tables.

Grab your food to go and head to Yurba Buena Gardens!
author: David B.

description: In the Mexican food wasteland that is Northern California, Chiptole is consistent and good.  There is only one in the city & the major drawback is that the stupid place is never freaking open.  Closed on Sundays (no love for the hungover burrito customers), closed on every holiday, closed when it rains...this aspect alone knocks 2 stars off the rating.
author: T D.

description: All Chipotle's are the same really, but this one has the fastest most efficient service I've ever seen in a Chipotle. Try to avoid peak lunch times if you can as the line can easily loop the entire restaurant. Good for small groups.
author: C D.

description: Ridiculously fast, cheap, decent food for my belly.  I've been in and out of there, burrito in hand, in under 90 seconds.  +1 for sheer speed.
author: Kasima T.

description: The women here are beyond friendly and the food is beyond amazing. FOr a first time Chipotle experience I will have to say two thumbs way up!!!
author: Ja l.

description: I have to admit that I was surprised by Chiptole. I wasn't expecting much but the burrito I had had a nice flavor and they didn't skimp on the meat.  Lots of options on how you can get your burrito.  Very crowded at lunch time on a weekday so go before 12 if you want to beat the crowd.
author: Eric G.

description:
This place has very healthy (not greasy)  and delicious mexican-esque food.  What I like about it is that they will customize your order any which way but loose, and the niman ranch carnitas is delicious.  They have beer and margaritas too.  They also take credit cards.

What i don't like is that the line for food here is ridiculous during parts of lunchtime.  They work quickly, but there may not always be seating, and it's like a cattle car because of so many people flying in and out the door and waiting in line.
author: Frank S.

description: Amazing customer service.  Delicious food.  Quick service.  Great atmosphere.  Cool Music.  This place has it all.  I'm here almost every other day and enjoy it every time.
author: Mack D.

description:
sad to say that this chipotle does not live up to the standards of my original chipotle experience in foster city.  where are the bottles of hot sauce?  did the students all smuggle them away in their backpacks?  sad.

my usual order:
-chicken crispy tacos with sour cream, cheese, salsa, and EXTRA lettuce OR
-carnitas burritos with black beans and everything
-root beer (of course - root beer compliments almost everything!)
author: Josie M.

description: This place must be handing out BJs cuz when I walk by on my lunch hour, the line is OUT THE DOOR!! it's like there's no other place in town. Where are we? Walla Walla?
author: Molly E.

description: *sigh* This is my local Chipotle. I love that roasted corn salsa. And the guac. And I know this isn't REAL mexican. But you know what? The orangey red sweet and sour chicken isn't REAL chinese. But you know what else? I like that sweet and sour chicken! And I love Chipotle! I just wish they had more seating at this location.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Imagine the Soup Nazi from Seinfeld.  You have to know exactly what you want or no burrito for you!
author: Brian H.

description: Way Back in the day, not too long ago I use to eat here on occasion,  and then stop after discovering that they are affiliated with Micky D's, but whatever.  Sooo I went back not to long ago and had a Chicken Burrito,  with all the fixings, and I ate it all.  The Next day/ 18hr later, I decided  while sitting on my throne at that it was the worst idea I ever had.  I shall not go back after the torture i went through. Chipotle  I shall never forget.  I do understand that it is hard to find food in this area, but seriously go to Soup Freaks or something else.  Don't play Mexican roulette with your stomach here.
author: adams l.

description: Chipotle is the restaurant that I hate to love.  With so many options in SoMa, I constantly find myself pulled to their salads, cilantro rice, and uber fresh food.   Makes me feel better that they aren't owned by McD's anymore and that the original chef was inspired by taquerias in The Mission.  Granted, it's hard to make the connection because it's so mainstream in flavor, but it's still good stuff.  Avoid the crowd and go just before noon.
author: Maulie D.

description: This is a more Tex than Mex fast food place. I mean, it literally takes them like a minute and half to get a burrito bowl, including my think-time. Time wise it's definitely comparable to McDonald's. It's pretty cheap (6 bucks for the bowl) but the $1.40 guacamole is a bit much.
author: T L.

description: I have one word for you burrito makers: mix.  If I wanted a  bite of rice, I would have gone for Asian food.  If I wanted a bite of meat, I would have gotten a chicken wing.  If I wanted a mouthful of cheese, believe you me, it would not have been grated.  If I wanted a mouthful of hot salsa, I would have ordered chips and scooped it down.  If I wanted a mouthful of sour cream, I would have gone to the store, bought my own tub and eaten it with a spoon.  All of the ingredients are there, and the spices are good, but my burrito was a tubular compliation of various sections that maintained their distance from one another.  A big toss with a spoon would have drastically helped this actually taste like a burrito instead of different food items segregating themselves.  Next time I'll either get the bowl and mix it myself, or kindly suggest they do it for me.
author: ellyk E.

description: It doesn't bother me that McDonald's owns this chain of Mexican food joints and the convenience of Chipolte's downtown location makes this a frequent lunch stop.
author: Philip M.

description:
First of all, take a look at the line on any given day around noon. That should tell you how crappy their food is. It is usually going out the door, or winding back into the seated area of the restaurant. 
I bought some stock in Chipotle (google it! CMG) a few years ago because I was hopelessly addicted to their burritos and I witnessed the feeding frenzy every day to the tune of $9 a pop (this can only be mean good profit). But it took more than the long lines to convince me this place is a winner; I always order the same thing - a chicken burrito with guac, lettuce, and their "corn" salsa. It is salty, I'll admit, but I swear those are some of the best burritos I have ever had. Maybe I'm too easy to please, or I'm nuts. Whatever, I know what I like and I like these burritos. Be warned: I have had the same burrito at other Chipotles in other cities (Washington D.C. and Ontario, CA) and they were not the same. The ingredients were not as fresh. I was actually surprised, but I think it shows that the CMG in SOMA is in a class of it's own.
author: Matt H.

description:
the *one* and probably only thing i would miss about colorado (where i had the misfortune of living for a bit (haha)) would be chipotle.  but, since it expanded, and is now in SF and on the west coast, i don't have that problem! i love this place! i know it's the mcdonald's of mexican but it's sooooooo good.  the separation of ingredients in the burrito did bug for a while, but if you ask, they'll mix it all together as much as you want.  

veggie burrito w/pinto beans (which is not technically vegetarian b/c they use pork in their pinto beans) rice, cheese, sour cream and guac just hits the spot some days.

-1 star b/c it's not the "local mexican hole-in-the-wall" around the corner, and given the choice i'd usually pick the whole in the wall ... but chipotle is still damn good.
author: Alexis W.

description:
ahhhhh....a corporate burrito- and there's a special taste of mediocrity in every bite. ...

unfortunately, due to the great salsa famine of '06, Chipotle has taken up the flag of conservation, and to defend mother gaia's honor, they ration their salsa out only to those willing to pay extra for it (otherwise it's tabasco for you pal!) NO SALSA FOR YOU! (says the burrito nazi)
author: Tim V.

description:
I went to this Chipotle location for the first time today. I have been to a few others in the south bay area and this one was pretty much the same. The line was rather long at 1pm, but it moved quickly (probably took 10 minutes to order and get my food). I got the chicken fajita burrito with guacamole, lettuce, cheese, and pico de gallo. Tasted OK for a chain store burrito..
They managed to STUFF it full with so many ingredients that I was unable to finish it. I guess that kind of makes me feel better about the price, but its still expensive at $9.77 for the burrito and a soda. There were plenty of seats inside and also seating outside, though it was full outside the entire time I was there. Was pleased to see the tables inside being wiped down pretty frequently by employees.. hate eating my food on top of someone else's mess!
author: Jon W.

description: Chipotle is really good. I love their big chubby burritos. My favorite is the chicken with rice and sour cream. Get the salsa with the corn in it, it's very good. The cilantro adds yummyness. A good place for lunch downtown.
author: O K.

description: Chipotle is like the fake mexican burrito. Kind of like the chinese food down the street made my non-chinese people. It's delicious when your hungry and when your craving it, but in the end it's not authentic. I'm not going to lie, it's not disgusting. I love the cilantro rice! i'd eat that by itself actually, and their chips & guac, thats always a fave. I don't eat too much of the Chipotle burritos so i haven't grossed my taste buds out yet, so this place is still good in my list of places to eat.
author: Suzan L.

description: Its owned by McDonalds.  Of course I am going to take the manatee here for dates.  The grilled pollo burrito with no beans is good.  The carne asada is dry.
author: Fatty A.

description: Best burrito in downtown SF.  I wind up craving one of these every now and then.  Just tell them to go easy on the rice.
author: matthew w.

description: If you're looking for a Burrito that's a bit more Americanized than usual, Chipotle does a pretty good job.  (Americanized meaning: white rice with cilantro, not mexican rice, and most of the meat is made in an American fashion, too.)  However, if you've got the time, you should probably do yourself a favor and go to El Farolito in the Mission.
author: Kelvin K.

description: Chipotle's food is decent. I am hooked on the burritto bowl with chicken and black beans. Here is why this place gets 4 instead of 3 stars - the people who work here are so nice! They make my day - very friendly and smiling. I'm from the Midwest and being happy is my natural state. Kudos to the staff for such a consistently positive experience.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
this place is great. its fast, its fresh and you dont spend the rest of the day on the can after eating there like most mexican restaurants.
dont be fooled by the heathly image. a burrito there has over 1100 calories. if your trying to keep the ass in business, go for the burrito bowl.
author: Chris P.

description: Served by an unsupervised trainee. The non-trainees were equally blah. Any questions about the menu were met with blank, vacant stares. If it wasn't for the quality of the mostly organic food, this location merits 1 star.
author: Chris H.

description: I can't vouch for anything except the burritos but I find them to be decent in size and taste. You can't complain when they use "naturally raised" meats. Price point is what you would expect... maybe I'm a jaded person as any normal person would be beside themselves.
author: S L.

description: I have to say, this is not my favorite Chipotle. I went here for the first time a few days ago, as I recently began working close to it.  I am a huge fan of their salad. I get it with black beans, hot salsa, sour cream, corn and sometimes peppers.  Too much sour cream and too much dressing. My greens were swimming and I feel that their dressing here is not nearly as good as my former Chipotle in Woodland Hills, so too much of a not as good thing is not very good. But, their staff is friendly, nice, fast and efficient.
author: Emma B.

description: Love it....Fresh, all organic, make it the way I want it made, lots of choices.....and who would of known it was owned by McDonald's- now you know!
author: Ricquel N.

description: least authentic tasting burrito ever. it tasted like they got the recipe  from mary sue white in alabama. WTF does mary sue white know about mexican.
author: L H.

description: Love the corn in the burritos. Why did I ever think that these burritos weren't up to par? Oh yes, these burritos aren't authentic by any means. Nor are the prices supa cheap (guac is $1.40 extra for crying out loud). But if you are hungry hungry in this South of Market region - go on ahead and treat yourself to a burrito. Oh yes, and they are open late - one of the few cheaper to-go varieties that are left open after the lunch hours have subsided.
author: Judy L.

description: When I went to AAU I frequented this place a lot. I felt like I was eating healthy burritos lol Yea if you want knock off authentic burritos come here.
author: Jessica E.

description: Normally, I would give just 3 stars.  It's not extroardinary spectacular, but I like how they use white rice with cilantro in their burritos.  It brings out the flavor in the meat.  Another thing that would add to that extra star is that they do not go cheap on sour cream.  they use a freaking huge spoon!  and they do not charge extra for that.  How great is that?  Maybe the meat is a little bit dry, but hey, lather extra sour cream and everything tastes right and dandy!!
author: AhLin C.

description: It is a Monday so I will shatter dreams as mine were once shattered with only a pinch of regret. There is sugar in the rice! Yes, that is the big Cheepotoplay's secret. The rice is: rice, cilantro, and lots and lots of white sugar. My friend tolded me!
author: Shannon V.

description: The burrito is ok. I don't see what the big deal with this burrito joint. The only reason i go to this place is when i crave for mexican food and there isnt any other ones around. I guess it is cheaper than 360 degree burrito but its just your regular burrito joint that i believe is owned by Mickey D's. Can someone confirm?
author: Bren L.

description:
The food is ok but it only gets 3 stars after considering price and wait.

The place is okay but it definitely has the feeling of a well run franchise.
author: WP D.

description: I tried the vegetarian burrito for the first time today and I really enjoyed it.  It was full of flavor, filling and oh my God did they make it fast!  I walked to this location on my lunch break and they cranked out my burrito in a matter of minutes.
author: Jenna M.

description: I do not care what anyone else says. I love this place. I love that it is clean, I love the you get what you order. I love that the meat is a higher quality.  I love that lime cilantro rice, YUM!
author: Adrienne G.

description: Why do I eat here several times a month against my better nutritional judgment?  Because it's the most convenient establishment on the planet.  I order and pay online ahead of time while sitting at my desk.  I specify a pick-up time that is convenient for me, and when that time comes I hop over to Chipotle, skip the line that snakes around the block, state my name at the register, and they hand me my veggie burrito bowl wrapped neatly in a paper bag.  No fuss, no questions, literally no wait.  They're consistent, follow my instructions on the order, and they have never messed up a single time.  So while I know that hefty dollops of guac, sour cream, and cheese might not be the most healthy of garnishes, when I'm in a rush and want something cheap and predictably tasty, you know I'm ordering from Chipotle.
author: Anna R.

description: They only do a few things, and they do them well.  First off, LOVE that the meats are non-hormonal, vegetarian-fed (unlike me), non-antibiotic etc.  Secondly, the line during lunch does go out the door, but I've found it moves really quickly.  Their credit card machines are on speed, or something..  The downside of this is, as has been pointed out, poor filling distribution.  Who wants rice on one side and hot salsa on the other?  MAJOR BURRITO FOUL.  I'm knocking one star for that.  Finally, I've gone in towards the end of the day, found the staff super friendly, and my burrito comes out great.
author: Sujit R.

description: Although its not authentic mexican, its good. With 9 bucks you get a drink, a HUGE burrito, and super speedy service. I've never seen a quicker place to get a bite to eat in this city.
author: Shaina P.

description: I finally had my first Chipotle!  It was not disappointing but it was not amazing either.  It's a good lunch option though, I'm excited to have one open closer to my office.
author: Debbie Y.

description:
the ingredients actually aren't bad for a chain. quick service and normalized FiDi proces here as well.

however, they do two things that chains never fail to do: provide a gummy tortilla and make no attempt to roll your burrito into a convenient and compact tube shape, opting instead to just get the whole thing wrapped and out the door, even if it's in more of a giant square.

i'll ask them to re-wrap it should i pay more attention next time.
author: Charles C.

description: These guys are fast. Then again, there aren't that many ingredients to choose from. I had a terrible experience with them back in Vegas a couple years ago and didn't ever go back until recently. The barbacoa is not bad, taste like cheap tasty meat (which it probably is). I had a burrito with Steak and added guacamole. Came out to $7.97 or something. Whoa momma. I hate paying for overpriced Mexican food, but if you crave it... this place beats Baja Fresh... hands down.
author: Wil M.

description: I crave a Chipotle burrito at least once a week. I have found Chipotles across the land all taste the same and thats a great thing cause it tastes great every time, this location is no different. I go with the Grilled Chicken burrito, grilled vegetables, black beans, and the works with hot sauce. This one tends to be big even with no rice so keep her rolled in the tinfoil so you dont have juices running down your shirt at the lunch hour. Enjoy!
author: Michael G.

description:
ok, i have been much maligned for my appreciation of the chipotle burrito.  apparently you can't call yourself a resident of the mission if you suggest that, sometimes, an overstuffed chipotle burrito may actually be more satisfying than an el taqueria taco covered in salsa.  i love el taqueria, but is admitting that you like cilantro in your rice and that the corn salsa is yummy really such a heinous act of sacrilege?  come on, now.  i happen to know someone with quite discriminating tastes who likes corn beef hash FROM THE CAN!  her reputation (and elite status) remain unscathed.  but, fine, if you're going to scorn me because i'll admit what many of us think (that sometimes crappy american fast food tastes good), then so be it. 

i do realize that it's owned by mcdonalds - the joint mcd's/chipotle by the MCI center in DC was my first hint.  i've never made any claims that it is authentic.  and i wouldn't support it as a regular eating habit.  but damn it, a huge steak burrito for $7?  that's a good deal.  and if you'd put the foodie inside of you to bed for a minute, i think you might actually enjoy it.

now, i'm giving the chipotle in SF just 3 stars because there's only one location and it's not open on the weekend.  lame.  normally, it would get 4 and not 5 because, well, it is owned by mcd's.  

so there you have it.  yelp suicide.
author: Jonathan B.

description: Yes, it is McD's of Mexican. But just like you want the fries every once in a while, you want the foil-wrapped burrito. It could be worse, it could be taco bell!
author: The Sock S.

description: For a Mexican chain, Chipotle still manages to serve up fresh Mexican food. The burritos are top notch but so are the tacos (got with the 4 crunchy, and get one of every kind of meat!).
author: Nish N.

description: I don't care that it's a chain but I care that it's not very good, I mean this is about as fast as you can get food when you order it so why are my rice and beans still cold? Gross!!
author: Cathy T.

description:
yes, it's owned by mcdonald's.
yes, it's kind of expensive.
yes, it's not "real" mexican food.

don't get chipotle if you are craving a carne asada burrito with refried beans & mexican rice because that's not what theyre all about.  get chipotle if you want chipotle, they're like their own damn genre of food. burritos at this location are not as big as the ones they serve in southern california. this place is spotless & the employess are fast & nice. plus they serve $3.50 margharitas that will put you on your ass.
author: Lizzy L.

description: This Mexican joint is alright. It's near work but nothing great and not crappy either. I go back to it because all my co-workers love it. Me on the other hand am torn... the food is very non-Mexican authentic but yet very flavorful. I've been there 6 times now and half the time they always screw up my order. I was hungry so i ate the food and was satisfied with it. Go and try it, this place has mixed reviews.
author: Jose S.

description: I am not a fan of chains (Chipotle's master is none other than McDonald's), however Chipotle does a decent job of providing a cool, hip place to grub on some good burritos. I typically get the "Bol" with lettuce as this is the tortilla-less version sans rice. The chips are so-so but the salsa is pretty good. You get moved along assembly-line style as they build your order and you sit down with your food after you pay. The interior is semi-industrial with some great music in the background that can apparently be purchased separately on CD. This is a good place to grab a quick bite if time is an issue.
author: Don O.

description:
This is where I goto satisfy my (regular) burrito cravings! I've tried some other places around the area, but this is the one I always feel like going back to.

My review might be biased since I'm a vegetarian. 

However, their Fajita burritos are excellent. The spicy salsa is actually a bit spicy and the burrito is thick and filling. Perfect for lunch.

This place is fast in service!
author: Rahul A.

description: I was so happy to see these guys come to SF.  I loved this place when I lived in TX.  The menu is limited but what they have is great.  The staff is friendly and your food is prepared quickly - I only wish they had easier parking (but this is San Francisco after all).
author: prior O.

description: The food sucks.  Can I give Chipotle minus stars?  The food is so bad, that after I ate there  I joined bulimia support group.
author: Princess P.

description: the burrito bol is better than the burrito! (a new way to prepackage messiness, so convenient! add extra sour cream and guac if you have a hearty appetite); its too bad they don't supersize the chips and guacamole (satisfyingly salty with a curious kick of zestiness)
author: Hae-Jin K.

description: Great place to hang when you want to pretend you are hanging out in a suburban Kansas City mall.
author: Troy B.

description: I seriously love this place. I don't care if it is a national chain, it is delicious nonetheless. Maybe it isn't 'authentic', but if 'authentic' means I have to go to a taqueria that is a tiny hole in the wall with questionable cleanliness, fuck it! Come here if you want a tasty cheap burrito prepared every time with the same exact consistency as a McDonald's burger.
author: M. W.

description: i know it's vaguely sacreligious to love chipotle when living in a city that has some of the best burritos north of mexico, but i do. now don't get me wrong, i love those other burritos too, but chipotle holds strong in my heart as the best non-traditional-kinda-fake-but-damn-tasty burrito there is. i heart their carnitas, really. and their guac is always superfresh. bonus, the soma location gives student discount if you show your academy of art id (and possibly othe schools too?)
author: lisa w.

description: everytime i go to this freaking place i wonder why i came.  i tried it first back in the burbs and was awfully disappointed by flavorless, dry burritos.  then i tried a chicken salad and it was a similar if not worse experience. criminies.
author: Susan K.

description: Gotta love Chipotle!  Easy to order and you always get your money's worth.
author: Leslie R.

description: i am used to chipotle, being from l.a. and all. it's not a super great burrito, but if you're on new montgomery and you don't want to take the bart to 16th and mission, what are you going to do? i like the burrito bol option, because sometimes i just don't feel like a tortilla.
author: Oleya P.

description: Loved the way the staff sprinkled the lettuce and corn on the counter instead of putting in on my food because she was too busy talking to a coworker.
author: Jake G.

description: Coming from a mexican. the food there make my aunts wana cry. if you want real mexican food theres one on second street a block away from market
author: AJ G.

description: Mickey D's makes some surprisingly good Burritos. I used to eat here 3 times a week when i worked across the street. Hottest Salsa I've had in a long time. Don't mistake it something mild and use where needed. Also, considering it's location its about the only good fast mexican food around which makes it perfect for lunchie.
author: David T.

description: This is my first bad review on Yelp.  I feel a little guilty, but then I saw what Chipotle's Market Cap is.  They're rich, so they can handle one bad review from some dork in SOMA.  BTW, this review applies to ALL Chipotle's.  First complaint, the burritos taste too bland and boring.  There is no "juiciness" or "bursting flavors" or anything that makes it taste good.  The rice is super white, meaning NO FLAVOR.  The salsas look healthy, but lack any kick or substance.  The chips are so damn salty you can see entire salt licks on each chip.  Chipotle's claim to fame is that it mimics the great burritos of San Francisco's Mission District, foil wrapping and all.  Well, since we live in San Francisco, why not just get the real thing?  I mean, we're already here, right?  Don't go to Chipotle, unless you have to go with your boring bland co-workers who rave about Chipotle and how they've been going there since one opened up near their house in Suburbia, USA.  Trust me.
author: Terry L.

description: better than most fast food I've eatten.
author: Michael S.

description: I eat here every week because it's only a half block away and I love burritos. I like the steak marinade, but I wish they had spanish rice and refried beans. The burritos are very filling, but I'd rather have more meat and less rice. Also, what's up with the fat and short shape? Are the tortillas too small or is there just too much rice? Or do they just not know how to roll a burrito? Oh well.. I'll be here again next week.
author: AJ C.

description: Love the veggie burrito. It's not authentic Mexican, but in my case that's a plus. I prefer this version of the burriiitttooo. I do have a problem with this particular location - the music is way too loud and annoying.
author: Victoria A.

description: i'm generally a huge fan of chipotle. by huge i mean "eat it every day until i explode or start speaking spanish fluently for no reason" huge. sadly, this one struck me as a bit off. its like they poured the entire salt shaker into the guacamole and added maybe one or two avacados to offset the salty taste. the carnitas were just as salty. i needed to drink the entire bottle of water with that meal otherwise i would have shriveled up. at least i know i wont get goiters (if the salt has iodine). still 3 stars because i do adore other chipotles and maybe i just came on the day when the salt bandit was screwing with the food.
author: Aly L.

description: Hell yes. I can't believe it's owned by McDonalds. The fajita options are great and the service is quick.. if you are looking for a "better option" to traditional fast food, give it a try. They should include chips for free.
author: David F.

description: Chipotle is amazing.  Having tasted them all, I still think the chicken fajita burrito is the best burrito in town.
author: Adam Z.

description: Average of 3 stars? Not fair for this place.  Chipotle, you remind me of the East Coast and a must have for people who don't like their burrito places clean, reliable, and delicious.
author: Lisa A.

description: i miss this chipotle! they put plenty of rice and meat just the way i like it in my burrito bowl (they just take a scoop and plop it in the bowl or burrito) :) it's really good when you get the freshly cooked meat too. i agree with marco c. that this place beats the heck out of taco bell!
author: Jill Q.
